Reviews.Title: “Superb ownership/management, stiff front-desk Eastern European staff!”
Reviews.Author: manail
Reviews.Content: Overall I would rate this hotel good to above average. And I would stay here again. The pros: 1. Price. 80 quid for a double room with free internet. For the location and hotel standard, the price can't be beat. 2. Owners: warm, hospitable North Indian/Punjabis. Attentive, caring, eager to please. 3. Location: Inverness Terrace is the street next to Queensway, and the hotel is right opposite Hyde Park. Central as central can be, and excellent public transport connections. 4. Rooms: Modern, clean, well-appointed with good daily room service. 5. Building: historic property with grand front lobby/entrance, lovingly maintained and restored (dark woods, old English portraits of royalty, mahogany leather couches, etc) The cons: 1. Hands down, the Eastern European front desk staff. Young, inexperienced, wooden. Not even able to smile back when smiled at. Automaton-like. Barely able to cooperate or service guest requests. Had to be pleaded with, and thanked profusely later - even that didn't bring forth a smile! 2. Rooms are small. Not only in terms of general area to walk around in, but also with very low ceilings. Since the building is a Victorian conversion, one assumes the floors were divided into two. Not for the claustrophobic, as upper floor windows do not even open. Thankfully, the ground floor has some windows that do. 3. Internet is free, but wired. Small inconvenience. However, I must add that I ended up getting a room on the ground floor (#034) which had wireless access. It should be added that emails to management prior to my stay were answered promptly and professionally, and I even received a call at my overseas number to ensure my queries were answered. I was quite grateful for this gesture. Also, I ended up having severe toothache the first night of my stay. The front desk staff responded caringly and amazingly. A young man named Ravi, who deserves special mention, sprinted out around midnight to the nearest pharmacy and brought back painkillers at barely a moment's notice. For this, I couldn't thank him enough. Overall, this was a great experience with initial hiccups during checking. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, and recommend it with the only caveat that front desk staff who check guests in be as warm and cooperative as the night-time staff on call at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bea_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a deluxe double room. Room and bath was clean and nice. Size was not bad for this roomtype. We got a room on the sixth floor. The location is perfect and we got a really good price so absolutely highly reccomended for a few days stay in London!!! Helpful nice staff - lovley rooms in the lobby. A plus is also that we could place our luggage at the hotel after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Ya.. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AdventerousMe
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel! Friendly staff and with right attitude towards the customers. Access to a computer in the hall near the reception that we needed most of the time. modern and clean rooms and bathrooms and lobby with the history.. perfect breakfast.... hmm ! We have found a hotel in london to suit our budget and meet our expetaions !!! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “staff is courteous and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Redband M
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect, quiet but very central and lovely area. The price is fine. For your money you get a good room in a good location in London. The staff is courteous and helpful. The air conditioning, I did not understand but was hot ,we have simply switched off as explained by one of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bernard D
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a one night stay in this charming hotel. The hotel has a very interesting wood panelled foyer and ground floor lounge. We had booked a club room but were upgraded to a luxury suite. The room was spacious and superb with a large four poster bed, immaculately clean and a very comfortable bed. The en suite was huge with a traditional roll top bath and separate shower. There was wine, soft drinks, fruit and chocolate in the room and the whole thing was a complete treat! We enjoyed an excellent cooked english breakfast with plenty of choice. This hotel is in a great location for the Underground as it is very close to Queensway (Central Line) and Bayswater (Circle Line). Kensington Gardens is just across the road and there are many restaurants and bars close by. The staff were very helpful and polite. I know we were lucky to get an upgrade but will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “historic charm and fab location!”
Reviews.Author: suarezlover
Reviews.Content: just returned after 2 nights here, booked through booking.com, superior double room on 5th floor with adequate space, modern bathroom,flatscreen tv, tea/cooffee making facilities..we didn't experience breakfast as we went to Hyde Park over the road and had breakfast there overlooking the Serpentine!. The location is brilliant with 2 tube stations around the corner and lots of bars and restaurants as well. The hotel is very charming and has a warm appeal, the room was on the small side but it wasn't an issue and the staff were all very pleasant and helpful...i am extremely fussy and was worried by some of the reviews on trip advisor but i wouldn't hesitate in coming back here and look forward to doing so in the future. The only negative comment i could make is that our room was looking out onto the road which was a bit noisy at times, but hey it's London not the countryside! Bought all day travel passes on tube for Â£7 each at Queensway station and really made the most of them!

Reviews.Title: “Too hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: SiwSJ
Reviews.Content: We were 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed 3 nights at this hotel in early March 2012. I would guarantee given this hotel top marks if the air conditioning had worked. Unfortunately it did not in any of the two rooms we had. The room my teens lived in was particularly hot. They had an external air conditioning from the reception, which unfortunately did not work more than one night. Going into this hotel room was absolutely excruciating, and teenagers had problems getting to sleep in the room. The second room was slightly better but the air conditioning did not work. It was not very hot outside those days we were there, max 10 degrees Celsius during the day. It was also negative that we had two rooms with 7 floors in between. The hotel has no lift between 7th and 8th floor and as we lived in the 8th floor we had to go up the stairs to our floor. Also very narrow spaces in the hotel. The reception and staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very small, as is common in London, but it was clean and we had daily cleaning and fresh towels. In the lobby there is a guest computer. The hotel has free Wi-fi and a small bar. The breakfast room was very pretty, had a lot of staff who takes care of service. Breakfast costs 15 pounds per person and there was great variety of dishes. Located just 2 minutes from the Queensway tube station. We paid 278 pounds for 3 nights per double room deluxe without breakfast. If the air conditioning had worked, I would recommend this hotel to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: donnajHull
Reviews.Content: I booked the Shaftesbury Hyge Park International hotel for my partners 40th Birthday surprise trip to London. Only booked a few days before the trip direct on the hotels website but when we arrived we were told that there was a problem in some of the rooms with damp and we were being transferred to their sister hotel down the road, the Shaftesbury Grand Royale. When we arrived at the sister hotel we were told that, due to the inconveience we would be given complimentary breakfasts but I actually had already paid for them so this was not the case. This hotel doesn't have some of the things listed at the originally booked hotel, restaurant, gym, room service, iron, ironing board etc and has a poorer trip advisor rating. Not sure if this is a scam or not on the hotels part but felt a bit let down after booking one thing and actually ending up with something else. The hotel itself if seeped in history and the staff were friendly, the breakfast was great but the room we had was so small it crazy. Very difficult to get ready, showered, dressed etc and the bed is smaller than a double. You have to sit on the toilet sideways as there isn't enough room to sit on properly. The view we had from our window was at the back of the hotel and not very nice and the window only stayed open by being jammed with a towel. The hotel is very clean though. We did talk to another couple on our last night who were not happy about the size of their room and demanded something else, they were given the bridal suite which was about 8 times the size of our room and that bathroom was out of this world. All in all a good stay, close to the tube etc but still feel slightly cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Very well planned”
Reviews.Author: Alanvd_78
Reviews.Content: Great attention to detail has been addressed in this hotel. Outstanding bathrooms, huge TV screens and well planned, luxurious fixtures & fittings. Rooms are small , but beautiful, and cleverly planned with free internet in the room. Surprisingly, I received a fruit basket on arrival in our room though we were staying in the standard room. This place offers grace, quality and location at an extraordinary price. I recived what I expected.I will recomend this Hotel highly business travelers rather than family.

Reviews.Title: “We will come again”
Reviews.Author: Bishopsxtc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well placed; quiet, close to Hyde Park. Portobello market on foot, public transport and are close to the hotel itself is beautiful! Amazing contrast between the old and the hotel's small but modern and clean rooms , comfortable bed everything was perfect, including the gentleman with who helped in check in was very attentive and helpful. And thank you to Grand Royale for making my stay comfortable will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price and comfert”
Reviews.Author: Wang Y
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from London and stayed 4 nights at this hotel, because the rebound we had booked was full. It was a success look where you look. Beautiful building, rooms with windows endearing, very good situation with a subway station a block away and plenty of bus lines nearby. Rooms very well equipped, very clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom, clean and nice. The only but is that the room is just in size but you fit well. Reception and cleaning staff good, help always. Highly recommended by price, location, cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Address in London”
Reviews.Author: LilianaB30
Reviews.Content: Great surprise that this hotel, despite differing opinions on this site! 1 minute from Queensway, live on the central line and 1 minute from Hyde Park, location! again, very frequent bus passes for oxford street (even on Sundays!) the hotel is beautiful, but I agree, this is not a 4 stars, 3 stars a very good anyway purely because of room size... our room was very small ... but beautiful! raised bed, large pillows, flat screen, dinette for tea ... and thick carpet! a real cozy spot with lovely curtains to block the air from the window :) bathroom was small but ultra clean! bath addition, all brand new! staff is a professional and welcoming ... they have facility to keep your luggage all day when you leave the hotel at noon and take off at night! due to competitive rates and the service, this is our new address in London!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Was Perfect for me!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marks2323
Reviews.Content: I've been staying on business in London every week since September, and I've finally settled on a hotel that offers high quality of furnishings and room comfort. Room extras include complimentary cable broadband access, iron, tea coffee facility in room and 17" flat screen televisions,professional and frindly staff. Clean and comferable room. Grand Royale London Hyde Park has been coming in at a very reasonable price OK, so the rooms aren't all that big - but personally speaking I'd sacrifice room size for quality and comfort any day. All in all, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surely back ...”
Reviews.Author: AffonsoRuiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what I checked the images of the web site. With an excellent location, right next to Hyde Park and two tube stations (Bayswater and Queensway). The room is well equipped, comfortable bed, small bathroom, but very functional. The service and staff very polite and efficient. The english breakfast served is very good. Surely soon be back with more time to enjoy our stay and learn more about the city. Regards... Affonso (Brazil)

Reviews.Title: “8 sq.m rooms in a shabby hotel with a chic lobby”
Reviews.Author: vsinfinity
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located within a 2 minute walk from Bayswater/Queensway underground stations and a 5 minute ride to Paddington. With lots of restaurants (mostly Asian and Lebanese), cafes and food shops in the area, this hotel however has ridiculously small rooms even by London standards. There is literally not enough space for two people to avoid running into each over. No minibar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid lime the Plague”
Reviews.Author: memailer
Reviews.Content: This was a farce. I will never book with www.booking.com again. On arrival to Best Western Shaftesbury, Paddington I was told there was maintenance works, so I had to move to a different hotel, I had no choice. From reading other feedback this it appears this might be a scam where you are sold one hotel and then moved to hotel of lesser standard - or one with a poorer tripadvisor rating. The hotel I was transferred to Grand Royale Hyde Park. It has no restaurant, tiny rooms, no gym, and no room service. On asking for room service I was given a takeaway Pizza menu. Avoid Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington. Avoid Grand Royale Hyde Park. Avoid www.booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Though Rooms are small I Liked the Hotel a lot..”
Reviews.Author: Manfred M
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. The lobby, breakfast room, bar and some other parts of the hotel are beautiful with ornamental carvings, gold paint and old style decor. Very nice. My room wasn't big but it was very comfortable (especially the bed), clean and the barthroom was in good shape. The staff was very helpful and nice. I realised that whenver I went through the lobby they acknowleged it. The only thing they got wrong was when they told me I didnt have wifi in my room. Surprisingly, I did get it in the room and it worked very well. Overall I loved Grand Royale Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Full of atmosphere!!”
Reviews.Author: Catts74
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms for three nights through the central reservation system.We arrived around 11 o'clock in the morning, we could leave our luggage, and after being given the opportunity to see the rooms we had to pay in advance, which was also reported in the booking confirmation. The rooms are certainly quite small, although there is everything.The rooms were quiet and the bathroom was modern although small. Not all accommodations are comfortable but in the same way because there are some ground floor rooms which are very narrow ... The English breakfast was Good. The lobby, the lounges and bar are really beautiful, with ancient painted ceilings, full of atmosphere. The location is fantastic, opposite Hyde Park a short walk from Queensway and Bayswater underground stations. We also go back because the price is great value, with breakfast, and London is very little.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed shoe box”
Reviews.Author: ringsau
Reviews.Content: It is really a shame. This hotel has allot going for it. The staff are friendly. The breakfast is excellent. And they even have free wifi (in the lobby). But the rooms! Immaculately appointed in every sense with stylish bathrooms, designer fitting and flat screen TV's. Too bad they are so microscopic you can't fit in the door. Literally. The room was so small that the double bed could not be walked around. Without exaggeration. It was bounded on 3 sides by walls. It was quite funny that the room had one of those luggage caddies (you know the ones that fold open to put your bag on) but without any space to even open it (except perched on the bed maybe). So while a great location and very stylish, the room size (and the room for this stay was a deluxe room) make this a single night stay place if you are one traveller with a toiletry bag only.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad surprises”
Reviews.Author: Aubergine11
Reviews.Content: 3.5 points would be more accurate. The location is good, as it is near two tube stations, which gives you good access to all of central London. The building too is very interesting and I would love to know more about its history. The staff is friendly and helpful. Now, about the rooms. The way they are advertised is extremely deceptive. I booked a "Deluxe" double, which was meant to be more spacious than a "superior" double. It was in fact the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. You cannot tell from the pictures on the site, but there is hardly any space around the bed. When I complained that this could not be a "deluxe" room, they said that in fact I had been upgraded to a "club" room that was even larger! Indeed as I saw in the fire escape plan behind the door, my room seemed to be among the largest. I sincerely fail to see how smaller rooms could fit beds in them (let alone luxuries such as space for your luggage!). Similarly, the bathroom was really tiny. You could only be in the shower or on the loo (sideways), no other space. So my first impression was very negative, as I feel that the representation of the rooms is not done in good faith. Having said all that, my stay was not, in the end, too bad, as the bed was actually very comfortable (other than the rock hard pillow--described as "fluffy" on the site), the room was very clean and the breakfast was excellent. I would not stay here again, as I take issue with the dishonest adverting of the hotel amenities, but otherwise I was quite pleased with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: 171SWAMPC171
Reviews.Content: The entrance is huge, good siting area in the lobby. nice and clean room ,quite small but considering the standart of Londons hotels, this one was very good value for the money that we paid. we stayed for five nights. Air conditioning was great and the bathroom also, there was also a fridge in the room which was great as we have been given the club room. Breakfest was nice. But generally we can recommend this hotel to everyone who appreciate great location and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith c
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was very good, room were alean,the reception staff who receive a friendly and approachable. In fact, the room had a small cafeteria (on coffee, chocolate and tea) included in the room that brightens up the awakening or the time you spend on it. As for location, the hotel is next to the Queensway tube station and bus stop, making the connection to central London is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull place”
Reviews.Author: Mario J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. It is also very beautiful inside, because it was built more than 200 years and has a history. The rooms are very well decorated, but some things do demonstrate flaws: It has no mini-bar, although in some sites stating the existence of mini-bar, there is the space of only mini-bar, but clean and comfertable rooms. nice and friendly staff with the right attitude throughout, Without any further explanation, the breakfast costs just 15 pounds, value for ransom, near what is charged in hotels of location. Moreover, the hotel is very good.Will love to come back and highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid”
Reviews.Author: Marina W
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I was only staying one night and it was a "special" rate. The room was THE smallest room I have ever stayed in. The curtains were broken, as was the door lock. There was no heating - although there appeared to be 3 methods of supplying heat, none were working. The most disturbing thing was that there were spots of blood on one of the towels - perhaps it was cleaned and came back that way... perhaps not. I am not a difficult customer, honestly - I just want the basics right. I was asked to pay for the room up front, never had to do that before - I usually expect to receive a service before paying for it. I can't remember ever having to pay for a hotel room before actually staying in it. The reception staff were pleasant, so when they asked how my stay was while I was leaving I didn't take it out on them. But for the first time ever I filled in one of those hotel room surveys and left that with them.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, some wonderful rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay for my wife and I. The downstairs part of the hotel is absolutely beautiful. However when we got to our room, although very well decorated, clean etc it was really small - ie you could only half open the wardrobe and could hardly squeeze past the bottom of the bed. As we had got the rooms at a good discount we really didn't mind, except we couldn't open the window at all and it became very hot and stuffy. The airconditioning was working, and I reset it several times, but it was very hard to sleep. I rang downstairs to see if we could change rooms (about 1130pm) but was told not possible. However the next morning I spoke to the manager (I think) who was completely sympathetic, told one of his staff to show us a selection of three other rooms to choose from, the first of which you could fully open the window and was superb. They moved us straight away. The next morning we realised we had lost Bagpuss...my wifes toy cat, and figured it must still be in our last room. Housekeeping couldn't find it however, but the manager made a personal search and after half an hour bought Bagpuss to us himself. We would definately stay here again. Important to realise its a listed building and the rooms are all different. Our first room may well have been very cosy for some people. Also I think all the staff take their lead from the manager, they were all very sincerley helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SamWilcox-Diedericks
Reviews.Content: I have once again stayed at this hotel that has now become my base in London. The location is great for anything in W1 or W2. It is close to the Queensway and Bayswater Tube station as well as on a well serviced bus route. It is 20m away from Hyde Park. If you are looking for a hotel for a weekend break, or longer, or need a business hotel - this will suit your needs. This is a well priced hotel and the service levels are very good. I will continue staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: JMH1953
Reviews.Content: I had booked into this hotel for an overnight stay as it was my birthday, the rooms are very small and compact, all staff were either asian or european, therefore trying to hold conversations with them were very hard. Although the rooms were trying to be boutique hotel style the workmanship was very poor. The heating/Air conditioning was very noisy, so little sleep was had. The pictures on the website looked very grand, but indeed this was not the case, the lovely period reception rooms downstairs were freezing cold, they could have done with lighting the open fire which was a lovely period feature, alas this was not to be. The bar well if you could call it a bar had limited drinks on offer the barman seemed not bothered at all and it was very expensive even for london Â£15 for 1 gin and tonic and 1 whisky and coke...needless to say I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suprise for a lonely traveller”
Reviews.Author: Sooty242
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 14th Feb 2012 as a lone female traveller for 3 nights in what I thought might be an ok base for a visit to London. Was met by friendly and helpful staff in a beautiful setting. Was booked into a single room on the eighth floor which couldn't have been any cosier, cleaner or more welcoming. Bar area and lounge were gorgeous. Have already recommended this hotel to familly, friends and anyone who wants to travel to London by themselves as an ideal base

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise, manager kept his word”
Reviews.Author: Lynda O
Reviews.Content: Thank you Paulo Goncalves, we had a great experience and you deserve to receive honest feedback of our experience. We stayed for two nights back in July 2011 and I must admit chose the hotel for location and price but was really worried after reading all the negative comments on trip advisor. I emailed Paulo Goncalves obtaining his email address from this site and advised we were thinking of staying but were worried about some of concerns expressed by other travellers and could he ensure a quiet room and that we would not be moved. He replied that same day which was impressive and he also stated â€œI will be glad to fulfil your request of a nice room in a quite area of the Hotelâ€�. He also assured us we would not be moved. We were due to stay five nights but had to depart to the next leg of our journey earlier than expected and now know we would have been most comfortable for the full five days which is great to know for future reference. The location and huge area adjacent to check in where there are ample complimentary papers is really nice, big leather couches and has a nice historical feel. We did not eat at the hotel and think that perhaps the room at the back where you can have afternoon drinks should be opened up to adjoin the huge area adjacent to the check (where the papers and computers are) as this room is just beautiful and has so much potential. I would love to have been able to have order a coffee to have here whilst I was reading the paper in this room. The location really is a highlight and two days was definitely not long enough. One day we hope to be back over the other side of the world and would definitely stay at this hotel again. Thank you. The staff were friendly and our room was great it was a good enough size, nice and bright and airy and was on the 6th floor, room 605. You did not disappoint so thank you very much Lynda Oâ€™Hanlon

Reviews.Title: “3 nights stay February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Angela K
Reviews.Content: + when we arrived they gave us a really small room on the 1st floor looking back to a narrow space, facing the other rooms windows. I immediately called the reception and they changed our room, upgrading us to a superior room on the 6th floor, then they also send us some fruit. That did us really a very good impression. -However the room wasn't quite clear, the tap of the wc was dirty, the sheets were dirty and never changed during our 3 nights stay and the towels in the bathroom had some yellow stains on it....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Marino_c507
Reviews.Content: great surprise that this hotel, despite differing opinions on this site! 1 minute from queensway, live on the central line and 1 minute from Hyde Park, location! again, very frequent bus passes for oxford street (even on Sundays!) the hotel is beautiful, but I agree, this is not the best but very good anyway ... our room was very small ... but beautiful! flat screen, tea coffee making facility... and thick carpet! a real cozy spot with lovely curtains .. staff is a good and friendly specially Alex the porter ... you can keep your luggage all day when you leave the hotel at noon and take off at night! Great Value for money.. Highly recomonded

Reviews.Title: “GOOD vALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Ashley M
Reviews.Content: Price quality is good. Nice hotel in good location within walking distance of Hyde Park and underground station. Nice area with many restaurants and bars. Hotel room / bathroom are small, but equipped with all conveniences and comfort. staff is Friendly and helpfull. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a London weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Sinag
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and good hotel weekend rates from booking.com. Primary reasons: think of this as a boutique hotel, loved the location, accessibility by public transport via Circle, District and Central Line, quintessentially British, near Bayswater/Queensway Tube Station, lots of shops around, near the Catholic Church on Queensway, near Hyde Park The single bedroom was tiny but I loved it. Very clean. Pretty and perfect for a solo weekend in London! Could be better: breakfast could have been more exciting :0). Sure there are hot English breakfast options, charcuterie, cheese, fruits and yoghurt but I would be more interested if you have the option to ask for omelette, other cooked eggs... Perks: lots of shops nearby for food, groceries and you have Whiteleys shopping centre for nice restaurants and the cinema, free wifi and the airport shuttle pickup from hotel was great if you don't want to drag all that weekend shopping through the London Tube or Heathrow Express! Shuttle picked up other passengers in other hotels but that didn't matter. I at least didn't have to carry a heavy luggage back to the airport :0), your one Tube line away from the Westland Shopping Centre in Shepherds Bush Central Line stop. Excellent for all that UK shopping!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: louise m
Reviews.Content: A suberbly located hotel, next to Hyde Park and the central line tube. The room was fairly small, but spotlessly clean and well-equipped. The room appeared newly decorated and had everything we needed. We had booked a club room and enjoyed all the extra treats! The staff were super friendly and couldn't have done more to help us. Breakfast was delicious. The communal areas are absolutely stunning - all very grand. All in all, the best hotel I've stayed in in London - well worth booking, especially if you can, like we did, get a late booking offer.

Reviews.Title: “London Style Without the London Price”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a budget trip over Valentines day. It gave you the feel that you were staying in a nice hotel as soon as you walked in & not a run of the mill city travel lodge. The entrance & reception has a grand look about it where you are greeted by very friendly staff.The room itself was smallish for a double but spotlessly clean, comfortable & cosy. The Bathroom was also small but clean & modern with a very good shower. The room came with all the amenities stated & all worked perfectly well. The buffet Breakfast was also very good.The hotel is about a minutes walk from the nearest tube station and just over the road from Hyde park/Kensington Gardens. I would highly reccomend this hotel, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand!”
Reviews.Author: m_shazad84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and I'm glad it wasn't any longer. The room was tiny,stuffy and cramped. The window cannot be opened and the air-con is rubbish therefore it was like a sauna at night. Noticed late in the evening the duvet sheet had tea stains and the bin had not been emptied from previous occupants. I called reception three times and received no answer or call back. Hotel is 10mins from oxford circus via underground. Shops nearby including a sainsbury and restaurants. Overall was not impressed with this hotel and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I sort of liked it!”
Reviews.Author: ClareBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave very good value for money, (except for Â£4 for a small bottle of Becks!) It was suberbly situated, just a stones throw from Marble Arch and on The Bayswater Road. The lobby area is huge and gives a feeling of grandure and class. The staff are helpful and attentive. What lets it down are the impossibly tiny en suites. The shower is so small you can hardly raise your arms to wash your hair and the shower curtain - yes curtain - sucks inwards and wraps around you. The toilet is about a centimetre from the wall and so forces you to sit at a right angle - and I'm not fat. The wash basin is mini cloakroom size. Also the bed was a bit too firm for my liking. I won't talk about the brick wall and steam outlet outside the window because, hey, this is London! I did enjoy the trip but was very glad to get home for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Best”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel last year with my family. I find this hotel very reasonable. Rooms and room services are excellent. There king size restaurant is truly amazing! Its well connected by transport. I find free internet access in mu room, print and fax facilities are also available here. Reception opens 24 hour. I felt that i have not wastage my valuable money anymore.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: ingrid999187069
Reviews.Content: a good value hotel with lots of character, was once the home of lily langtry, a must for history buffs, the staff are very nice and helpfull, a lot has been said about the size of the rooms being to small, come on you only need a decent place to rest your head at night, the rooms have every thing you need, large tvs, comfy beds , air con loverly clean bathrooms , tea and coffee making making facilities hairdryers,what more does one need for a good hotel stay whilst in holiday. ive visited a few hotels in london,and for the price you pay,this was far the best ive stayed in,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the business travellers, I am sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: ambjuk
Reviews.Content: I've been staying on business in London every week since 2 years, and I've finally settled on a hotel that offers high quality of furnishings and room comfort. Room extras include complimentary cable broadband access, steam iron, fridge and a flat screen televisions. The Grand Royale London Hyde Park has been coming in at a very reasonable price, most importantly the staff is friendly, helpful and courteous. I am sure, I will be back again and again in all my future business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not large, but well equipped. Everything is new and clean. The staff is attentive and friendly. Ideal for people who want to relax (the bed was big enough size and very comfortable) and visit the center of London. Very close to Notting Hill. It also has the metro linias yellow, green and red (central and circle line). Very well located. Also in the back street there are plenty of restaurants to eat that close late. Next to Hyde Park. The price is good value for the quality. would love to visit again and recomend it to the family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ALBERTO G
Reviews.Content: Very welcome. Staff very helpful and courteous. Decent breakfast. This hotel is very well located and very central with respect to what can be visited. and most important Value for money..

Reviews.Title: “great location : p”
Reviews.Author: jane t
Reviews.Content: we had a pleasant stay here for a good price.staff was friendly and polite. breakfast wasfine. perfect location in central london closeto tube station and hyde park. the room was compact but was comfortable and clean. would love to come back

Reviews.Title: “perfect is the only word”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: perfect location, close to 2 metrostation, friendly service and clean and nice for the price, polite and helpfull staff..what else you expect in london?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: Madisson L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well maintained. I was told that it was an old property but it was well kept and the staff was very helpful. Loved the ambiance and the overall fell when you enter the hotel is amazing. The rooms are fairly sized and if asked for the reception can change the room. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “My cold night with the smallest window I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Caroline S
Reviews.Content: Feb 2012, booked on Late Rooms and was told saved Â£366, no way, hotel is a barely 3 star. Staff are lovely. We had an upgraded room , and room and bathroom were tiny. Terrible draught from tiniest room window I have ever seen. I had to sleep in my winter coat. Bed was comfortable. Towels were rough. I think the hotel is suited to young people who don't want to spend much and are happy if things aren't perfect. No it is not normal to have a small room like this in London

Reviews.Title: “Week in hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlemissmuppet38
Reviews.Content: Hi,Stayed at this hotel for a week while on Business. Found it very clean, hospitable with friendly staff....Rooms tend to be on small side but can't fault them for cleanliness/comfort....Would definitely stay again @ this hotel. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that but you're only 1 minute walk from Queensway central line and the Queensway high street so plenty of options open for coffee/breakfast/meals.....

Reviews.Title: “Bed-Bugs”
Reviews.Author: andriCyprus
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for one night Unfortunately, we realized that our room had been infested with beg bugs. For the unaware, bites show up 5-9 days later and are kind of like mosquito bites (though there are many, many more of them). We were covered in them. It is an incredibly unpleasant experience and we are living in fear of having transported them from the hotel into our home. When we explained this to the hotel, they informed us that we were the only complaint, but we thought it reasonable to warn future guests to be on the lookout.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back!”
Reviews.Author: Michaela D
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor of the old hotel lobby. There is always someone to help you with anything. We did expect having a small room in London, so that wasn't a bad surprise - quite the opposite, I was impressed how such a small room can be designed in such a cozy modern and hip way. Yes, you may hear people walking in the room above you walking, but not a biggie and no sounds from the next door rooms and the place was very quiet itself. The bathroom could use some kind of a ventilation, after 2 people showering it's really fogged and humid. On our departure early in the morning we were told we ha to pay for breakfast we didn't have, but they never found any receipts from the restaurant, so of course they couldn't make us pay for that. Next time I'm in London, I'd definitely stay there again, if I find the similar great price as I had on Booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..will definitely come back in our next visit.”
Reviews.Author: YASMIN S
Reviews.Content: The entrance is a classic building even very ornate baroque so it is, but with style. The service was great. Despite not handle the language fluently, the family got to feel at home. The hotel is found in tripadvisor and after evaluating many options we decided on this one, because of its location. And pleasantly surprised us for the better by being there. Located two minutes walk from Queensway station, one of the entries hydepark, urban bus connections and unso fifteen quiminutos walking along a very pleasant walk to the start of Oxford Street. Returning to the beginning. Room was bit small but enough to stay in a city where virtually all the time you're on the street and just go to sleep. The modern decor, nice flat screen TV free internet connection, very bright and welcoming rooms. Dryer also in the room. A full-length mirror in the bathroom door and a tiny closet to hang the four things that leads one to these trips. The bathroom very modern, beige and all kinds of details. It is small though comfortable and have ease of movement. Everything was very clean during the six days we stayed. Even the towels changed every day. It's worth staying in this hotel because of the incredible value for money and yes polite and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Fraklin J
Reviews.Content: Defiantly come back. As a business person I have tried almost 7 other hotels in the area. This is by far the most reasonable but great service and excellent rooms and free internet facility. Nice, cheerful and friendly staff in the lobby as well as restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Tommys weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: thomas g
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay at this hotel with 3 other couples Location perfect for tube (50 metres) ,Hyde park (50 metres) Hotel lots of history & character excellent staff , full english breakfast or continental (eat as much as you like) everything very clean & tidy

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sel099
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Grand Royale, for business purposes. Following 2 changes to my room (first on ground floor next to main road and another one on 7th floor in which I could barely fit, the final room was comfortable, as was the bathroom. As in any other London hotel don't expect too much space but the decor, cleanliness, free wi-fi and very good breakfast made up for the small environment. The price was extremely good for a London hotel, as was its location, 2 minutes walk from Queensway tube station. The hotel also accepted to hold in their stores several rather bulky boxes which were delivered for us a few days before our arrival - which is always a plus when visiting for business. On the negative side: the attitude of some of the front office people bordered on the arrogant at times - one particular manager was almost rude in his attitude, in the way he talked to clients etc. Same for a particular lady, which almost blamed us for the fact that she almost had no clue as to what she was doing. They were compensated by the great service of Asda (?) as well as the porters, who were also extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delux Room and Breakfast make a good deal”
Reviews.Author: buffalojim67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location less than half a block from Hyde Park and Bayswater Road. It is walking distance to two tube stations and many bus lines so you can get anywhere in town easily. If you book a delux room and include breakfast it makes for a great stay. The room is small but well equipped with flat screen TV and full bathrooms with tub/shower combinations. Breakfast will fill you up and start your day right and the service in the breakfast room is excellent. The hotel offers good value for money and a great location to explore all of London.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: expatinprague
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel and, like most of the other reviews, were generally pleased with the accomodations (certainly good value for the price). Unfortunately, when we returned home, we realized that our room had been infested with beg bugs. It is important to note that the only hotel at which we stayed during our trip was the Grande Royale London Hyde Park so the problem could not be attributed to another property. For the unaware, bites show up 5-9 days later and are kind of like mosquito bites (though there are many, many more of them). We were covered in them. It is an incredibly unpleasant experience (we are now on day 5) and we are living in fear of having transported them from the hotel into our home. When we explained this to the hotel, they informed us that we were the only complaint, but we thought it reasonable to warn future guests to be on the lookout.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap deals!”
Reviews.Author: Neon G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to local transport and the best thing was that we got a cheap deal. Was Â£69.00 for one night. That was truly amazing. Guys at the front desk were very helpful. Would like to mention Nekyl and Astah. They were very helpful and knew the area quite well. Also the bell boys helped us with small queries. Only glitch was that the website said that the room was spacious, which was in reality small, but the reception compensated with complimentary breakfast which was cool. Overall an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: E C
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel. We were upgraded to a suite which was lovely and had an amazing bathroom.The hotel has a lot of charm. It is well situated for the parks and for getting about London. The local area is nice with some good places to eat but needs a bit of research to get beyond the immediate Queensway area into Notting Hill and North Kensington. All the hotel staff were very friendly, especially Anca on reception who was most kind, considerate and very helpful. She made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates, very accessible by local transport”
Reviews.Author: oasisneon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a part of the ancient history and you can feel the difference as soon as you enter the hotel. The hotel entrance is small but the inside reception is huge and it mostly has wooden interior. We had a great feeling while having a couple of drinks in the bar. The rooms although are small, but after requesting reception they gave us nice big room on the 5th or 6th floor, don't remember. All staff including the luggage guys were helpful. The breakfast was filling and we had an overall nice feeling. If you are planning to go to harrods or piccadilly or central part of the london this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights whilst visiting London and we had a great stay! This hotel offers great value for money in a ideal location for visiting all the London attractions. The hotel offers a Stately Home feel in the sitting room and main reception area keeping its original grand house feel. The bedrooms are modern and well presented and the bedroom that we stayed in was a deluxe bedroom. The room had a modern flat screen television and tea & coffee and biscuits was provided in your room, the bathroom was modern but be aware that if you have a late shower in the morning the water was cold so try to have a early shower if you like lots of hot water. The hotel and the rooms were as good as any of the better hotels that we have stayed in. The only fault I could find with this hotel was they did not provided any information in your room in regards to the hotel or local area, also the staff were not over friendly when we checked in and did not have much to say. One thing that may help you if you are arriving at Bayswater Tube Station!, to get to the hotel you need to go up Inverness Place which is opposite the Tube Station and at the end of that road turn right into Inverness Terrace and the hotel is on the right. I hope this review helps you if you are considering booking this Hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Low price point - ok”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the greatest bargains, on the face of it. Â£74 for a 'superior spacious double bedroom'. The rooms, as others have commented, are very compact, somewhat tired, with the tiniest showers possible. The term spacious appears to be spurious. In theory the room is well appointed. In reality the experience is moderate. Positives included: quiet location, grand reception rooms on gnd floor, close to tube star=tions. Negatives: very slow check in, tiny bathrooms that are awkard to use. Having said all this, the experience and price are well matched.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gsebire
Reviews.Content: Across the road from Kensington gardens ,3minute walk from 2 tube stations,helpful staff,great breakfast beautiful lounge and bar more than compensate for the tiny rooms. Why come to this exciting city to sit in your room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Get trading standards in!!”
Reviews.Author: ISOBEL S
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel. Stayed here on New Years Eve 2012. Upon check in the receptionist told us that we should have received a phone call cancelling the booking (this did not happen). They needed to cancel due to maintenance problems with the room. I told the receptionist that I had seen this scam on Tripadvisor and that I wasn't going to be sent to another hotel. The receptionist picked up the phone - spoke in another language and handed me the key. No other words were said. The bed was the hardest that I have ever slept on - like a mortuary slab. Horrible experience - good job in didn't spoil the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: WallyWalters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New Year's Eve and despite arriving early, reception happily took our bags while we went shopping for the afternoon. First impressions were great, the exterior and reception were very grand, as the hotel name suggests. After checking in, we made our way to our room...only it wasn't ours! We were given the wrong room key and walked in on some other innocent guest trying to relax! Reception were very apologetic about this but didn't offer any kind of compensation to us, which I think was necessary after the embarrassment. When we finally got into our room, it was smaller than the other room we saw and was right besides a staff room with staff popping in and out throughout the night. The room was extremely compact and there was very little room to the bathroom entrance. We had to literally squeeze past the bed to get in. Also, the air conditioning didn't work which resulted in a sweltering nights sleep. However, we weren't overly disappointed as we were in London and didn't spend much time in the room. The breakfast was delightful, there was a good selection whether you wanted a full English or something more continental. Queensway tube station was a two minute work which is ideal. Overall, an average hotel in a good location. Suitable if you just want somewhere to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: lauraglasgowx
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Beautifully decorated, including the rooms. Room was nice and clean however not very spacious, but this was not much of a problem. Comfy beds, clean shower and bath, large flat screen tv, tea and coffee making facilities. However, the room got very warm even with the self-adjustable heating off. When we asked for the windows to be opened the staff said that this was not possible due to health and safety, this was the only bad point of our stay. Also, I would advise buying your own bottled water from the local spar (a 2 minute walk round the corner) since the hotel supply small bottles at Â£2.55, much cheaper at a local shop. Staff were very friendly, rooms were nice and simple, and catered to all our needs. Nice hotel and overall I was pleased with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “old but nice”
Reviews.Author: pheonix70
Reviews.Content: Me and My Wife , had spend 4 Nights in this hotel, during Dicember 2011, The Hotel seems like an old style Hotels , but with very nice stairs , loby and Resturant, But the rooms look more modern, the staff was very helpfull, the breakfast was good too , The only thing that I didn't like in this hotel is that the rooms are very small,the smallest that I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, great location”
Reviews.Author: martwald
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in two appaling London hotels on the last two business trips I found this hotel to be well located, with a nice lobby, and a decent room. Yes, as some of the reviews say, it's a bit dated, but I found it good value for the money. I think it possibly deserves 4* relative to a lot of the crap in London, but were it anywhere but London I would give it 3* and so that's what I did give it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the grand entrance and wonderful pictures on their website. Don't use this hotel it put a real dampener on ou”
Reviews.Author: Clairelpettet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly through their website & with many other comparably priced deals at other 4 star hotels, I was immediately impressed with the images & what looked like very high quality accommodation. Talk of Victorian heritage,step back in time, complementary fruit basket, luxury rooms etc. I was sold on all of their promises so booked a superior room for me and my boyfriend. But BE WARNED! The beautiful pictures are completely misleading!!!! The staff were all foreign with very poor English and most were quite rude. I was told I had booked 2 rooms and had to argue about that, then had to pay in full before seeing our room. The room was tiny, I've recently stayed in other 4 stars and premier inns and this was terrible in comparison to even the premier inn. The bathroom was like a wardrobe and the wardrobe was barely big enough to get a couple of coats in. The fittings were badly attached or missing, The duvet was like a handkerchief and the bedspread throw was filthy, it had grt big bits of food and grease on it. In fairness they did change it straight away but this shows a lack of standards expected in a 2 star. On our first morning I spilt a little coffee on the duvet and was pleasantly surprised to see it wasn't there later on, but it turns out they had just turned the duvet round!!!! The room was unbearably hot too even though we threw the windows open and turned off the heating. The only good thing about this hotel is its brilliant location (even though there is a foreigners hostel association across the road) and the breakfasts were really good. DON'T USE THIS HOTEL IT BLIGHTED OUR STAY IN LONDON!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short stay in west London - excellent service - we'll return!”
Reviews.Author: Essex_dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our teenage daughters for a short break. The staff were welcoming and gave really good service. They gave us access to our rooms early so we could drop off our bags before going out for the evening and then looked after them again after we'd checked out so we could go shopping unencumbered by baggage. As other reviews have observed, the rooms are not huge, but we found them to be perfectly adequate and the fittings were good quality - with a good quality large flat screen TV with Freeview digital channels. The rooms were spotlessly clean, with just the right facilities for what we needed. The en-suite shower room and WC were quite stylish - no baths, which was fine. The girls both loved their room and the hotel and said straightaway that they wanted to come back - they thought the reception area and lounge were great. The bed was comfortably firm and the pillows similarly refreshingly supportive. We were fortunate to stay on a half price special offer, which made this hotel outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “Charge you even after you've cancelled well in advance”
Reviews.Author: Glen K
Reviews.Content: Hi all, I can't comment on the hotel stay, nor its cleanliness etc but what I can comment on is its customer service, or lack of should I say. I booked this hotel through booking.com and cancelled due to changes in my travel days before my 24hour cancellation period. Suffice to say that they still went ahead and charged me for two nights until I rang up, made a complaint in which I believe after realising they messed up, promised to revert the funds back to my CC immediately. I have received one of the nights stay back to my card (after a week) although I am still to this date (18 days later) waiting for the second amount to be returned to my CC even after five seperate calls to different people?! If you're going to book with this hotel, make sure you stay with them or cancel weeks, NOT days in advance and perhaps even drop them a line to make sure they've checked all their mail for cancellations as you too may have to deal with an inconvenience. Hotel looks nice, just seems that every good looking est in London is going down hill due to their incompetent staff. Thumbs down to staff.

Reviews.Title: “My mistake...sorted out amazingly.”
Reviews.Author: jjctay
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and my disabled partner. I made the mistake of thinking there was wheelchair access. From the moment the manager realised my mistake he couldn't have been more helpful. He offered to transfer us to a hotel in the chain more suited to our needs - but I wanted that location. He then went out of his way to make that possible and personally took me to view a room he hoped would be suitable. He also said that his staff would help my partner in and out of the hotel whenever needed...which they did. His staff were stars!!! Within minutes of asking, two members of staff where always available to lift my partner and wheelchair down a flight of steps. I didn't meet any member of staff who wasn't polite, cheerful, and willing to help us with anything. If the manager wasn't so intent on caring for his guests the outcome could have been so different. It was after all MY mistake! The lounge, restaurant and bar are amazingly beautiful. Little touches like the fruit and magazines make it very welcoming. Nothing in the room could be faulted. On the occasion I (wrongly!) thought the kettle wasn't working someone was there to check it within minutes. I am just sad that there isn't wheelchair access because I would never knowingly inflict our problems on a hotel. With access we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “No-go.”
Reviews.Author: Leah S
Reviews.Content: This place was a vast disappointment- as we arrived, we were told there had been a 'maintenance' problem and that my boyfriend and I would be only able to have 2 Single bed rooms, or they could take us to another one of their chain hotels. Whether this is true or not I dont know, however I have a degree of skepticism as we didn't pay a deposit. They probably just overbook and dont expect people to turn up. This doesn't however make for a great impression when you arrive and are told you cannot stay in a suitable room. After the receptionist blathered on, she called around and wonderfully was able to find us a room. The grandeur of the foyer gives a very false impression, the rooms are woefully characterless and dull. They attempt a finish that they fail to really obtain, fittings that look vaguely attractive, but you touch and they no only move having been badly attached to the wall but are made of plastic. Thoroughly underwhelming quality and the bathroom was crap- the tiles were falling of, there was a badly fitted shower that had a pathetic discoloured curtain barely containing the deluge. The whole place reeked of a botched job. Even smaller details like having very old, scratchy towels one with a dubious brown stain. For the price of the hotel I got the experience of a travel lodge. And they made you pay on arrival, which I thought was strange, but perhaps they get a lot of dissatisfied customers and do it to stop people negotiating the rate. Overall, very low rating for a '4 Star' hotel. Underwhelmed and quite annoyed to be frank.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small....very small”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: 7.30.am I am lying in one of the hotel beds, very comfortable but knowing that the only way out is to slide to the bottom of the bed as the room is so small that the is barely room at the sides to place your feet! The wardrobe too is small, the hangers have shelves underneath them that means nothing can be hung without being crumpled, not even the smallest jacket/ suit. Not a one off situation either as I booked 3 rooms and 2 of the 3 are like this ! Having said that, the staff are charming and helpful, havn't had my breakfast yet but I am confident that it will be lovely. My advice is not to let my comments stop you staying here but make sure you see your room before, not always practical I know but you risk disappointment otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “OK but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: myview
Reviews.Content: I was moved to this hotel unexpectedly due to a problem with another hotel in the same hotel chain. The Reception staff were much more welcoming and helpful but I found the room very / too small to be that comfortable. It wouldn't be my first choice but it did the job and was OK.

Reviews.Title: “My 1st experience at Grand Royale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aftas Z
Reviews.Content: I wanted to share my experience of staying at the Grand Royale Hotel for two nights. I must say that from the moment of my arrival the staff were at hand to take my luggage, asked me if I wanted any tea or coffee. Very friendly indeed, which ultimately set the good mood for the duration of my stay. I believe someone worth of particular mention is Mr. Gagan (supervisor/manager) who really went the extra mile to make it one the the most pleasant and enjoyable stays for me at a hotel (and I do a lot of travelling throughout the world). I would without reservation recommend this hotel and its staff to anyone who wishes to enjoy a hassle free and relaxing stay in London. Kind regards, Aftas

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Emilie F
Reviews.Content: Although the room was very small, the hotel is beautiful and has a great location. The room was comfy and good to sleep in. Staff was also very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Grand Royale!”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: After just returning from a hectic tour of Europe, staying in the luxurious Grand Royale was just what I needed. A hot bath, uninterrupted sleep in a comfy double bed and delicious Hot English breakfast the next morning...aaah! It was such an elegant hotel with an understated appeal. Prime position next to Hyde Park and central Tube station. And the Hotel Manager, Gagan, was more than helpful. He couldn't do enough for the guests and I personally thanked him for his efforts. He was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ssim065
Reviews.Content: This is definitely NOT a 4 star hotel... But its reasonable for what's available in London. Very small and cramped room - which is to be expected in London, coupled with quite average service really. Apart from that we found it very clean, with a nice bathroom and the perfect location, just a 2 minute walk from the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Dont think 4star”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Royal Hyde Park weekend 26th/27th November ,the photos on website looked great but i'm affraid after the splendid entrance and reception areas the hotel left a bit to be desired.Our double room was small to the point you could not pass each other without having to move to one side ,the bathroom had no shower curtain or glass panel so when you had a shower the floor was wet through .There seemed to have been more attention on fitting as many bedrooms as possible in meaning small rooms and this ment you could hear either bedroom at the side of you running water either toilet or shower and television noise .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mixture of character with all mod cons”
Reviews.Author: alisunchyme
Reviews.Content: I was concerened by the mixed reviews for this hotel so before i booked it i rang and spoke with Gagan one of the managers. He was extremely helpful and went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was a good experience. The hotel is in a fabulous location literally a few steps into Hyde Park and to the main Bayswater shops and restaurants. Transport links are also good just at the bottom of the road are bus stops and tube stations. The hotel communal areas and receptions are stunning with lovely wooden panelling. We especailly enjoyed the smell of fresh lilleys. It was so nice to stay somewhere which has real character. Our room (503) was exceptionally clean and modern with a good sized flat screen TV & a really comfortable bed. The bathroom was very small but very modern and it had everything needed. Another nice touch was there is a small fridge under the desk and the individual room climate was excellent so it never felt too hot or cold. Breakfast was a fair choice considering it was included in the price and the breakfast rooms themselves are beautifully ornate. A really nice environment to start the day. The best thing about the hotel was the way they have kept all the original features and character away from the modern refurbished bedrooms, you just enter them from the lovely sweeping staircase. There have been many bad reviews about the staff but from the moment we arrived Gagan and his staff were first class with their customer service. The breakfast staff were particularly nice. Ok so there has to be a few negatives to make this a balanced review, well there are but literally a few. The fan in our room didnt work and the maintenance call out was slow, but when they couldnt fix it we were offered another room. As it is a listed building the original windows do let quite a draught in but the room climate is so effective it is easily dealt with. One of the porters let the staff down as they really werent that interested in their job and it showed. Finally the cooked part of the breakfast was only luke warm and i did have an undercooked sauasage on day two. All in all though great hotel in great locations with great staff. We would definitely love to stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Characterful reception rooms”
Reviews.Author: DevonEcologist
Reviews.Content: An historic building with soime really superb reception rooms. Helpful staff. basement bedrooms to be avoided. Small, dampish atmosphere and little natural light, Breakfast only adequate. But what a great location within 50 metres of Kensington Gardens and at a reasonable price for London at a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: Claire C
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in a single person's room: room 8: garbage bins taken out into the street at 6am right outside window of room = impossible not to be awaken at that time due to noise. bins should be taken out in the evening before so i asked to change room which was done reluctantly by doorman who made me feel like a complainer. room 511: door lock faulty.no lock from inside intermitently so when the doorman came to inspect my complaint, he did not take my complain seriously so i said no more and slept with a door unlocked. needless to say i was not very happy with my stay at this hotel but i did write to the management and they offered me a discount next time i chose to stay there, which of course i won't do but the offer is appreciated just the same. otherwise, very good position in central London. well apointed room though very small but most of London hotels have terribly small rooms so it is not that unusal for a London hotel. staff need further training to make guests welcome and take their complaints seriously

Reviews.Title: “accused us of trashing their hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: CharleneA2
Reviews.Content: I really found this hotel to be quite charming, nestled in the Hyde Park district, the lobby and bar were pretty cool and you could tell alot of time and money had been spent on bringing them to their former glory. You got a hand out with the history of the hotel which apparently had been given as a gift by King George to one of his girl friends in the 1800s. The crown moldings were amazing and you got a feel for the era. however i was pretty disappointed by the rooms, it had cigarette smoke which i dispise and the shower consisted of a flimsy curtain around a few cubes of flooring. so when you showered water dispensed all over the floor. it actually ended up falling off and we had to relocate to a new room. a stewart had the gall to call us in the room and accuse us of trashing it so as to get a new room, as we had previously complained about the shower. this i found to be rude and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location, helpful personnel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline W
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel, by London standards reasonably priced, super great location (2 minutes walk from buses and tubes), helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast buffet and bar located in impressive rooms. Small rooms, but clean!! Modern bathroom. Free internet. When asked for special requests the staff went above and beyond the call of duty. We had a great time here!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Buster1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to polarize opinion, it was my accommodation for my last 3 days in London and the single rooms on the first floor seemed to be quite newly renovated. The bed was comfy and seemed wider than a standard single and the bathroom new and clean. My only complaint about the room was the noise, I can sleep through a rock concert but this place is opposite a hostel and there were people hanging around and making a lot of noise until 12pm when it seemed to settle down. The rooms also had like a bay window and being an old building this did let in a lot of cold air! The building is really beautiful though. Room was serviced adequately each day. The staff were just there, they were not pleasant or rude, I was aware they might try to shaft me off to another hotel so I emailed them before I arrived stating that if that was their intention they needed to let me know as I didn't have time to be stuffed about, no reply from them but I didn't get shafted like many seem to have been. Many of the staff seemed to struggle with English and the reception area always seemed to have too few staff, you always had to wait to speak with them and often they weren't very well informed. Their front line could certainly use some work. The location is great, 3 minutes to Queensway tube and almost across the road from Kensington Gardens where I picked up a blue bike and rode to Hyde Park and beyond. Notting Hill markets about a 10 - 15 minute walk away. A bus also runs along the main road straight to Oxford St and you are also 5 minutes in a cab to Paddington station to catch the Heathrow Express. I'd stay here again if I could be sure that I was going to get a room and not be shafted but I did see this happening when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Polite, Friendly, Clean, Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Nick D
Reviews.Content: I booked the Grand Royale London Hyde Park at last minute for a business trip. As with all first visits to a hotel I was quite sceptical. On arrival I was very please with the staff, and cleanliness of the hotel (also enjoyed the dark stained wood lobby). I ask for a quiet room and that's what I got, it was also very clean and pretty modern. The hotel is right round the corner from the tube station which has the central train, making it handy to get out and about. At night I sat in the bar, it looks visually amazing (royal box office) but it does lack atmosphere. However they had film 4 on the TV and the bar staff were very friendly! All and all I was happy with my stay and would return to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for short visit”
Reviews.Author: Olderfamily
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant two night stay. Arrived early - no problem leaving the bags until room was ready. Room was newly refurbished bright and clean. No complaints! Breakfast was excellent. Location was very good for getting around. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good”
Reviews.Author: p k
Reviews.Content: the hotel lobby is a traditioanl european style. I arrived quite late night so there was only one reception officer who is abit Indian (I am not sure). Looked around and saw a few Indian Guests..so I was so scare. What is this hotel. The bell boy in European, thin and tall but not smiling. He is polite and helped me with my baggage. Once I got into my room I found the room is nice, quite big, not small as the previous hotel I used to stay. It looks modern, has coffee and tea making facilities, bath tub, safety box and wifi (even it is abit slow) but it is better than no wifi. The bed is so comfortable for one person. The hotel is located on a good location where is near by Hyde Park, Queensway & Bayswater Subway station and a lot of restaurants. There is one Thai restaurant but owned by Malaysian so it is not bad if you are looking for a similar Thai. Overall this is a nice hotel and I will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly APPALLING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Betterdaysgo
Reviews.Content: Not even enough text for what was wrong with the service of this hotel!! Booked this hotel for my partners birthday, should have checked trip advisor first!! In a nutshell- appalling customer service from reception on arrival, put in a twin room when paid for a double superior, told the room we reserved and Paid for may not be available then it was! Put in an even smaller room with no water- fruit as stipulated! Had to move our own luggage and shopping from the wrong room to the even smaller room! Check In and settle in period Took over an hour! THE BEST PART Is someone else had our room number and let themselves in my room while I was in my undies... Back down to reception to complain!! No apology" error" the guy who walked in my room was also in reception ( how embaressing) another hour has passed.... Back up to the room, the fob dissent work... Back down to reception.. 40 mins late for the birthday boys dinner! The service at this place is appalling plus the worry about all your possessions being safe being as other guests have access to your room!! Days after I wrote a letter of complaint, it took the manger over a week to even reply to which he apologised " they are a learning organisation and will take note" NOT good enough! Another week has passed .. Still no response from my second Letter! The manager emails to say he's out of the office and will reply when he returns... Did he? NO!! I had a email saying they would refund me 25% of the Â£140 room I paid for.. And you guessed it!! Week 2 and this still hasn't happened!! Bad service, bad experience and bad management! Would highly Not recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: anniwhere
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. The lobby, breakfast room, bar and some other parts of the hotel are beautiful with ornamental carvings, gold paint and old style decor. Very nice. My room wasn't big but it was very comfortable (especially the bed), clean and the barthroom was in good shape. The staff was very helpful and nice. The only thing they got wrong was when they told me I didnt have wifi in my room. I did and it worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star or 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Jenny270
Reviews.Content: Good location but truly awful room in basement. Abrupt staff at reception and overall unhelpful; not a positive experience and I would avoid. Room in basement which had hazardous shower and no heating, carpet smelt due to damp from shower, very dark, no sunlight etc and no cable TV (expect for BBC 2 and 2 which worked fine). Also they are seem to be overbooking the hotel so you may be told hotel is full and they have room somewhere else nearby. I don't usually rate hotels I have stayed in but feel I have to in this case.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: chris944
Reviews.Content: i wanted to stay for 3 nights but left it late so had to go to another hotel for one night, booked this hotel via laterooms who texd me the booking reference staight away, that hotel was good and cheaper parking below hotel and Â£15 for 24 hours, Then booked the nexd 2 nights at the Grand, who said they would text reference but did not phone the nexd day again for ref they said they would send but didn't when we arrived we were given a room lower ground, room was smelly and a light was shining from outside the window, and outside was full of dustbin bags when we asked to be changed to a nother room there was no problems and we were sorted out as quick as could have been, room was small but very clean, bed was nice, shower good but screen veery small, very loud out side i think there is a few hostels for those nice people from other places, breakfast very good staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: John w
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but well decorated/renovated in a beautiful building, no problems with our booking and overall great value for money - fantastic breakfast included when you book throught the hotel website. Excellent location - hire the barclays bikes to cycle hyde park on a sunny day!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: OzzyBozzy
Reviews.Content: Lovely building in public areas, small rooms but cosy. Minus for the cheap & hard beds. Needs maintanence in the rooms: few screws missing on lampfittings, walls very marked, table legs needs repaint. Bad air, had to have the window open to avoid stuffiness. Great breakfast, plenty of staff in the old dining room 1st floor. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pierangela L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location, right around the corner was the Queensway tube stop. I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room didn't have a great view, but this didn't matter as we wanted a nice, comfortable place to sleep with free breakfast. Location was the most important thing for us. With only two days in London, we wanted to be as centrally located as possible. Unfortunately, I found the hotel to be extremely overpriced. But the bedroom was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean as well, but the standing shower was very small. Overall, I had a wonderful stay but wouldn't stay here again because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Jason L
Reviews.Content: Pros: The Grand Royale London Hyde Park is in a great location. (This is explains why there are many other hotels on the same block.) On the north border of Hyde Park, it's a nice neighborhood, plenty of nearby places to eat, multiple Tube stops nearby, and plenty of traffic going by if you're trying to catch a taxi. Cons: Way small rooms. We even had to go up 5 stairs *in* our room (yes, once we opened the room door, there were stairs). No shower curtain, and they claimed it was designed this way. (My girlfriend was fine with this, and barely got any water on the floor, but I think it's just dumb.) The staff isn't particularly friendly, though they were responsive to requests -- iron and ironing board, for example.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: holiday84Sydney
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is close to the underground and buses. Hyde Park across the road and Kensington Palace very close. We walked to Oxford Street and the shopping. But this hotel is not 4 star. Very average. Stayed here for three nights. Our room was so tiny - it was marketed as double bedroom, but did not have enough room to put two suitcases down to open them up. The smallest room I have ever stayed in. The decor of the hotel was old world, dark wood panelling, etc. I loved it. Breakfast too dear, cheaper to have it down the road., in the local pub. Would not say here again, as the rooms are way too small!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deliberately overbooks”
Reviews.Author: Kate E
