Reviews.Content: If you are happy to have a confirmed booking fall through; if you are happy to fill in the Guest Registration documentation, sign it and then be told there is no room available and you will be put in a taxi to go elsewhere; if you are content when reception staff apparently rings a 'manager' to check that they are in fact full when you express some doubt; if you are happy to go to a 'sister' hotel in another location; if you are happy to believe maintenance works of the building have unexpectedly arisen preventing your accommodation being available at 5pm; if you are satisfied to have had no notice that your booking is canceled; if you have confidence in the establishment to provide you with equivalent or better accommodation after your experience with them; then this, my friend, is the place for you. Kate, Melbourne

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel, stay elsewere”
Reviews.Author: AndisAme
Reviews.Content: If you are booking a 4 star hotel in London you surely do not expect this kind of hotel. I will start with the good things The room was clean and the breakfast buffet was good. The location is great. The bad things First of all i will have to say that already we booked two rooms at this hotel they said that by mistake the only booked one so they need to move us to another hotel. But they didn't look any suprised at all. As the hotel is a member of shaftesbury hotels and have other hotels nearby i belive its their policy to overbooked and send you elsewere. Susana the so-called manager (not a chance for her to ba a manager) said that was nothing to be done so we need to accept the other shaftesbury hotel. Have in mind that i was traveling with my two year old son and two senior people. After a almst two hours of arguing she managed to find the rooms we booked and most propably send he next unlucky clients to the other hotel. The same story for another couple next to us by the way. She (susana) called my wife and myself rude because we didn't accept her offer to move. This is the first time something like that happens to me. I stayed in a lot of hotels in different countries. Rooms are not just small are tiny. Imagine the brought to us a babycot but i was laughing as there was not any place to put it.They say they have free internet and they do when it works. I stayed there for two days and it worked for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay if not a little frustrating initially”
Reviews.Author: richard37_11
Reviews.Content: My first time at this hotel. Stayed in room 216 and wanted to max the time I had working and so a clean, comfortable room with internet access was essential. Sadly, the internet did not work and took two of the hotel groups IT guys to fix it. Credit to the hotel, they stuck it out and after 2 hours had the issue fixed (new cable!). The only additional amusing point was the lights blowing in the morning, so could not see clearly in the room, especially in the small bathroom with no natural light. To be fair to the hotel, the staff were very helpful during my stay,the room clean and the breakfast hot, so all in all a good stay. (Didn't stay for evening meal so cannot comment). Just a few frustrations. The hotel is a minute from Bayswater road, 2 minutes from Bayswater tude, local shops, bars and restaurants. A very traditional old style hotel, so for those who lbve historic buildings, there's lots to view here.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chloe123-11
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in London and I had hear that Motel Accomodation in London was not all that great. But I have to admitt that I was extremely surprised. The room was quite spacious and the bathroom not too small either. Everything was very clean. This Motel was very old world charm, but very inviting. The front desk staff were always polite and friendly at all times. The vicinity couldn't have been any better. Only a block away from the Railway Station and plenty of good restaurants only minutes away. Good location also for catching the Hop on Hop off buses, which can take you just about any where you would like to go. My partner and I had 6 nites in August and the bonus was that we only had rain for 1 day which was great. I would recommend this Motel to any other traveller and wouldn't hesitate to return should be in London again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ciro4
Reviews.Content: During Edwardian times, Lillie Langtry, mistress of King Edward VII, performed in the in-house theatre of this historic hotel. The public rooms of this hotel are all beautifully restored to their 19th century appearance. The individual rooms are modern and well-appointed, and clean and comfortable. I stayed in a Deluxe Double on the fifth floor and it was no smaller than any American hotel of the same value. It even had a terrace! The hotel is located across the street from Kensington Gardens, and just moments from both the Queensway and Bayswater tube stations, as well as the restaurants and shops on Queensway. It is also a 5 minute walk to Kensington Palace and a 15 minute walk to the Portobello Road Market. Paddington Station is nearby, where you can easily reach Heathrow within minutes. I for one enjoyed my stay at the Grand Royale Hyde Park and loved its old world feel.

Reviews.Title: “â€œgood place to stayâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Reem33
Reviews.Content: we went to grand royal hotel. we stayed ten days there. First time they give us rooms to small and tight we shocked then we ask them to give us big rooms it was in basement. the hotel is clean but they didnt change the blanket

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Rafael K
Reviews.Content: When I arrived there, I was told that they were no free rooms and I booked it nearly one month ago. Then after a long discussion, I finally got a room. Once I arrived there, I noticed that the room was small and not really clean. At night, I had the impression that my window was open because it was cold and I heard all the noises from outside, but it was closed... And the staff tried to appear friendly but they were always taking me for a fool. Only good point is the location. Avoid this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “An Extremely Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: angieCharlotte_NC
Reviews.Content: In Sept, I stayed in this hotel on a one night stop over, from my trip to the Cotswolds, before leaving to the States. I was not impressed with the area at all. I had made reservations three months in advance as I was traveling from the States. When I arrived I was given a room in the lower ground, this is the translation for "basement". It is like a labyrinth, my room was all the way at the end of a very narrow hall, it is so narrow, that my small luggage could barely fit through; I had problems trying to open the door of the bedroom and turning my small luggage. The room was very small although it looked like if it was updated; the bedroom window was unlocked....and that terrified me, since it is wide and from the floor to almost halfway to the ceiling. The hallway rug was old and very tired. I decided to change into something more comfortable and go out to get something to eat, and while I was in my under wears, a man opened the door of my room and tried to get in!! I was terrified and screamed...he said in a very broken English, "I'm sorry"; he looked Russian to me with a very heavy accent. I got dressed right away and went out as fast as I could. I took my notebook computer and valuable items with me, just in case it would be stolen. I went to the Reception in the Lobby, with every intention of reporting the incident, but decided not to, afraid of some type of retaliation. As as I was approaching the elevator I saw the same guy again, and he told me "I'm sorry" again, apparently he is part of the staff and was going around changing the shower curtains, you would think that he would knock on the door before he got in with his master key...unbelievable!!!, I went out and walked around for a few blocks, and the area is full of very shady characters, just did not feel safe at all. As if this was not enough, there is Hostel across the street from the hotel, and in the side walk in front of hostel, there were a group of young people screaming and making all kinds of noises, as loud as they could be. I went back to the hotel and sat in the Lobby until around 7:00 pm and then went back to my room; I was really scared; I decided to put my luggage against the door and sat on the bed to watch TV until around 4:00 am, drinking tea, afraid of falling sleep, when I decided to check out. I had a driver schedule to pick me up at 5:00 am to take me to the airport and I preferred to wait in the Lobby for him...I have never felt so scared in my whole live; I am not a young person anymore, I have travel a bit in my life and I don't get scare easily, but this was a frightening experience. While I was sitting in the lobby at that time of the early morning, I could still hear the young people from the hostel screaming and horsing around like if they were drunks.... I can't believe that I paid $225 for me to have to go through this horrible experience. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, for this price, you should be able to at least feel safe and be able to get some rest. The Victorian charm other people have written about is very old and tired, although, when photographed looks very luxurious. I have stayed in less expensive hotels in London, better priced and in better locations, were you can feel safe and the people look like normal people. As far as I am concern they can keep the architecture and the history, I rather feel safer and with peace of mind when I am traveling abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: pete9412
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at his hotel a number of times. Very comfortable beds, always clean. Rooms are airconditioned although a little small. Noise from the hostel opposite can be annoying, just hope it rains for your stay to keep them in their rooms. Breakfast really nice, drinks a little expensive. Staff all freindly. Hopefully they have sorted out their "boiler problems", as a number of people were complaining as their rooms were no longer available and were being transferred to other hotels. It was quite entertaining to watch different peoples reactions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: BklynNotes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it. It is in a good location and the architecture is beautiful. Originally built in the 1850s as a home for Lily Langtry, it has a beautiful lobby and second floor. In addition, the breakfast offered a range of options - a full English breakfast of eggs, sausage, beans, potatoes, bacon, plus yogurt, cereal and fruit and coffee and tea. The people are very pleasant and helpful. Having said that, we had some problems during our five-day stay. First the rooms are very small (we didn't mind that); the rooms don't have a night latch, or bolt; we had water leak into our bathroom from above, we lost electricity for a while; and a couple of times we came back to find our rooms open. The cleaning people or porters had left them open.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Treatment”
Reviews.Author: K R
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 15.00 Hrs ,I requested The Receptionist Can we Get The Room with View , Receptionist took the help of porter , She told the porter to Show us room on third Floor , Room Was nice but Compaq , I Requested Can we get a little Bigger Room ,As we are here for One Night , the Lady approach to the manager .He personally came out shown us , I Believe One of There Best Room of The Hotel 419 , When We Entered We were amazed , So Big room with View . Thanks to The manager (Gagan ) for Allocating us bigger room . We Missed The Breakfast but Find The Decor amazing . We had a Very Pleasant Sleep Will Come back again

Reviews.Title: “Manager and Staff Was Helpful”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I Booked a single Room , Requested for Early check In . I arrived around at 08.00 a.m in morning Normally in hotels of London you are not able to get early check in but, I was given Upgrade ,to double room as well as the keys straight away The Best Thing I Liked about the hotel was I was given a quite Room 414 . I requested the manager , Mr gagam can I get Late Check Out till 01.30 pm , He offered me Late Check out free of Charge . Staff At Reception were quite attentive and professional Actually the manager has given his personal e-mail address for the future Visit Will Definitely Come back

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay upfront to stay in this cupboard!”
Reviews.Author: JohnFredHardy
Reviews.Content: The non refundable price for a room the size of a shoebox that you don't get to see until you've paid is only worth the location. You can complain and upgrade to a cupboard with a window box. All 5 star reviews are obviously written by staff, who were polite but ineffective.

Reviews.Title: “Entertainingly Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Raddisch
Reviews.Content: Arrived quite early in the morning and was greeted by the same disinterest as other reviewers have mentioned. Had greatly difficulty proving I had a reservation even though I had a printed copy on me. Had great trouble communicating generally to be fair, as most the staff had English as their second or third language. Left to see family for the day and arrived back late at night to find that that the disinterest had been upgraded to complete rudeness, apparently that whilst my room was ready there was no key cards left to get into the rooms and they had misplaced the master key â€“ pure Fawlty Towers Madness! Eventually after finding the Master Key they let me into my room and the porter jammed some business cards in the slot to keep the power running and said in heavily accented English â€œYou get Key Tomorrowâ€� and shut the door â€“ I felt like I was behind the iron curtain during the height of the cold war! The room was incredibly small, I actually couldnâ€™t open my suitcase unless I put it on the bed, and only just! Leaving proved as entertaining as arriving, of the two lifts, one was â€œlocked outâ€� by the room service staff for their use so I had to wait nine (9) minutes for the other one â€“ Very â€œHotel Californiaâ€� Give this place a miss â€“ there are plenty of other non-descript hotels in this part of the London that are far better.

Reviews.Title: “Attaining high standards ....”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Not easy, and there are some things the hotel should work on, starting with reception. The hotel has royal connections, and a lot of period features, but customer service needs to be improved so that today's patrons feel like royalty!! That said, the manager Mr Gagan Ahuja has on more than one occasion (I stay on a regular basis) gone out of his way to provide every courtesy. I am surprised by one comment that breakfast was cold. In my experience, the breakfasts at Grand Royale are among the best I've found in London.

Reviews.Title: “Single rooms are in the basement”
Reviews.Author: DubaiIbnbattuta
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. That's about it! When we arrived, the rooms were not ready and we had to wait about 6 hours before they were ready. No sorries from the management. The real shocker was that the room was in the BASEMENT (below pavement level). In front of our window were stairs going up to the road and every morning early, the staff would drop its garbage and used linen down those stairs. The sink in the bathroom was the smallest i had seen in all my life. Barely fits in a hand. The only great thing about the hotel is the location and the heritage architecture in the main rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: hen89
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for just the one night at the GRand Royale which was just enough! Staff on arrival were rude and unwelcoming with no interest in who was walking in their door. We were actually 'shooed' away by one of the girls behind reception to the next one who was equally as uninterested in us! First impressions not great! The hotel reception and lounge area, although impressive, lacks any atmosphere or warmth. We stayed in room 101 which has to be the smallest '5*' hotel room I've ever seen! Then room was just big enough for the bed with a small table in the corner. We really could have been in any old budget hotel, sterile, uncomfortable yet still would have got better value for our money!! We did consider requesting a larger room but knew it was pointless knowing how unfriendly the staff were downstairs! The breakfast was cold, dining room lacked atmosphere also. When looking at the website we were sold a luxury hotel, this is not the case. Beware when looking at pictures these are only the top end rooms anything in between is far below expectation, save the cash and stay at travel lodge!!

Reviews.Title: “maintenance issues - what a scam”
Reviews.Author: 805WCL
Reviews.Content: I wish I had looked on trip advisor before I booked this hotel, I'm gutted to see that we were also scammed by the maintenance issue on arrival. (It sounds like they overbook the hotel then move you to substandard hotels once you have paid.) We had booked this hotel weeks in advance and were really excited about our trip to London. Our whole weekend was ruined as a result and extremely stressful. We were moved to a "sister hotel" of apparently the same standard. It was appalling - a dirty shoe box, with very rude staff who entered into a shouting match with me across the hotel lobby. I have never written a complaint letter before / or used trip advisor, but we were so upset about the way we were treated I wrote a pleasant letter to the manager of the hotel outlining our complaint, needless to say we have never received a reply.. I think this perfectly sums up their customer service - absolute crap. I am not only surprised to see a number excellent reviews of this hotel, but in a lot of them people mention the managers name - 1. Who meets a manager when they stay in a hotel? the manager was no where to be found when we wanted to speak to them 2. Remebers their name 3. Then writes about it on trip advisor... Curious!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Ash181
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised about some of the negative comments I read on this site regarding the Grand Royal. I stayed 2 nights in august and had a great time. Yes the hotel was very busy but the staff were very helpful. I suffer from asthma and had forgotten my inhalers. The manager and staff made calls and found a 24hr chemist which gave me the medication. I can honestly say they went they went the extra mile with us. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stayed”
Reviews.Author: Jen x
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 3 days in June 2011, The rooms are small, but the staff is quite nice specially the duty manager name Mr Ahuja, he is quite helpfull. The breakfast service was good but need an improvement. All in all its was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: omay a
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week together with my wife to celebrate our 5th anniversary and i can say it was amazing. The room that we have book was good but we had the pleasant surprise to find out that we have been upgraded to a bigger room that was much better and also had some complementary amenities. We would like to thank to Mr. Gagan Ahuja who was on duty the day we checked in for offering us his exceptional service and for making our stay even more enjoyable. He was really helpful and attentive with us from the first moment we arrived until we left to the airport. I would deffinately recommend this hotel for the good service received from the staff, for the location that is great and also for the value. Is a very good hotel comparing to others the same standard.We can't wait to go back and have an amazing time there.

Reviews.Title: “Wanna see the smallest hotel room in the northern hemisphere?”
Reviews.Author: CarosassoneCH
Reviews.Content: If a make a rough estimate, I think that Iâ€™ve been in about 500 â€“ 600 hotels in my life â€“ but this hotel really surpassed everything Iâ€™ve ever seen â€“ regarding the room size. Itâ€™s just a joke!!! Iâ€™ve never seen such a small room â€“ you can barely enter and move in the room! If I compare the photos on the web with the reality, I think that the photographer is the most talented guy in the world â€“ he could transform a mouse into an elephant just by taking the right objective â€¦ at least on the photo. Second negative point: you can turn off the air conditioning, but you canâ€™t turn off the ventilation which blows cold air on your head all the night â€“ I woke up with a big headache (and I swear, I did not drink a single beer during the evening!). Third negative point: service quality is poor or even very poor for almost every aspect. Another problem is overbooking: apparently, I was lucky â€“ other guests who had a confirmed reservation were sent away as the hotel was full â€“ at midnight! Consequence: I would never recommend going there and will never never sleep there again. This is actually a pity, as the building, the lobby and the bar are gorgeous â€“ a historic theatre with plenty of funny and beautiful details. I canâ€™t understand the concept of the owners â€“ if I had such a real estate project, Iâ€™d transform this into a luxury boutique hotel, luxury serviced apartments, spas, a high-end brothel, whatever â€“ but not into a â€œbudgetâ€� hotel resembling to a rabbit hutch once youâ€™ve left the lobby. Nevertheless: if you like historic buildings, you may want to see the place (itâ€™s really worth) and have a drink at the bar â€“ but make sure that you have the confirmation of another hotel for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! Great location and a very classy place!”
Reviews.Author: j0seph1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 3 days in September 2011. I was initial skeptical because I paid about 80 pounds a night. When I checked in and saw the lobby and my room I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby and the room were amazing - modern and clean. The only bad thing I could say was that the single room I stayed in was pretty small (think along the lines of a single room in a Tokyo hotel). But the room was clean, the decor was modern and there was free internet internet in the room. I would definitely stay here again and without doubt this was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance issues!!”
Reviews.Author: bewlaybros
Reviews.Content: This would have been my third stay in this particular establishment...however, it did not happen!!!!! Arrived at 3pm last Friday, approached the desk in order to check in and was informed that even though I had booked a room at the Grand Royale in Hyde Park I would not be staying there and instead will be staying in some hotel in Earls Court! Apparently this was down to "maintenance issues". When I pressed the receptions for an explanation and to clarify the "maintenace issue" she paused, thought for a while, blushed and replied "boiler". What a joke. We asked for a refund and left. Basically, they double book you then try and fob you off with "maintenance issues" and try and relocate you to one of their sister hotels. Looking at past reviews, this seems to happen alot so beware, DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!! unless you are happy on taking a gamble on where you will be sleeping that night.

Reviews.Title: “Closed for maintenance - another redirection”
Reviews.Author: chubtor
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location, read the above average reviews and really looked forward to staying there. BUT we only ever saw the inside of the lobby as we were the victims of what seems to be standard procedure for this hotel...."Sorry but due to maintenance we have no rooms available for you and we are transferring you to one of our sister hotels." Our unproven suspicion is that the rooms in this hotel are only issued to those people willing to pay a higher rate than that supplied by lastminute,com. Despite protesting to the lobby staff - who showed no interest in us other than to get us out as quickly as possible - all our protests fell on deaf ears and we had no alternative but to spend our 3 nights in London at a hotel further away from Hyde Park, closer to Paddington station than we wanted. Our alternative room was tiny, with a bathroom suitable only for a contortionist. We cannot recommend this hotel or its associated group.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hannah H
Reviews.Content: I was meant to be staying here late August for one night. We had made a booking on Wotif and arrived at the hotel only to be told the water was out for the next 4 hours (we were early and wouldn't have been able to check in anyway), so we were being transferred to another hotel in their group "across the road". Other guests were still staying there and others were checking in. The hotel that we were transferred to was 4*, The Shaftesbury, but not what we had paid for by any means. It was a huge disappointment as we were looking forward to spending the night a hotel which had a lot of character and history.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID - The worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Gareth T
Reviews.Content: This has to be the poorest hotel I have stayed at in London. The rooms are very small, the sheets were dirty and the service was shocking. I even wrote a complaint email to the manager who ignored this twice, so I emailed the Director who also ignored my complaint. Sums up the hotel really they have no customer service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book through Grand Royale Website”
Reviews.Author: Stephell
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the previous reviews but booked through the Hotels own website as advised by the Australian visitors & got stung for taxes on top! Last minute is Â£69 including taxes we paid Â£82! Rooms very compact especially the bathroom but very clean and well appointed with crisp bed linen & clean plump towels. Dining hall was beautiful as well as light and airy. View from hotel room was a dirty yard behind some shops but didn't bother us as only staying one night.

Reviews.Title: “Thorougly enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were made very welcome by the friendly staff, especially Anca Gagan who allowed us to check into our room early. The public rooms are beautiful- lots of fresh fruit and flowers, a stunning lounge to sit and relax in! The bedrooms, although not huge have everything that one needs; very comfy bed, small but perfectly formed prestine bathroom. A complimentary fruit bowl and bottle of white wine were very nice extras, the breakfast was also excellant. As frequent hotel visitors we would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Want to enjoy a pleasent, comfort & relax with warm welcome try this”
Reviews.Author: siddhant d
Reviews.Content: I got a refference of this hotel from my friend who was there for his holiday with his wife, i Oppted for the same GRAND ROYALE LONDON HYDE PARK, believe me i made a right choice by listning to my friend's advice by choosing the hotel. Beautiful Hotel, Beautful rooms neat and clean, wish to stay back there, great ambiance of heritage touch, and beautiful restaurant very most important great staff, Would really appriciate and thank Ms.Darshana Patel for giving us and excelent servcie during my saty, with her guidence me and my wife have really enjoyed our self. would definatly recomend any once who is looking for a pleasent stay GO FOR THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Krishna D
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to London and stay at grand royal was excellent Location of the hotel was superb...my special thanks to gagan darshna charu and poter will very helpful who made my stay comfortable. Cheers to all.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Will only stay here when in London from now on in.”
Reviews.Author: Carlan H
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel listed on Lastminute.com but booked through the hotels own website as it was much cheaper. We were a little concerned that there would be some 'catch' to booking this online, but to our delight there was none! Not only is the hotel beautiful and the rooms fantastic, but it's the service here which makes the difference. Our Concierge - Gargon, went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. He was so helpful and went out of his way to make our stay even better! Thank you so much Gargon! We will be back because of you and your lovely staff!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodations, wonderful service, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Filippa V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful - the building has the feel of an old English charm, yet the accomodations are cutting edge with modern monsoon rain showers, state-of-the-art room call service, key card access, luxurious bed linens, and is abolutely spotless. The breakfast is extensive and the wait staff and desk clerks can't do enough for you. In addition, the area is ideal, four stops from Oxford Circus on the red line with easy access to two Underground stops. Very safe neighborhood with quaint English feel to it. There are many merchants on parallel streets, near to Notting Hill, with plenty of shopping. A twenty minute walk to Knightsbridge. Several options are available for airport transport around the corner, or there is a shuttle that will come right to the hotel door for a small price. This is really worth the value and we will definitely book future hotel plans here. I recommend you to ask for Mr. Gagan when you check in, as he is extremely accomodating, courteous, professional, and it is evident that he engenders good rapport with everyone at the desk and in the dining hall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanMaynard85
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner just left London and stayed at the Grand Royal Hyde Park for 3 nights. Was excellent. The rooms were great, the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms werent huge or anything but very nice indeed. Would stay there again and have already said we will next time. Its very central to shops and transport and theres a nice little place around the corner that does buffet breaky for Â£4.98. And there are about 3 tube stations in walking distance. Loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant stay, we recomend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Eef V
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park was in one word fantastic. Not only does the hotel look great and the rooms are really nice but we were most impressed by the extremely helpfull and friendly staff. We had a business meeting and the staff did everything to help us, make us feel at home and simply make it a super stay. Our special thanks go to Ajay, Cagan, Darshana and Ravi who were so friendly and helpfull. We run many meetings in many European cities and this one was logistic wise just one of the best thanks to whole the team. We didn't need to worry about anything, everything was taking care of! Also the service in general for checking in etc at the front desk was simply top class! We really apreciate that!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it & I'll be back.....”
Reviews.Author: Shuchi R
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved & enjoyed my stay in the hotel due to the excellent service & assistance provided to me by a manager named "Gagan Ahuja"......He was extremely courteous & helpful & made my stay extremely comfortable..... Be rest assured if you have more staff like him.....people would love to keep coming back all the time......

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very nice and very profesionall..”
Reviews.Author: Dorelynho
Reviews.Content: My brother he Booked a room for me in the month of august my stay was excellent all the staff were very helpful at reception and resutrant specially manager gagan,Dorel ,darshana,alius,gabriel thanks to them.in the site it was mentioned wifi Ã®s free that was the best thing and surely will recommand this hotel to everyone. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fire alarm went off three times at night!!”
Reviews.Author: ameitomu
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the worst hotel stay ever. First of all, the staff was rather cold when I checked in. Then I called reception to ask if they had a pair of slippers and the phone just rang out. When I finally spoke to someone at the reception, he promised to call back but never did. The room was very tiny, but I had no issues with that given the price I paid. I was on the 8th (or 7th) floor and there was a tiny little window (A4 size). The noise coming from the street was unbearable and it went on till well past midnight. When I had finally managed to kind of fall asleep, the fire alarm went off. First at 1am, then 2am, then 2:30am. To my surprise, no one had bothered to call to explain why the fire alarm had went off. Each time I got out of the bed, not knowing whether the alarm was real or false. The next morning, I asked a couple who was also staying there about the alarm, they just said it was nothing unusual, as the night before I arrived the fire alarm had gone off twice as well. WHAT THE!!!!!!!! If you just want good location and good size breakfast, this is the place for you. However, if you want a good rest at night, this is definitely not a place for you.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: rachel b
Reviews.Content: There are lot of things to say about grand royale london hyde park.First of all the hotel is located in a good area near hyde park,by the way a beautiful park you should visit it in case you decide to spend your holiday in london,the underground station is just 2 minutes away from the hotel which is very convenient for everybody and also all the amenities are near by such as restaurants, pharmacy,shopping mall.now let me tell you something more about the hotel itself.when i first arrived at the hotel i was very impressed with the classic stile, i have to admit that i love this stile and also nowadays you can hardly find such buildings especially hotels.the receptionist was very kind and despite the fact that i arrived a little bit early she managed to provide a room for me which was perfect after a long journey.the room was not that big but very cleaned and quite and the bed was very comfortable.the breakfast was good and the staff was helpful.i did really enjoyed and i would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sri_gadapa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend as we were on trip to London. We picked a room , as we entered hotel the staff welcoming was warm.Hotel service was very good & excellent. The hotel was clean & neat, The location was beautiful. In short, Grand Royale London Hyde park is AWESOME...

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but overall pleasant stay !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jones1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July. Rooms are really very tiny than shown on internet as many of the customers commented on tripadvisor , but what I really liked about this hotel is overall environment. Specially the entire staff of all departments is very friendly and helpful. Upon arrival I got a very tiny room but on the next day reception staff upgraded me to a club room. Reception and concierge are very enthusiastic and attentive also the service and housekeeping staff is good. I personally enjoyed the stay and will definitely visit again. Thank you very much Grand Royale for making my stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean hotel. Central to everything.”
Reviews.Author: jaymcinney1234
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Attended efficiently to requests and inquiries. Room was comfortable, clean and attended to. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: santosh19984
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel for two days with my family and i booked two rooms. Despite of reading the reviews on tripadvisor i was not sure, that i will be able to get a room in this hotel. But, apparently i didn't found such situtaion as well as atmospere in this hotel. We were given the room on the sixth floor both rooms near to each other because i had requested a room on the higher floor. When we arrived at the hotel we requested for a late check out, the reception staff was not sure he approched the manager (gaggan) and finally we were given a late check out. Therefore, i found the manager quite helpful. I would be thankful to the Grand Royale whole staff for making my stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and will definitely be there on my next visit...”
Reviews.Author: aditi s
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to London.. was there was a business trip.. I was accommodated at your hotel by my office n i thank them for the same.. Ur property is lovely with an amazing vintage touch.. The rooms were a little small though.. Your staff has been very helpful, friendly and courteous, specially Mr. Anup and Mr. Soish who work in the night shift... they have guided through each and everything i've asked for... The service provided was pretty fast.. It was a pleasure being at your property and will definitely be there on my next visit..

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff good location...”
Reviews.Author: Rajeev21
Reviews.Content: We have just finished our second stay at this hotel with in last 15 days during our visit to UK I would recommend this hotel for its convenient location and helpful staff led by duty manager Gagan. While the rooms are small they are well equipped with all modern amenities. For our return stay the duty manager took special interest to ensure we got two slightly larger door corner rooms for my family. The breakfast room was very nice exuding royalty with a decent menu and courteous duty staff though one would have loved to see some changes given our extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: chriscall_3
Reviews.Content: What a great improvement from our first stay at this hotel in 2009. We had a good sized room and lovely bathroom. The reception staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is beautiful and sunny. There was plenty of choice of food which was topped up regularly and the staff were attentive. My only moan was that the duvet was too small for the bed, so one of us lost out on the cover (me of course!).

Reviews.Title: “Antique hotel and lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lollita18
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel I have never been in my entire life. I love the location and the interior of the hotel and great value for the money. I was staying in this hotel for couple of nights with my partner and we loved so much. The best thing u can say is the staff and service they provide was awesome, sometimes we will never get this kind of service in a 5* hotel either. Thanks to all the front desk staff especially Anca, Charu who made our stay very comfortable. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Its great to be here and all thanks to Gagan and his team”
Reviews.Author: SumitHarit
Reviews.Content: It is a pleasure to stay in this hotel which gives you that ancient feeling with modern hospitality. Gagan and each member of the hotel would make you feel special. I would recomend everybody to enjoy being here if they are visiting London

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! YOU WILL GET RIPPED OFF!”
Reviews.Author: Sansel78
Reviews.Content: I just finished my stay at this pompous hotel and it ruined my holiday. I arrived on Saturday evening and a guy at the reception picked up a phone and after taking my money for the room told me I will be transferred to the other hotel near Marble Arch. When we asked why, he mumbled it's due to some electricity problems in the room we booked. So he organized the taxi and without telling us where he's sending us put us in a car where driver tried to convince us we're going to a nice hotel next to Marble Arch. I asked the driver for the address of the hotel and it turned out hotel was on completely other side of the city, nowhere near Marble Arch. When we called the reception at the Grand Royale and asked them how's this near Marble Arch, he said it's near, it's 15 min by cab. I complained to the manager at the other hotel as I wasn't interested to stay at their hotel. He organized us a transfer back at the Grand with an upgraded room and breakfast. By this stage we already lost 4 hours of our night. Next morning, upon our arrival at Grand, as soon as the guy from the previous night saw us, he ran and hid. Very mature for 5 star hotel. We checked in and our room was not upgraded, but quite the opposite - downgraded. When we were to go to bed, we discovered a lot of dirty tissues under the bed cover as well as dirty bed linen. And the last drop was the transportation to the station was organized by hotel and as the mAnager assured me it was going to be free due to all the inconvenience, the driver asked me to pay. I wonder, what exactly is 4-5 star about this sad place apart from staff's behaviour?

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE....PLEASE HEED THIS ADVICE”
Reviews.Author: peepers444
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked us a room at this hotel as it was our first anniversary and we thought it would be something different. As I have lived In London all my life I have often wondered what staying in one of the fancy hotels near Hyde park would be like. Knowing this my husband splashed out and booked us a room. Before leaving to go to the hotel I went onto this website and was alramed that there was a very large number of negative stories regarding this hotel and claims of 'scams' about double booking. I was slightly worried but thought it would be ok. When I tried to book in Low and Behold the girl behind the counter told me there had been a matinance problem and they we had to be moved to the sister hotel. I asked if it was the boiler to which she looked shocked I told her about all the bad reviews. She them asked me to sit down and began to wisper into the phone. Shortly after the 'Manager' arrived and told me as it was old building they experience a number of problems regarding the working of the building. I was put in a taxi to the sister hotel and promised a better room. When I arrived in the better room I was shocked, not only was it not a 'Superior Double' but it did not even have room for a chair!!! When I spoke to the manager he offered me a free bottle of wine (which never showed up). I telephoned the grande royale to let them know about the room and they gave me 30% of my money back. However I still behond angry about this as it ruined an evening that should have been special . I am now complaning not just to the hotel itself but also to the company we booked through and also the AA who give tham a star rating..Please avoid this hotel and any in its chain.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Good Service”
Reviews.Author: SamWilcox-Diedericks
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my fifth stay at this hotel. The service levels are very high and problems are always attended to immediately. The rooms are absolutely fine, and I have stayed in various across the five stays. They always generously offer me an upgrade upon arrival, alongside a really warm greeting. The location is brilliant with Hyde Park less than 50 metres away. Close to the tube and major bus routes. In terms of value for money, this hotel is an excellent choice compared some serioudly dodgy offerings in London. The managers Gagan & Ajay are brilliant and take a personal interest in guest satisfaction. The support staff are also exceptionally helpful with Ravi a leader of the pack. This gentleman Ravi certainly understands the definition of excellent service. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there again later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, historic building but run like a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: 1000Brussel
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel promoted on WOTIF.COM but reserved directly through the hotel. The hotel is really well located with 2 Underground stations within quick walking distance. The public rooms of the hotel are very impressive but I was very disappointed with the Front Desk staff. Their management and service approach is better suited to a Youth Hostel. On the hotel website, they ask for estimated arrival time ("Please let us know your arrival and departure flight details so that we can better prepare for your room arrangements"). However, the 2 Romanians clerks (male and female) working at the Front Desk when I arrived made it clear that they were not interested in any preparation of room arrangements. They said no access to the rooms would be granted before 14:00. (If this is the approach, then please remove this question from the on-line reservation process because it creates unrealistic expectations and only results in frustration.) At 13:40 when returning to hotel, I asked about if they could assign me a room. The Front Desk clerk (the Romanian man) replied that it was impossible because the computer system would only be refreshed at 14:00 and he could not see which had be cleaned already. When I then asked kindly contact housekeeping, he said that this was also not possible. This is not the kind of response one should expect from a 4 star London hotel but obviously this was the best they could do. Hence my comment about the hotel being run like a youth hostel (treating guests like children and providing no additional service) .This is too bad because aside from the contact with the Front Desk, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The rooms are quite small (this no surprise in London) but they are modern and very comfortable. Also the breakfast was excellent, with very attentive waitstaff. And again the location and easy Underground access could not be better. Am hesitant to stay there again. . I did not expect to have access to the room at 09.00 but had hope that I would be given the room before the official check-in time of 14.00

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the personal attention!”
Reviews.Author: ychadda
Reviews.Content: We would like to share our experience of our stay at the Hotel Grand Royale in London. My wife & myself checked in this hotel, there were few problems, but thanks to Mr Paulo Goncalves(Hotel manager) & Mr Ajay Patil (shift leader) all the problems were ironed out. They were very very helpful & made our stay comfortable & enjoyable. The entire staff was courteous & polite. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends for a stay & advise them to look up these two gentlemen. Thankyou! Mr Yogesh Chadda New Delhi India

Reviews.Title: “Depressing little room, unorganized front desk”
Reviews.Author: strawberryfrog
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews about people switching hotels and, perhaps because I was forewarned, I easily saw this arrangement on the website. I think if you read the rates carefully it's pretty clear when you're signing up for the lower rate that you are agreeing to stay in whichever hotel they want to put you in. I paid slightly more to stay in my hotel of choice. This hotel has a gorgeous old lobby. Unfortunately the front desk staff are extremely disorganized. I checked in and they asked me a two other parties to step aside and wait to get a key. The other party got the key and I kept patiently waiting. Finally, the lady who checked me in asked if I needed some help and I said "Yes, you asked me to wait on a key." Then she remembered, and called someone to fix me up a key...the are standard hotel card keys, not sure what the issue was. My room was a single, and it seemed to be a large closet in the basement that was converted into a bedroom. Despite having only a twin bed (which was actually comfortable), there was barely enough room for me to move around in the room. Tiny, tiny, tiny..it's amazing that I paid $188 per night to stay in this closet in the basement! The location of the hotel is fine, a tube station is close by and there are numerous bus routes just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate London accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Wal15130
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to London. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Bayswater Station and just as close to the bus stop on Bayswater Rd. It has a very small entrance but the foyer and sitting room are large and well furnished. We had booked a deluxe double room and it was VERY small - really couldn't turn around in it and there was no room for our suitcases - we had to stack them on top of each other. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was very quiet - we slept well on all the nights we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “SCAMMED AGAIN: DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: claire0602
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! I had read the reviews before of people who had arrived only to be sent to a 'sister hotel' but I honestly thought it would be ok. SUPRISE! 'Unfortunately there was a problem with my room and I would have to go to another hotel.' I was furious and started telling her about all the tripadvisors, but the little polish woman of course had no idea about this. The man who carried my bag to the 'taxi' dragged it and bumped it down all the stairs, I had to ask to carry it myself to make sure anything valuable in it was not broken. On arrival, they placed me in the basement room with a view to the garbage on the steps. When I asked if they had any other rooms, the woman was extremely rude again and insisted there was not even one other room in the hotel that was available. Yeah right. I had booked on wotif.com and have sent a complaint to them, but would strongly advise that you DO NOT STAY HERE. This is completely unacceptable behaviour and I am furious now that I have read all the reviews that I didnt stand my ground to at least receive some sort of discount. I will be sending out further complaints again tomorrow. Once again: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive cupboard”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesisters255100
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 single Superior rooms at this hotel through Lastminute.com and paid GBP229 per night for each room in advance. All up we paid GBP931 to stay two nights. One room was tiny and down in the basement a long way from reception. The other room was even smaller with the tiniest bathroom imaginable. When you walked in the door you were almost in the bathroom. The cupboard was stuck over in a corner and was almost impossible to get at as it was behind the desk and bed. Definitely no room to open a suitcase unless it was on the bed. There was also a chair which was plonked in front of the desk, under which there was a stool. The chair was enormous and took up a quarter of the room. It was impossible to get to the wardrobe while it was in place. I think the door to the room must have been put on after the chair had been placed as when I tried to move it out it was very difficult to get through the doorway. It was a hazard in the room and a constant source of irritation and completely useless. I eventually dragged it out on to a landing and it's probably still there. There seemed to be a lot of staff hanging around the reception area not doing very much and needed direction to carry bags. Too expensive, rooms too small, staff untrained. They just haven't quite nailed it.

Reviews.Title: “good location, tiny but smart room, ameteur staff”
Reviews.Author: mgh444
Reviews.Content: It's a great location, central and close to the tube and lots of ammenities. As with all London hotels, the room was tiny, so if like us you have a baby cot in the room, there's hardly space for luggage. The staff seemed clueless generally and looked about 12. I suspect the hotel recruits the cheapest people possible. Housekeeping was not thorough - although the room was very clean when we arrived, without going into too many details we could tell the bathroom was not cleaned properly during our three night stay. The room was smartly appointed though. Price was cheap, so overall I would recommend it as long as your expectations are not too high, as the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kal537
Reviews.Content: I visit London on business every few months and found the Grand Royale through the Lastminute.com site. Very enjoyable experience, booked a single room but found myself upgraded to a Club Double. Very impressive service from check-in staff, in particular thanks to Gagan Ahuja who ensured I was well taken care for. I often stay at Hiltons & Crowne Plaza's in other cities and get far less service but pay 2-3 times the price ! Hotel has a nice, relaxed, cosy feel - and doesn't skimp on the mod-cons so all-in-all a very enjoyable experience. Couldn't fault the breakfast - a very impressive hot and cold buffet. Lovely old building with modern interiors. 5 stars all the way. I will definitely use this hotel for my next London trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: qwertyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: The Grand Royale is a beautiful old historic building, the staff were excellent as was the food, the rooms are tiny with the smallest bathroom I have ever seen however they were spotless and very well maintained. The level of care by the staff team and the atmosphere of the hotel went a long way in making up for the lack of space. I would definately stay there again and happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE THE BOILER EXCUSE”
Reviews.Author: MrJoshuaTree
Reviews.Content: On check in we fell victim to the boiler scam/fraud. My partner checked in prior to my arrival and was told that their boiler was broken and that we would be put up in their sister hotel nearby. Sister hotel is a hovel beside Paddington. A total kip of a hotel in a total kip of an area. And that's being nice to it. I kicked up a storm (and I really had to kick up a storm before they backed down). I pointed out that I had seen reference to this scam on TripAdvisor and that unless the boiler was out of action for over a year it was simply just a fraud. I demanded an upgrade, the first night (spent in the hovel) free and a 20% discount. This they agreed to as I was talking quite loudly at the check in desk. Another couple leaned in to tell me they had tried the same on them at check in. The hotel also, quite unbelievably, tried the same on the next couple checking in right behind us!! The 'upgrade' was to a v average room - their attempt at a suite. Goodness knows what the standard room must be like. Pros - beautiful wood-panelled check in area; great, safe and central location near tubes. Cons - swindlers who attempt to send you to another hotel (when I asked to see the rooms made empty by the boiler they refused to show them); massive breakfast queues; v dated old rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: chris7183
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room online - although seemingly well decorated - the finish is a bit shabby. The reception staff where poorly dressed for a hotel of this calibre - they where also argumentative and unhelpful - the room was so small I had trouble opening my case - the bed was comfortable and the location is excellent for tourists - don't be fooled by the old world charm that the online pics offer - in my opinion - this hotel does not deserve to carry a 4 star rating - England and London has far better to offer - def not a boutique hotel. And not a hotel I would choose to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Afford like the plague !!!”
Reviews.Author: liskatmic1
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel months ago for our first romantic weekend away together. We walk down Inverness Terrace and find hotel wrong hotel walk further down Inverness Terrace try and book in to get told only have single rooms available due to a maintenance issue. We booked a deluxe double !! The receptionist was not bothered in any way shape or form and was to busy chatting with other guests to look straight away for a new room for us. We get offered two single rooms on different floors (not accepted) so the receptionist offers us a transfer to a different hotel ok thats good so we think. Get in the taxi driver takes us to wrong hotel so another taxi ride to the right hotel and finally our room two and a half hours after arriving at the first wrong hotel and 4 hours after leaving our home. The hotel looked like somewhere where Miss Havisham from great expectations would stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Please PLEASE read this review! VERY important.”
Reviews.Author: MarcusFletcher
Reviews.Content: Ok, there's a LOT to say here. I will put this as direct and clear as possible. 1) This hotel is running a double-booking scam. FACT. We read the reviews beforehand, booked the room 3 months beforehand and honestly didn't think that the double booking fiasco would happen to us but true to form, we arrived and were told 'I'm sorry, I have some bad news'. We were told that they didn't have a room for us and would have to go elsewhere. I immediately demanded the manager and was furiously complaining. It would appear that it paid off after literally shouting, screaming and quoting Trip Advisor reviews to the manager and the staff. The many staff around simply held their heads down, you could tell this was commonpractice and happens often. But not to me. I refused to be treated like this and after the manager telling me to calm down, he headed to the computer and tapped about on it, eventually telling us that he HAD got a room on the 4th floor and that it was one of their club suites. We demanded to see the room before we paid and found a MASSIVE suite with 4 poster and huge bathroom with double sinks, wet room shower and standalone bath. It was beautiful. We had paid Â£150 for our booking. We later found out the room was over Â£400 that we stayed in. It pays to complain it would seem. I must admit, as I was ready for any double booking news, I was on the defensive and was ready to complain. I told the hotel manager (who was actually very nice) that I would not be treated like this and that the whole scam needs to stop! You cannot treat people like this, we had travelled 200 miles for this and whilst we were in reception, other guests heard me shouting and clearly some were also being transferred to a different hotel also. It was surreal to be in this very situation. I am so disgusted by this whole scam that I am complaining to Shaftesbury Hotels and will also be taking this to watchdog to see if we can get some TV coverage about this as it HAS TO STOP. There are people who will be staying at this hotel, oblivious to the scam and simply accept the transfer to another hotel without questioning. Also, on reading reviews, it would seem others who have complained have still been transferred. I was obviously raging enough for them to keep us quiet. Hence getting a Â£450 room for Â£150. My advice to people wanting to stay here is simple: THERE IS NO GUARANTEE that you will have a room here, if you've booked then be prepared to be told by some miserable Polish staff member that 'they have bad news'. What you do beyond there is up to you but if you complain hard enough, they will let you stay, but who would want to stay after that?! It ruined on our trip knowing that we'd been in this situation. No one should be subjected to that and I intend on getting to the bottom of this scam and fully exposing it and putting a stop to it for the sake of others. As for the room, it was beautiful but the furniture was tired and the cleaners attention to detail in the bathroom was a bit poor on the sinks. Didn't eat the food as ate somewhere else, did not want any other contact with the staff to be honest. We had an amazing night's sleep, average view. Wireless internet was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: MMMcCabe
Reviews.Content: I booked a superior single room online and warned (both online and by phone) that I would be arriving late in the evening. I needed to stay one night near Paddington before an early train to a meeting in Oxford. I arrived at 11.30 (reception area dismal, smelled of old cooking, reception staff desultory). There was a lot of telephoning and looking things up; I was told eventually that they didn't have a room for me, but that I would have to stay in a sister hotel. Taken there by taxi, that hotel smelled even worse -- I was sent to a tiny room in the basement -- certainly not superior, the basement was being refurbished, the furniture was dirty and scuffed. Bathroom OK. No apologies, no help with anything at all, just a demand for a deposit in case I watched any movies on the TV! Shameful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location.”
Reviews.Author: mike_farrell34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a friend stayed at the grand royale 4th July 2011, we had a very enjoyable 3night,4day stay,although the rooms were compact they had all that we required and the rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable.the location of the hotel was spot on being very close to queensway and bayswater tube station and across the road from Hyde park.the breakfast was excellent served in a beautiful dining room,although most of the staff were not English we couldn't complain about any of the service we received. The only downside was that the hotel windows were not double glazed or secondary double glazed and at times it was noisy,but after all we are in London and that wouldn't stop us from staying again,we hope to return soon we thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: antandruth
Reviews.Content: If you want a filthy room, with staff who can't speak English then this is the Hotel for you. They ran out of crockery at breakfast every day (and it really wasn't worth waiting for) and the idea of cleaning the tables was wiping everything on to the floor. We stayed four nights and they hadn't vacuumed before we arrived and didn't during our stay. There was hair in the bed and when we complained we were offered a room in the basement. They changed the sheets but they were a size too small which matched the duvet! Don't believe the 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Really great staff, great location. Would come back again and again”
Reviews.Author: ladyg17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night as we were going to a concert in London. The staff were very welcoming with all of our details to hand. We had booked a club room which was on the 6th floor. The room, as with most London hotels was small but very comfortable and clean. The bed was a king size and was very comfy. The bathroom had a bath and shower over which was a surprise as i was expecting just a shower room. We had a very small issue with the room but this was sorted immediately by the very helpful reception staff. Breakfast was included and there was plenty of it even though we did not come down to breakfast until 9.50am (breakfast closes at 10am weekdays). I have stayed in many city centre hotels all over the world during the last 15 years (as I travelled for work), this hotel was great and not at all like some of the reports on here. When booking this hotel you have to remember that this hotel is in an old building and therefore the rooms would not be large, but the nightâ€™s sleep was good and very comfortable. The added bonus of having free wifi was excellent. We will defiantly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Romanticoo7
Reviews.Content: It was pleasure staying in grand royal Hyde park hotel we had a wonderful greeting from the moment we arrived many thanks to the outstanding service of miss Anca at the reception desk the hotel is in a great location 2 min walk from metro station rooms has all modern amenities and are very clean we will sure choose it again

Reviews.Title: “Cosy is a bit on an understatement!”
Reviews.Author: kimg88
Reviews.Content: Staff could have been friendlier. Rooms are very small. We complained as we had a brick wall for a view. We were then told we had been upgraded to a Club room! We were not told this on arrival, nor were we told of any benefits we should have received with this upgrade. The rooms were nicely decorated, but very very small. Breakfast was ok. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for a budget price”
Reviews.Author: tnttravel2010
Reviews.Content: Staff efficent and polite. The place looked great. The room was clean, maybe a bit small but great for the price we paid. Would recommend as this must be pretty much the top end of budget prices. Great location for the Pulp gig at Hyde Park too. Hot water and clean bath and shower. But the fire alarm went off late in the morning and was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for London standards”
Reviews.Author: Redstripe4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in june 2011. The location is great, close to both Queensway station and Bayswater station, right outside Hyde Park. You basicly have anything you might need in the neighbourhood, grocery stores, Boots (pharmacy), good resturants and a shoppingmall with a movie theatre. The room was nice, but very small. The design of the room was modern, and so did the bathroom. (there is no shower curtain or anything though, so when you shower water sprayes everywhere). No minibar. The free WiFi was great, I used it a lot. All in all, nice but small room, but I did not think it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Do not visit here! Ruined our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Marriedmidwife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to this hotel at 22.40 on Wednesday evening-tired after our journey and looking forward to getting rid of our bags in our hotel room and heading to the bar for a nice refreshing drink but this of course did not happen! When we arrived and gave our names, the male receptionist proceeded to make a phone call and began speaking his own language (Asian) which I thought was extremely rude. Then he told us our room was DOUBLE BOOKED and we'd have to go to another hotel for the night!!!! Not one mention of sorry or not one bit apologetic! He told us he'd get a taxi for us but if we wanted breakfast we'd have to return to this hotel before 10am plus make our own way back-a taxi was not offered! Eventually, at 23.30 a driver picked us up to take us to our replacement hotel-Kensington Close Hotel for the night but he had trouble finding this hotel! I had to point it out to him eventually! Oh my God what a dump of a room we were landed into-honeslty a singel room in a 3 bedded terrace house is bigger! It was just a disgrace! But we were just so tired at this stage we just went to bed and didn't kick up a fuss! Throughout our 3 night stay at the Grand Royale we were never apologised to or offered any concessions! Our room was ok-it was clean, but again, very compact! Breakfast was a joke-each morning we had to queue for a table. Then you had to queue for cooked breakfast, which was constantly running out so you'd have to wait for more sausages/bread for toast/orange juice etc. It just was not worth the money! While we were waiting for the driver to take us to our replacement hotel for the night, I overheard another couple checking in, but only to be told the same thing as us:'Your room is double booked'! The only positive about this hotel was the location, but even this won't make us return to this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - for London!”
Reviews.Author: kat1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend after attending a concert in Hyde Park and picked this place so we could walk back afterwards. However, it's very close proximity to Bayswater and Queensway tube stations was very useful. The hotel is in a good location and I felt safe out and about at night. On arrival we were greeted warmly, first by the porter and then by the receptionist. It was extremely busy that weekend due to a number of events in London and we were asked to swap from a twin to 2 single rooms (no extra cost) which was actually a bonus for us as they were next to each other! Check-in was efficient and we were allowed to our rooms early at 1pm. The rooms themselves were small, but adequate, comfortable and clean. My bathroom was much bigger than my friends, although I have seen smaller in London! Free wifi was also a bonus. The only disappointment was the breakfast as the staff were overwhelmed and we had to wait to be seated, wait for juice to be refilled, wait for sausage and bacon and were never asked if we wanted hot drinks or toast - I expect much more from such a hotel. However, when it came out (despite the rush from other guests) there was a very good choice and the food was good. At checkout, again the porters were immediately helpful in taking our bags for day storage and there was no fuss at reception. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “tiny ,stuffy, dirty”
Reviews.Author: nyfan01
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary and to see bon jovi at hyde park, hence the location, even though I e-mailed a special request to the hotel through late rooms telling them it was our 27th wedding anniversary on the day of arrival (23rd june) and asked if we could have a nice room, high floor with air con, what we got was a tiny, dirty,stuffy room with a broken chair and a view of a brick wall! went to reception and told them I was not happy, I was shown another two rooms to be honest not much different than the one we were given, we took room 212 it was a tiny bit bigger but not much! but still not very clean,the manager sent up a small bottle of wine by way of an apology which was nice but the rooms are VERY tired and dirty and far too small for two adults plus luggage! and the air con needs serviced not much cool air coming out of unit and as london can get very warm air con is a must!!! couldn;t even open a window overpriced for what you get..would I book this hotel again ? probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very small room”
Reviews.Author: zmyusof
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel or 2 nights in May 2011. We arrived at the hotel quite early but only managed to check in at the normal check in time around 2.30pm. The hotel is very much strategically located in Bayswater busy area and the tube station is very close by. Room is clean but very very small. once we put our luggage there is practically no other place that you can be other than on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Service needs Improving”
Reviews.Author: badk70
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the room was ok but quite small and not much room to move about the bedside tables were squashed to close to bed. The service of staff was quite poor, i heard a couple say they come from Australia and the room was taken when they booked online and been waiting 8 hours to sort, and another couple waiting since 8am for the room. The shower was really good and big powerful very nice, the staff were all foreign but expected in london, they really need more training in customer services, overall a good hotel breakfast was nice, not bad for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent foyer, tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: bcmegan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice last year, once in April for three days and again in early June for one night. When we first arrived, we were very impressed with the hotel lobby which is beautifully decorated - but overheated. We had the benefit of cheap internet rates on lastminute.com and were not too surprised when we found our room to be very tiny. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was also good. There was absolutely no room for our luggage and we had to leave it in front of the door overnight and unpack on top of our bed when we needed anything. The dining room was also sumptuous and we enjoyed good service and nice food at 12 pounds per head. Location is great being right opposite Hyde Park, and very near to the Underground station. Overall, the hotel was quite satisfactory and very cheap for inner London. Just don't take too much luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: rovers100
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night on 20th June 2011. We were placed in the 'lower ground floor' (ie basment) which was a bit daunting at first. The downsides to the room was poor view (below path level), double not kingsize bed and the shower curtain spilled water all over the bathroom floor onto the carpet outside. This carpet was wet when we arrived in the room. The upside to the room was it was clean, modern good tv/kettle etc and plenty big enough for the two of us. The hotel itself was fine, the staff helpful and the breakfast great. \the location is good, 2 mins walk from the Queensway tube, 10 from marble arch. Not too much to do around the hotel and no Starbuks/Costa for miles!!! Overall a good, clean hotel which is all you need really if your not staying too long. Would book again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great location and exception service”
Reviews.Author: bob31367
Reviews.Content: Stayed for eight nights, and almost everything was perfect. First, the staff is incredible, from the bell boys, to the reception desk, to the breakfast staff. Waking up, and going up to the second floor beautiful large breakfast buffet, was one of the highlights. They had four or five people working the buffet, serving coffee or tea, and cleaning up, as fast as you were finished. They always were more than polite, and always had smiles on their faces, nice way to wake up. Location, Location, Location, a half block from Hyde Park, and two major tube stations, and on a major bus line, whoa, you couldn't be better located. Around the block, all kinds of shops and places to eat, and the hotel is located on a very quite street. The only thing I would warn anyone about, the rooms are very very small. Most in London are. The rooms are very well appointed, and the bath is beautiful. Would stay again, but warn them, they can't raise their prices much more.

Reviews.Title: “not a good relation quality/price”
Reviews.Author: furious57
Reviews.Content: A room "single deluxe" of 2X1 square meters is not worthy 200 euros at night (+ continental breakfast) as they charge. It is not even in downtown Lodon, but underground distance. Do not let you impress by the lobby, because that is the only large space in this hotel, according to my experience. In the room there was no room even for a small table. Caffe pot had to be set in a stool, and the tabacco box by the bed only can hold the tlf. Closet was half closed and was set in the only space availble, not making possible to open the window for ventilation (but door can not be locked for "security reasons...". It was imposible to move around in the room, even with a small suitcase! You have to jump into the bed to be able to go the closet. And this is a Deluxe , 200 euros a night , room... Avoid it! The noise of the elevator is unvereable, also, sin ce 6 o'clok in the morning. This seems like a room in Liliput!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, terrible service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Simstar_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May & after spending 3 weeks in the US travelling prior to arriving in London, we really noticed when this hotel was not up to standard. When we first arrived, they had no record of our booking (which was made on their website) despite us having a printed copy. After an overnight flight from the US via Iceland, we were tired, hungry & thirsty so the last thing we felt like doing was sitting in their lounge room waiting for them to sort it out - which took about 30 minutes! 'Lucky' for us, they gave us some bottles of water. We then found our room, which was on the lower ground level - my boyfriend at 6 ft 6 inches tall hit his head on several occasions getting in & out of the room (very low ceilings). Our room itself was tiny, with a really awkward bathroom - it sounds odd but no shower curtain or glass meant water went everywhere!! The free WiFi had no reception where our room was which was frustrating. Also, the room had an awful smell - like cigarette smoke or mouldy water or pungent dirt - anything is possible when your room is in a basement! Breakfast was free & had many choices but none of them were enjoyable - even the hash browns were dry & tough! I'd have been happy if they kept it simple but quality. The day we were checking out, an older gentleman had issues with his room & the staff did not appear to be listening or helping. It got to the point where he demanded to speak to the manager, who happened to be off-site. I'm not sure what got resolved, but when we left it didn't look like they were doing much! The location of this hotel was on a beautiful, tree-lined street & the lobby area felt very 'old charm London'. Queensway & Bayswater tube stations are an equal & very brief walking distance away, making access to all the sights fantastic. Hyde Park is literally at the end of the street, giving the area a lovely feel. But none of that made up for it. Definitely would not stay here again, there are too many other great options in London (& other options on the same street even!).

Reviews.Title: “Very well priced hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BlackPanther4
Reviews.Content: Well located for two tube lines and buses into the centre of London. Clean and well priced. Rooms on the small side but as a base it was fine. A PC in the lounge provided free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Would have no hesitation in returning”
Reviews.Author: DuvetDreamer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is only minutes walk from both Bayswater and Queensway tube stations which are just in the next street and it is easy to walk to Notting Hill, Kensington etc. The rooms are small but modern, tidy and clean. The hotel lobby, sitting area and bar are really nice with some amazing features. Staff were friendly and helpful. For the price (considering it is London) and the location, it is worth a trip - only marked down because the room was a little small and we didn't realise until check out that we were entitled to breakfast so didn't get a chance to enjoy that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: davidbrown257
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a good central location and is very good value. particularly for business travelers who need something more personal than the big chain hotels can provide. Excellent & professional service from check-in through to room service. Modern, clean and stylish bedrooms, very well equipped and comfortable. Breakfast is very good, with a great selection and very appetising. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: irelandladyluck
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for night.We found this hotel to be average at best the room size was not too bad.The bathroom was tiny to use the sink you had to leave the door opened.It had showe gel and shampoo no body cream and no hair conditor. No way to open window in the room i do not like this i like to be able to open a window in staying in a room the AC was not too bad. We olny had brekfast there so can not say much on the food.I would not eat brekfast there as it is buffet and i do not like this i can not understand hotel that are 4 star cannot freshly cook a brekfast for people. It was failrly central for using the tube as there was 2 in walking distance. I dont think i would stay there again i did not think that it was good value for money as they size of the room were tiny and the brekfast let it down badly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee_uae
