Reviews.Content: Avrege hotel has good location , very small rooms, house keeping was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Unfair Practice”
Reviews.Author: Kev6969
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as a surprise so we did not have the opportunity to research the reviews found here. It seems to be common practice to keep accepting bookings and shifting guests to other locations under all sorts of pretences. We arrived on the 3rd of June at 5pm to be informed by an unhelpful female receptionist that there was an issue with the internet bookings and that there was no room available for us and we would have to be relocated to another hotel, as I had previously experienced this practice with another hotel I requested to see the manager who would not meet me to discuss the situation but relayed a message of a 15% discount which we have not received as of 13/06. I did not accept the internet excuse being offered as I also work in the IT industry. I then asked why we were not notified before arrival but got no reply, the receptionist was well versed and used to dealing with annoyed guests in this practice and gave us the same line on cancelling our booking and looking for accommodation elsewhere as was offered to other guests, also we were not alone on that day as there were other guests experiencing the same issue with some accepting the excuses readily. I then contacted DHR/JacTravel and informed them of the issue and they contacted the hotel and basically were informed we had no other choice but to stay the first night in the other hotel and move back up in the morning, this room was supposed to be a club room but as you will see from the attached photo it had two single beds pushed together. We did this and left our bags and checked in on the 4th of June to be given a tiny room on the 6th floor with a broken window catch and no room to open the drawer on the table at the end of the bed - the room was too small for the bed and our luggage so we rejected this and was relocated to another room which was slightly bigger. On the 5th of June we were contacted by reception about payment for the final night of our trip by a nice mannered male receptionist and we went down to reception to again look to meet the manager but again no one was available so we gave a copy of our pre-paid booking to the desk and informed him to advise that we would be lodging a formal complaint to the hotel board in due course. Summing up the hotel are fortunate that they have a good location which captures the bookings for them. I have passed our experience to my legal team and will let them check if this practice is in breach of any UK consumer protection laws.

Reviews.Title: “Well done to the staff”
Reviews.Author: Petrovic_59
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest of this chain of Hotels (Shaftesbury Hotels) and this is indeed one of their best hotels. I am writing this review because i now witnessed for the third time their habit of moving people from one Hotel to the other for no apparent reason but to maximize occupancy. I have seen on all 3 ocasions the pressure that the Reception staff is subject and they deserve a word of incentive and appraisall because they do a fantastic job. I know that the boiler excuse is a lie because i travel allways with my business partners and we are always given rooms on different floors and there was never an issue with hot water. Well done to all the staff working in The Grand Royal and a big minus to those who make them do their dirty tricks.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice and would go again”
Reviews.Author: kateandcaroline
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice now and although the hotel rooms are small this is central london and very resonable. We used it as a base for going to the wireless festival last summer and new years eve this year. We enjoy the area surrounding wihich has a wealth of cafes and restaurants, a great little community. The hotel is near 2 tube stations and you can walk through the park to Harrod's etc. The breakfast is ok, standard buffet, the rooms clean, service good. I have had no problems with this hotel and would use again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zaza80_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and staff deserve the time that i took writing this small review. I had a problem with my connection flight and i was stuck with limited money and no room to sleep in. Its not a budget hotel but it was the only one i could find online selling rooms at the time. Relunctantly i booked it for Â£170 for the night and i can now tell that i would book it for the double of the price just because of its carachteristics and staff attitude. Location, atmosphere and staff are ideal. The Receptionists were very helpfull and quick. I will be back definetly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: holaba
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has an amazing and welcoming lobby, The breakfast was top and the staff really helpful. Couldnt see any reason for so many complaints. I think people can get really picky nowadays. Its a Â£90 a night Hotel in the heart of London not in a beach in Bali.Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mairead39
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grande Royale London Hyde Park on 28-05-2011. We had planned this trip as a special treat and therefore did not mind booking a room at Â£157 per night. On arrival, the entrance to the hotel is very impressive which further hightens your expectations for a comfortable stay in a nice hotel room. However, the room we were given (room 102) was so small, I do not feel it was worth the rates charged at all. The smal shower room was directly inside the main door to the room with a a smal fights of steps leading to a room measuring approximately 9ft square. The room really only holds the bed with a few pieces of furniture shoe horned in. It was not possible to sit on the chair at the small dressing table as it hit against the foot of the bed. It was difficult to walk up one side of the bed without triping on or getting tangled up in the curtains! The bed was exceptionally hard so I did not sleep well at all. I stay in London hotels every week and this room is in no way usual in terms of price (expensive), size or level of comfort. Besides breakfast, the only food available in the hotel is sandwiches in the bar (seemingly only toasted cheese and ham on the evening we stayed). You can get reception to order a pizza. We went out for dinner and decided to go back to the hotel bar for a night cap. Unforunately, we could not have the Irish Coffee we ordered as the hotel does not keep fresh cream (4 star?). There is no parking available so we were directed to a local car park which ost Â£25 for 24 hours. Overall, we were very disappointed with this hotel and left feeling that we had not received value for money! I really could not recommend it to anyone. I can see that the manager of the hotel has responded to some other reviews expressing how the hotel takes customer opinion seriously and that the hotel will make every effort to improve. Unfortunately unless they knock down some walls to make the rooms a reasonable size, I struggle to see how this can be achieved.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mopseking
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows that London isn't the cheapest place but this hotel is good value for money. The rooms and especially bathrooms are very small but also very new and clean, which is rare in London for that price. It's in 3 minutes walking distance to Bayswater tube station and Mc Do, Burger King and Starbucks are there as well. The Hotel is located in a nice street and we had a room on the backside. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but they TRIED to calculate us one ;-(

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: Fuller1981
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for four days while visiting family and friends in the city and given some of the negative reviews, felt I should even the score somewhat. My criteria was: four star, with character, providing a comfortable and affordable base with good access to central London. This hotel certainly ticked all of the boxes and I would not hesitate in using again. There is very little in London that is appropriately or realistically priced, but I got a superior double room at the Grande Royale for less than Â£100 per night which was very reasonable when compared to others. But note that I used a comparison website â€“ do not believe the claim on their own website that you will get â€œbest rates guaranteedâ€� â€“ I did a quick check and found the prices hugely inflated. If youâ€™re using the tube, this hotel is perfectly located â€“ you have stations to the Central, District and Circle lines within a two-minute walk. Itâ€™s on a beautiful side street, opposite Hyde Park and without two much passing traffic. As the website suggests, the interior is truly stunning â€“ wood panelled walls, stained glass windows and plenty of character. Staff were polite and helpful, but I did make a note to arrive as soon as checking was possible, because of some reviews suggesting this hotel chain routinely move people to other hotels, citing one reason or another. The room was tiny, so god knows what a â€œstandardâ€� room would be like but it was very tastefully furnished and immaculately clean. I suspect it has been refurbished in the not too distant passed and while I cannot stand a lumpy bed, one that is perhaps new and rather too hard for my liking wasnâ€™t ideal, but I didnâ€™t feel I should complain about new furnishings! My room was always cleaned to a high standard, so plus points for that. And finally, I didnâ€™t try the breakfast, but had a look both in the dining room and the bar, both of which lovely and maintained the historic ambience of the building. On reflection, it wasnâ€™t perfect, but there is a damn sight worse out there which costs double the money, so I would not hesitate in going back provided the rates donâ€™t increase beyond Â£100 per night. Itâ€™s a beautiful building and superbly located for anyone navigating central London.

Reviews.Title: “Granddd in everything”
Reviews.Author: Ivana016
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, easy tube conections, very very clean room.... Thanks, I will certainly stay here again and will recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Service and room size terrible”
Reviews.Author: ErmerP
Reviews.Content: A stunning building from the outside and the public rooms gorgeous and full of history but thats about as good as it gets. Arrived to no smile or welcome from any of the 3 receptionists. The room was the smallest I ever stayed anywhere. Don't bring too much with you and stay alone if you want space. It is ridiculously small. Had a shower in the smallest bathroom ever and grabbed a towel which had a chewing gum wrapper on it. It needs a good clean and refresh. Breakfast however was good, full English or continental options and service swift and friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel and other Shaftesbury hotels at all cost”
Reviews.Author: ARBSydney
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe double room at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park for 3 nights, 19-22 May 2011. We arrived about 9.30pm, where we were informed by reception staff that due to a problem with the boiler at the hotel, there was no accommodation available for us. It seems that the boiler breakdown excuse!! has been used on guests previously (See previous postings). The unhelpful and arrogant receptionist (I think her name was suzanna), could offer no reason as to how rooms were still being offered at the hotel on their website for this same evening, albeit at double the price we had booked. Interestingly, rooms were also being shown as available on other booking sites. We were offered alternative accommodation at a sister hotel, Shaftesbury Premier London Notting Hill. We made our way to this hotel and fortunately requested to view the room first. This alternative room which was described as their club room, was located in the basement level and was not what we would consider an upgrade, or even comparable to what we had expected at the Grand Royale. I agree with a previous review that the practices of the Shaftesbury Hotels are dishonest, misleading and not consistent with fair trade practices. It would appear that the Grand Royale Hotel accepts bookings over and above their room allocations and as a result is able to provide guests to their lesser establishments. There must be a law against this practice and I intend to pursue this matter further.

Reviews.Title: “Good locations, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: raquelbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms, one double club room for my husband and myself and one standard twin for my son and daughter teenagers. My kids got a tiny room and bathroom in the basement and we got a tiny room in the 6th floor. It seems that the rooms were originally ment for smaller beds. For example in the club room there is a desk and under it there is a small bench that one cannot use because there is no suficient space between he bed and the desk. Room size is the real problem with this hotel. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, breakfast is good and the location is excellent. Price was good. If you don't care about the size of the room, just go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost but not quite!”
Reviews.Author: RealisticLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of May. This hotel is initially quite impressive and the rooms are small but comfortable and clean. The hotel claims to be 4 star but it's more like 3. The breakfast was excellent and served in the distorts dining rooms. However there are number if things that let the hotel down which if resolved would bring the hotel. Firstly the sign at the front looks a bit filmsy and even says it's temporary. The staff are very friendly but didn't seem to have any local knowledge and over heard them failing miserably to provide people with local information. The next problem is the bar it's tucked at the back in the historic theatre bit but it is not inviting, has no atmosphere and service is terrible. Eg sherry served in a wine glass and filled up! And champagne served in without any proper wine glasses. It would be much better to move the bar into the main sitting which has more atmosphere but no centre point. They could then serve tea, coffee and drinks all day and this would create this desired atmosphere. Finally in my moans is just the general finish isn't up to standard. The corridors are just a bit tired and battered, the central stair case has it's plastic hand rail joints melted to try and make them join together and the window in our room was very drafty as it didn't close well, I would imagine it would be pretty chilly on a cold winters night! Overall though it was a good place to stay for the price but there some things they could sort easily to make it a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Clean Room.”
Reviews.Author: 298570Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very beautiful hotel located near Queensway and Bayswater station. The location are good and the room are clean. The room was real small but Im okay with it. There's one thing that I would like to complain about - THE ATTITUDE OF SOME OF THE RECEPTIONISTS ARE UNACCEPTABLE! When we first reach the hotel, they didnt greet us and took a long time to checked us in. And during the stay in the hotel, I found out that there's this young lady working in front desk ( I should have remember her name ) that annoyed me because she always gave me and my family the very umcomfortable look. And since the day we checked in until the day we checked out, she never greet us and smile to us. ( Im very unhappy because she didnt do that to other guests!) But well, there are also some really helpful receptionists. Oh and the guys that helped us to carry our luggage to and from the room are very friendly. Overall my experience in this hotel wasnt bad but they need to seriously improve on the attitude of the receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “cramped & basic”
Reviews.Author: JScott2090
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel we were quite blown away as to how elegant it looked from the outside. Were greeted at reception & checked in. The room wasn't ready for another hour so we left our bags & went for a walk into Kensington Park, yes Kensington Park. Hyde park is a good 1 mile walk from the hotel. We headed back to the hotel & went up to our rooms. The corridors are incredibly cramped and difficult to let people by if you have luggage with you. I hoped they had sacrificed corridor space to make the rooms larger. Wrong. They were just as cramped and very basic. The view wasn't much to go by either. Considering the room i booked was given the name of 'superior double room' it was quite disappointed. there was no more than a 3ft gap from the end of the bed to opposite wall. I investigated the en suite & found that i could wash my hands while sat on the loo, you had very little room to turn around or put any of your wash things. The sink also rotated, which was quite concerning. Oh & if you want your bedside lamps on in the evening, you have to have your en suite light on otherwise they wont work. I met a friend on the friday evening & hoped for a few drinks in the Hotels bar only to find they had no hand pulled beers, only bottles & spirits. 2 half pint bottles of beer cost Â£8. The music that was being played didn't fit the hotels surroundings or historic image it's trying to have. i believe the bar man may of had his ipod on 'R&B best hits'. We quickly left & found another pub around the corner. Over all i wasn't blown away with this hotel & have definitely stayed in better. I'd certainly think twice about staying here again. Don't be fooled by the grander, it's not all what it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel group at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Graham1961
Reviews.Content: Recently I booked two double rooms for two nights in April 2011 at the Shaftesbury Metropolis London Hyde Park Hotel for myself and my daughter who had to be in London for an interview for a place at a London University. On the day we were due to travel I was contacted by the Shaftesbury Metropolis London Hyde Park Hotel first by telephone then a confirmation e-mail advising me that they had unavoidable maintenance problems and had made alternative accomodation arrangements for myself and my daughter at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park Hotel. Although not entirely happy with this myself and my daughter duly arrived at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park Hotel just before midnight (I wrote on the booking form at the ' that we would be arriving late that evening) and when we went to the desk to check in we were informed that this hotel, the Grand Royale London Hyde Park Hotel, had a broken boiler and therefore there were no available rooms. I should also point out that at no time during that day any attempt was made to contact myself to advise me of this probem prior to us travelling to London, also the staff at the desk said it had been broken since around 10:30 am that morning and we did not leave our house until 7:15pm that evening. After being told at check in about the broken boiler the hotel staff were basically dismissing any protestations that they had to find ourselves alternative accomodation of a similar standard, it should also be noted that there were also around a dozen other people as well as ourselves in the same situation, having arrived at that hotel late in the evening, after lots of arguing the desk staff contacted there reservation people and we were again informed that no alternative accomodation could be sought, and that we could, if we wished cancel our booking and find our own alternative accomodation, thus taking the onus away from the hotel to find us alternative accomodation, everyone effected by this pointed out that this was not acceptable and the hotel should find alternative accomodation, after another lengthy period of the desk staff calling their reservation people they came back and said all they could offer us was a two star hotel in Harrow which is in North West London or a Hotel at Heathrow Airport, neither of these locations would have been practical as we needed to be in Central London for my daughters University interview at around nine thirty that morning. At this point I personally managed to source a twin room at a hotel in Earls Court, which although not all that practicle I decided to take it, as at this point it was now around one forty in the morning of the 13th of April and we were both very tired. I should also point out that hotel guests who obviously had rooms were turning up and going to there rooms, when I challenged the desk staff asking why can these people have access to their rooms when there is no functioning boiler, his answer was that the broken boiler only affects some of the rooms, being cynical I would suggest that they were overbooking hoping people would no-show and they could charge twice for one room. All this time the desk staff were Rude, dismissive of the plight people were in and basically treating everyone, whom they could not find alternative accomodation for as a hindrance to them. On no account would I ever ever consider booking accomodation with the Shaftesbury hotels chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great experience, central location”
Reviews.Author: BabyPanda3
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveller going to London for a reunion with an old school friend. On arrival, the place was clean and tidy and the staff were very friendly. I had my bags taken up to my room and was offered complimentary tea and biscuits whilst I waited for my room to be ready. I had arrived and 11.30am and check-in time isn't until 2pm. I was hungry and tired and asked if I could have a room sooner than 2pm and within about 1/2 an hour, I was given a room. I had booked a double room as I like space and comfort. My room was compact and tidy and the bathroom was quite modern and looked fairly new. There is a huge tv on wall and I had a lovely view of the street below. There is also tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms and fresh flowers on the desk. Each room also comes with a wardrobe and a safe. My stay was for 3 days and 2 nights and when I unpacked my clothes, there were all wrinkled from my journey. I asked at the front desk for an iron and ironing board and received it right away. Whenever a request is made it is taken care of right away. There isn't a proper restaurant on the premises but there is a fair size breakfast restaurant in the basement where complimentary breakfast is served. You have a choice of a full English breakfast, fruit, cereal, croissants, toast, bread rolls, juices, teas and coffee. Check-out time is at 12 noon but if you are travelling later, they will keep your luggage and you can go out shopping and collect it when you are ready to leave. The hotel is also centrally located and is usually not more than a 10-minute taxi ride from places like, Buckingham Palace, Covent Gardens, London Eye. It is also a 10-minute walk from Paddington Station. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone as I had a pleasant stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: ana_vanessa97
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic the service is really good (Thanks Ajay!!) and the rooms are just perfect. I have stayed in London numerous times and I am used to tiny little rooms any where you end up booking, but surprisingly while booking a deluxe double room they have upgraded me to a club room. The room was much bigger than what you will normally find in another 4 star hotel. I will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Shaftsbury Group 'shafts' another punter! - Underhand and in breach of the law.”
Reviews.Author: Flora111
Reviews.Content: .The Grande Royale is the recruitment mechanism for clientelle to all the other hotels belonging to the Shaftsbury group in the London area. Do not be conned by the photographs, allusions to history etc. The lower the internet rate you pay, the more your chances of actually getting your foot past reception are diminshed. I had barely had time to put my luggage down when the receptionist announced that I was being moved to the Shaftsbury Hyde Park International, 50 metres north, up Inverness Terrace and that a cab would take me there. When the cab arrived, the driver went ballastic at the receptionist, protesting that it was just up the road and that he wasn't going to waste his time negotiating the one way traffic system! It became evident that this was not a private hire, but the hotel's own default shuttle system, a fleet of which was parked outside waiting to transport unsuspecting punters to other Shaftsbury accommodation. Of course, this unrequited outburst on the part of this employee was embarrasing, to the extent that I opted to follow his advice and walk the 50 metres. Only a few hours prior to arrival, The Grande Royale was still taking internet bookings. It is no wonder then that it needs a shiny fleet of silver, people carriers. At best the Shaftsbury group is embracing a practice which is under-hand, unfair and dishonest. At worst, it is in breach of the law, and I refer to the Description of Goods Act. I had requested a quiet room, away from the lift shafts and on a high floor. Instead, I got a trek to The Hyde Park International where I was allocated a room by the lift shaft, which overlooked a very noisy youth hostel across the road with a group of back packers for next dooor neighbours who saw fit to relay race up and down the very narrow passages of this rabbit warren whilst knocking back as much alcohol as they could muster. Please.............. Steer clear unless you want to waive your right to exercise your own criteria with regard to freedom of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Grand in everything”
Reviews.Author: bug_gil7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights in Grand Royale and I absolutely loved it they upgraded me to the Lily Langtry Suite . I must say is absolutely stunning suite. The manager was polite and helpful he even had time to escort us to the room and explain us the story of the building. Top noch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nonifrancis
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and found the service excellent and the facilities very good value. Whilst my single room was very compact, it was perfect for my needs and I slept better than in many other more expensive hotels. The breakfast and lounge areas are beautiful and really made my stay special. I will certainly stay here again and will recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: LANWANMAN
Reviews.Content: The Grand Royale is a First Class hotel. The holel is a classical architecture that has been recently restored. The period wood paneling, ceiling artwork and stained glass windows provide you with an atmosphere of the grandure that was England at its finest. The staff were intent on providing the very best service to ensure our stay was perfect. The Duty Manager, \mr Ahiya was truly outstanding..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ScunthorpeRobinson
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel the service is first class - I left my trousers in the room and they have been found and forwarded onto my which I feel is excellent. A lovely breakfast to set you up for the day, easy tube conections and local shops and restaurants within walking distance. An excellent "London" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: citizen66
Reviews.Content: I was moved here from an alternative hotel and ended up in a better room. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was quiet and had everything in it. It wasn't huge but quite adequate. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For a 4 star hotel I would expect much more!”
Reviews.Author: PRO-VIP-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Room: 112 Class: Club Double Room + Breakfast (Refundable Deal, Breakfast Included) Price: Â£125 pn For a 4 star hotel I would expect to have a proper bathroom, not just a shower; the hand basin was half the size of the toilet bowl and the lid of the toilet bowl was cracked. All complimentary cosmetics were made in China with a horrid smell! I also had complimentary drinks, but when I wanted to drink them at night, there was no bottle opener. I can't give this 'hotel' more than ** stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great service”
Reviews.Author: slavkova223
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels through out the world with my partner and we have a few that we remember for the right reasons and an awful lot that we remember for the wrong ones. Grand Royale we will always for the majesty of the lobby, the charm of the bar and the wonderful breakfast room. The rooms are as the other reviewers say "small" and if you are fussy about size you are going to be upset when you see the rooms. But incredibly they fitted every possible thing that you need inside it. This alone is worth to book for one night at least. A big thanks for all the staff at reception specially to Daisy who gave us some tips about restaurants and events.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff.”
Reviews.Author: free2fly349
Reviews.Content: It would really help if this hotel would hire front desk personnel who actually like working with the public. I have staye here a total of three times hoping that would change. The only that has changed is that the rooms have been renovated. The rooms are very very small. Like the other reviews have stated " I feel like I insulted the front desk clerk just by checking in" very unfriendly. Every visit has had a plumbing problem this is nothing new. I have always been very generous tipping all employees as well and I dont know why, Im never treated very nicely. Why have I stayed here three times?? The location..it is excellent and I love Bayswater area. Next time I think its about time I change hotels. I love the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful and Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: johnpinnington
Reviews.Content: Situated very close to Kensington Gardens and many restaurants and shops. Hotel has wonderful lounge, dining hall, bar and reception area. Staff all helpful. Breakfast very good and peaceful, bright atmosphere. our room was disappointing as it was very small and in basement area with no view. Bed and en suite facilities were very good. We complained and the duty manager gave us a 25% reduction which was a pleasant surprise. It meant we paid Â£89 for B and B, which we thought was excellent value for the middle of London.

Reviews.Title: “"Are you a tourist or a traveler?" - Paul Bowles”
Reviews.Author: RLSJC
Reviews.Content: If you are a thoroughgoing tourist, you might want to stay away from the Grand Royale. The rooms are as small as the other reviewers claim, and they are not for the infirm, the obese, or the spoiled and cranky. But just last weekend I stayed in a huge hotel room with two (American) queen-sized beds--in Melbourne, Florida, where there is nothing to do but go to a mall or--six miles aways--a beach with a CVS drugstore and a Wendy's. Believe me, I'd rather be in my tiny room at the Grand Royale and experiencing London, both inside and out. True, the Grand Royale IS in a touristy neighborhood, and not the swankiest one either. Though there is a Hilton around the corner, there is also an ill-kept hostel across the street with peeling paint and loud international teens. But the comparison that struck me most came on a misty Sunday morning as I cross the street for a stroll through Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. Paintings for sale lined the park side of Bayswater Road, and a series of elegant townhouses graced the opposite side of the street. It reminded me of a similar scene along New York's Central Park--only instead of staying in an outrageously expensive room on Fifth Avenue, I was staying in a modestly-priced room in a building designed by royalty and used by royalty as a pied a terre. When I returned from my walk, I would once again be ensconced--as were Lillie Langtry and future King Edward VII--in a lobby with gleaming carved-wood walls and furniture, beautiful windows, huge paintings, a fireplace and welcoming, comfortable leather couches and chairs. I would walk up an imposing red-carpeted staircase with painting ceilings in the stairwell to enjoy my English breakfast buffet in an ornate gold and white room, waited on by an energetic, competent, attentive and cheerful staff. But, unlike Lily and Edward, I would also have access to the hotel's computer and internet service, two tube stations within easy walking distance, a bustling multicultural neighborhood with great cheap restaurants, and every modern amenity in my room--which I concede might have been considered small even for a servant of Lily and Edward. Still, it was equipped with comfortable beds and linens, a fridge, slippers and bathrobes, a split of wine with wine glasses, and a selection of fruits and beverages. True, you need to aim the shower carefully to avoid flooding the room, but oh what a heavenly bathtub--just perfect after long days of admittedly tourist pursuits. The point I'm trying to make with my Paul Bowles quote is that if you measure the success of your vacation merely by the size of your room, you will not be happy here. I don't know how four-star ratings are achieved, but Grand Royale rooms are definitely not ranked for their spaciousness. And just so you know, my so-called "spacious club twin room" was just a regular twin room with the two beds pushed together, no space in between. The club treatment was simply the wine, robes, etc. Breakfast was also included with the club rate, and that rate was at least $50 USD less per day than any other 4-star hotel I investigated--and I checked out dozens. Many of the others did not include breakfast or free internet, both of which were important to me, but most of all, no other hotel was so uniquely and authentically English in its history and enduring charm. Other reviewers liked the hotel but faulted the staff, but I thought they were great. The hotel seemed full to me, but it might be overbooked in summer, so perhaps the staff has less attention to spare during those months. During my visit, however, everyone who helped me was exceedingly prompt, competent, and gracious. I did have to ask for a couple of things--the "club" treatment was missing from the room when we first arrived, and a curtain had to be re-hung when I accidentally knocked it down while opening the room's window--but these things were taken care of within minutes. To understand my high ranking of this hotel, please understand that it has little to do with its size or pretentiousness--it has very little of those things--and much to do with its charm, location, and history.

Reviews.Title: “A complete con, don't be fooled by cheap rates”
Reviews.Author: Little_robbie
Reviews.Content: Unable to really review what looks a beautiful hotel in an excellent location. We booked late on line for Â£80, deluxe room only, but on arrival were told they had a problem with their boiler and we had to move to a sister hotel, the shaftsbury metropolis. However people in other, full price, rooms were not moved, each room has it's own boiler perhaps? They were still selling rooms online might I add. They claimed they were calling a cab to take us to the (cramped and out if the way) sister hotel but it was clearly their own shuttle as we'd seen it leave with some other poor victim as we arrived! Stay well clear of the cheap last minute deals, but the hotel looked lovely, the shaftsbury isn't, it's a dump, and the corridor on floor 1 smells like someone has taken a dump in it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: aliceresevil
Reviews.Content: Traveled here from the US and stayed for 3 days, 2 nights. Hotel was lovely inside and out, location was great and convenient to parks and Tube, with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The staff was very attentive and helpful in every respect. The room itself was a bit small but so are most in London. Overall, a wonderful stay. I would definitely return here in the future! :)

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, quite a good location, quite good service, quite good everything”
Reviews.Author: PhilSmith_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was literally 2 minutes from the queensway tube which was very convenient, and though close to a busy street was very quiet. Service was quite good (breakfast staff were good), though could perhaps do with a polish at reception. Room was pretty small -pretty sure we paid for the deluxe double, but ended up with a superior - hey ho. Was comfortable and clean and had all the right amenities (Twinings tea being the best part). Shower was never incredibly hot, and seemed to have a bit of leak in the system somewhere that we couldn't find, but other than that was fine. Breakfast was good, lots to choose from (hot food, cereals, pastries, yoghurt, fruit, etc) and very attentive staff. One recommendation - fried eggs. All in all a good hotel at a pretty good price in London zone 1.

Reviews.Title: “Nice all rounder”
Reviews.Author: iggypopbarker
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for two nights as a weekend treat. The hotel is well situated with Hyde Park mere steps away and the Central, District and Circle lines all within easy walking distance. Our check in was seamless with a helpful recepionist, however the couple after us were told they had to be relocated due to a "maintenance problem" (for those reviewers below who this included, you have my sympathies). It was also slightly amusing to see three bellboys all taking more interest in their mobile phones rather than asking if we need a hand with our luggage, but nevermind! The room was a little pokey but very clean. The bed was a little too on the orthopaedic side, with possibly the firmest pillows I've ever experienced but we improvised by rolling up the counterpane which seemed to help. The evening reception staff struggled with our request for a bottle of water so we gave up and had tap water, but I guess they saved us a few quid so mustn't grumble! The breakfast was of a good standard and the serving staff very attentive. I'd also advise folks to check the Tube replacement program as the aforementioned Tube services were being fixed during the weekend we stayed there, resulting in a good half hour walk from where they terminated. Not the hotel's fault of course, but bear it in mind.

Reviews.Title: “No guarantee you will stay here”
Reviews.Author: wildmist_17
Reviews.Content: Booked a single (room only Â£65) at this hotel for my husband , after reading the reviews through LASTMINUTE.com. When he arrived after a long journey at 10.30 pm, the receptionist says they cannot provide a room as there is a "maintenance issue" & that they could offer another room at one of their sister concerns nearby, "Shaftesbury Premier Notting Hill" & provide a taxi to take him there. There is clearly a difference in rates between rooms in Shaftesbury Premier Notting Hill (SPNH) & Grand Royale, with the latter being more expensive. I had personally looked up & compared the rates of all the hotels that very morning, including SPNH before confirming Grand Royale. While Grand Royale was Â£65 single room only, SPNH was Â£52 deluxe single room & breakfast included. We were not bothered about breakfast & only the quality of hotel & hence booked Grand Royale. When my husband mentioned this to me while waiting for the taxi,I googled it on the to confirm it. The receptionist denied it & said that both hotels belong to the same class & hence their official website will state the same rates for both. The receptionist said that they will not refund the difference between room rates, nor would they give a complete refund (when my husband said that he would prefer to get his Â£65 back & book the same room at SPNH online for Â£52,which was being shown available at that very minute). As it was a long & tiring day, my husband did not challenge it further.The room at SPNH turned out to be alright,but the point is we could have got it by paying Â£52 from the start anyways. When we looked up reviews, we found that this a common pratice within this group or chain of hotels;which all go by very confusing & similar names such as Shaftesbury Premier Notting Hill Hyde Park,Shaftesbury Premier London Hyde Park,Shaftesbury Metropolis London Hyde Park,Shaftesbury Gardens London Hyde Park etc. We don't think we will get any refund back from Lastminute.com. Just a warning to everyone that this can be expected, if you look forward to your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy, A good location for london sights. pleasently surprised.”
Reviews.Author: anthony1950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed for looking round London the food is good value (breakfeast), the staff were pleasant and mostly helpful. The rooms are small but well presented and clean. If i was going to nit pick a fault it would be that the reception, whilst well staffed, felt a little hesitant toward the customers needs once booked in. They need to lift their heads from the computers once in a while and smile at the paying guests afteral this is the hub of the hotel and the first place you come into contact with any staff. Perhaps have a person welcoming guests at the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Staff - DISASTER MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: HenryCC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. The building is steeped in history and architecture. The staff is great! The rooms are EXTREMLY small but newly renovated. Now for the disaster - I work as a retail consultant so I find the situation perplexing - The management is a disaster...no follow up, they pass the buck from one to the other, they use each other as an excuse, they talk down to the staff. Usually when you have this behavior within management it infects the staff, thankfully the virus hasnâ€™t spread! Of the several issues (lost laundry, poorly laundered shirts, and forgotten room service orders) the worst was that none of my business colleagues or I were able to use Outlook to check our mail and work from the hotel because of blocked ports in there router. When we asked them to review this giving them the technical solution on the first day nothing was done. We had to repeat the problem and solution to every manager at the desk for the next 3 days. On the 4th day their IT support guy appeared and gave us the simple response that it was due to company policy and that he had no idea why. When we asked why a hotel that caters to business people would block internet access to our corporate email accounts they couldn't give us an answer. They advertise internet access but for what? Of all my hotel stays around the world I have never seen email access blocked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend in Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LifestylePlanner
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Grand Royale for a weekend I thoroughly recommend it. It is an old historic building sympathetically restored by Shaftesbury Hotels. The rooms are what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The staff are attentive and courteous and the breakfasts excellent with a wide range of hot and cold food, teas and coffee. I shall be booking there again shortly, on my next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kimidoll
Reviews.Content: it wasnâ€™t a personal choice but no regrets , its great place. when you enter the hotel youâ€™d think its so old. The antique dÃ©cor in their lounge is quiet neat. The rooms are quiet modern, tiny but ok. Quiet location if wana go shopping or just have some fun in London tube station is a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, comfortable bed & a fantastic breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: GingerJk
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the place, rooms may be a bit on the small side but are more than comfortable, bathroom's nicely set out and the bed is one of the more comfortable of London hotels I've stayed in. Buffet breakfast is great, cooked, continental, it's all tasty stuff. Great location next to the park, or just a couple of streets from bayswater tube station. Highly recommended, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: BaLola
Reviews.Content: We never got to stay at the hotel. After many emails requesting a quote for a group booking were left unanswered, I called their reservations line to book over the phone. Long distance is not cheap, but these guys made me wait on the line for 10-15 minutes each time and were consistently unable to make a simple booking. Eventually I got a quote, but paying them was another issue. The payment form I received had no booking or contract details, meaning that if I signed it I was agreeing to pay an undetermined amount. Nice. A corrected form was requested, but again no answer, so I went ahead and included the booking details in the form I had received, completed the card details and sent it over, only to hear that they didn't have any rooms available any more. I read in some other review that in this place "the blind lead the blind", but that is an understatement. Utter ineptitude is more like it.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel in London we have enjoyed most”
Reviews.Author: lovely61
Reviews.Content: We can only highly recommend staying at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park, London! The location was central and quiet, the room was spotless clean as was the bathroom, the bed extremely comfortable and, above all, the staff was very helpful and attentive. For our next trip to London we shall definitely return to this hotel. D&A Malant, Geneva, Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: sally5585
Reviews.Content: Lovely location (pretty, quiet street and close to tube and restaurants), friendly staff, nice rooms and excellent value for money! Highly reccomend! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel but with tiny single rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights on a business trip. Was given a tiny single room with hardly enough space to move inside. Nice lobby/ reading area. Just across the road from Hyde Park so its great if you're a keen jogger. A 20 minute walk from Oxford Street. A decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: laney071
Reviews.Content: when i first booked this hotel i read the reviews first.i wasnt expecting much as i only paid 177pounds for 3 nights bed and breakfast for 2 of us.what a very pleasent surprise when we arrived there.yes the rooms are on the small side as written in some reviews but what do you expect.the rooms are very modern and very clean and have everything you need for a comfortable stay.as for the hotel itself well it was beautiful with lots of character.the staff were very friendly and helpful.the breakfast was lovely and plenty to choose from,and the location was fabulous a short walk to queensway tube and about ten minutes from bayswater.so if you are put off by some of the reviews then dont be some people arent happy unless they have something to moan about!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel , no great shakes”
Reviews.Author: LittleBess
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on this hotel , booked a deluxe room for a great price. From the reviews I 've read and the hotel pictures I think I was perhaps expecting too much. I have to say the hotel is in a great location, no faults there. On arriving at the hotel we were told we had booked 2 rooms which we most definitly hadn't. We went up to our room , which was actually v. nice and not as small as I was expecting .The were scuff marks along skirting boards so repainting needed but apart from that the room was fine . We had a room were it wasn't possible to open the window , but there was air - conditioning but this was a bit noisy. Once up in our room the receptionist called to tell us she would not be charging for the extra room booked. I would have hoped not seeing as we didn't book it !There was no apology for this.The following morning we recieved a wake-up call at 7.30 which we hadn't requested . Also as we were packing to leave at 10.45 a member of cleaning staff entered the room without knocking . The bar doesn't open until 4 o'clock (this was a sunday maybe it's different on other days) not a big deal I suppose but sometimes it's nice when arriving somewhere to sit down for a drink. These are minor gripes of course but still a bit annoying seeing as we were only there for 1 night. I won't be staying here again and won't be recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Like a reverse Narnia”
Reviews.Author: travelcat20
Reviews.Content: The magnificant entrance, restaurant and reception decor are very grand and you feel as if you are stepping into a hotel of the ultimate luxury. However, take a step through the door to the long corridors of bedrooms and it is like the reverse of stepping through the wardrobe into Narnia - you get a compact,room, with tired decor in need of a refreshing lick of paint. Having said that, the room was very clean and provided all the essential elements for a pleasant stay: comfortable bed, complimentary toiletries, tea/coffee, etc. The rooms are small, but nothing more than you would expect in London, where space is at a premium. It was just I was a little disappointed given the grandeur of the photography on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Discodob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last night.....from 8pm last night to time of writing the review I have told 7 people who I knowto travel and stay in London to seek this place out....it has character as soon as you walk in the door, though from the outside it looks like a B&B...appearances are deceptive! Greeting at reception was warm and welcoming and embracing almost.....a request for iron was courteously received and immediately dispatched via the porter......the room when I got there was...well...way beyond my expectations....so clean,warm,great space in sleeping area, great bed and modern furnishins and a terrific spacious well equipped bathroom...my god...for Â£59 I thought i'd gone club class!. Checkout was so couteous also...it's always nce to deal with people who smile naturally and genuinely.....that's what I got for this stay at the Grand Royale throughout .I'd happily pay Â£200pn for this hotel again(though I hope I don't have to)......it's great...the area is great with easy tube connection and a great food scene around the corner with shopping if you want it.....I truly felt a connection where I was comfortable... I go to London weekly overnight and never have I felt so comfortable and my custom appreciated....check out the Grande Royale Hyde Park and check in....you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “It was one of best stay, especially the duty meneger Gagans support and help was priceless...”
Reviews.Author: dil_82
Reviews.Content: Excellent and high qualified staff, Gagan the duty meneger dealt with us proffessionaly and we had a very pleasent stay.... me and my husband defenitely will stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Wedding occassion”
Reviews.Author: Smiley_2_us
Reviews.Content: Im so grateful to this stunning hotel with its eexceptional brilliant staff, I am so impressed with their servie- kind, warm, professional! I had booked 6 rooms for my family to attend my wedding and the staff made my family feel welcomed and looked after in such a way that I as a bride felt so relaxed and helped by this hotel!!! I am forever grateful to Mr Mandar, Mr Gagan, Mr Ajay and the rest of the staff for their warm and special help! They made my wedding so beautiful and happy! For me and my family this hotel and its staff will always be the happy and warm part of my wedding memory.... When family come from abroad to attend wediing in an unknown area the hotel and the staff can do a big difference! This hotel was so helpful and HAPPY towards my family that my family insist to me to always book them this hotel! The design, furniture, atmosphere of the hotel is so xbeautiful with a very distinct elegance that the staff are very keen to maintain. This adds very much to the luxury feeling you get when staying here. The room are very nice and very comfortable beds! I love the electronic bell/sleeping etc system by each room! The breakfast in the beautiful room with the great staff make a great start of the day! The staff make u so hapy and well looked after that yu know it will be a great day from here on! The lounge is one of the most stunning hotel lounges I have seen!! Its very antique with a lot of beautiful details and gives a very warm and velcoming atmosphere to the hotel. Again the service is 5 star!!! My husband has travelled a lot on business trip and leisure trip. He usually travels business calss and stays in 5 star hotel. Even he said that this hotel and staff is definetaly one of the best he has come across! He has informed his company to add this hotel as priority hotelk for their business clients from abroad! I can very warmly recommend/guarantee that this hotel is excellent in all aspects!! Thank Yoy Grand Royale Lndon Hyde Park for making my big day a very beautiful and hppy day ! You all are the true stars of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, Very much impressed”
Reviews.Author: ferro40
Reviews.Content: I had very good time in Grand Royale. rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. hotel is very close to tube station its very easy to access underground. staff very friendly specially thankful to Duty Manager Mandar for rooms were upgraded to club room without any extra charges and very kind trought out my stay. Ajay and sussan are simply best and very friendly. The Buffet Breakfast was funtastic i never ever had in any other hotel before. Sabina (restaurant supervisor) very quick and very freindly. i will definetly visit to Grand Royale again

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Farkhad
Reviews.Content: Services are good, friendly staff. Guy Gagan at the reception was so helpfull, when we arrived there was a missunderstanding with room which he quickly solved. Whenever you apply to recetion you always find support! I wish such people could work in most of London Hotels. Breakfast is good, nonsmoking rooms are important!

Reviews.Title: “awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: vaibhav4
Reviews.Content: i had a awesome trip of london. specially the manager of the hotel Mr. mandar is realy helpfull ovre the trip. we were in very critical situation when i checked in. there was problem of internt and hot water but mr. mandar sloved all the problems. in the morning breakfast was very good. all staff is very nice. for the next time i will prefer the sme hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: TiJu21
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night and although the duty manager was very welcoming and pleasant and so was the bell boy, some of the other staff seemed rather uninterested and we almost felt like an inconvenience. A typical example was when we requested some drinks, while sitting in the lounge, we were told we should go to the bar and order them ourselves. We would perfectly have understood, if the bar would have been busy and a long distance from the lounge, but neither was the case. When speaking to the reception staff after the duty manager had gone, the female receptionist was unfriendly and to coin a phrase "looked like she was sucking a wasp". However the upgrade was very welcome as was the bottle of wine and fruit plate and we are sure that with a different staff philosophy and some good training, this hotel could easily be transformed and justify its classification as a boutique hotel. The location is fantastic with very easy access to the tube and the building is stunning. This easily compensates for the tiny rooms. We would happily recommend the hotel to a friend for its location and beauty, but make them aware of the staff situation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good All Round Value”
Reviews.Author: PVDalton
Reviews.Content: NIce location very central to Tube Stations Queensway and Bayswater. Their Duty Manager Mr Gagan was very helpful to us and took care of any items requested - advice on routes to take for off tube work at weekends. All the staff were very friendly and courteous. Excellent breakfast and you can even order things not on the menu such as an omelette and the Chef mingles with the clients after breakfast and is a very nice chap. Good Porter service too. There are some real benefits to the Group Premier Club Points scheme which we also enjoyed. Room sizes are typical of Central London and the corridors and partitions are also typical and not fully noise proof, but this was a minor thing real as overall we found it very good all round value. We will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rietepiet58
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights. The room and the bathroom were very small. Fortunately the bed was good. The temperature in the room was very high and it was not possible to turn down the airconditioning . We called someone from maintenance but he could not repare it. We wanted to open a window but that was impossible. All the windows were "fixed", it was impossible to open them to get some fresh air into the room. That gave us a stuffy feeling. The breakfast was good. The reception staff was not very friendly. The location was perfect, very close to 2 subwaystations and Hyde Park. The location is very central and yet rather quiet.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORSE HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN”
Reviews.Author: giaka3
Reviews.Content: Went there with my husband for a weekend. Don't be fooled by the nice web site.The building is old and feels like it has't be cleaned for ages! We had booked a deluxe room but we realised it was nothing like it. It was so small we could hardly walk around the bed and the same goes for the bathroom. No safe or mini-bar or even a bottle of water in the room. Also there are no double windows and you listen to everything that's happening on the street! On the second day we left the face towels on the floor because they were dirty and had to be changed.Instead when we came back at night we found the same towels on the selves.After we complained we got new towels. Same thing happed withe the foot cover they put on the beds, it was sooooo dirty I couldn't even touch it! The bed was ok but the pillows so hard and uncomfortable we had to buy our own in order to be able to sleep. The only good thing about the hotel is its excellent location. By all means do your best to stay in another hotel even if that means it won't be that central.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location!”
Reviews.Author: NCL19
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and I am very impressed, will definitely return when I stay in London again. Tucked away but not a problem because its very close to the tube and buses. On arrival the service was prompt and professional. The room was good for the price I paid (thanks to late rooms) but would have been disappointed if I'd paid full price. Modern, clean and comfortable room but small...the bathroom was tiny but did the job for 1 night. My only bad point are the pillows, because they are too hard for me.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money! Top condition, service and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ZvihaHadar
Reviews.Content: The Grand Royale surely beats all stereotypes about expensive- poor conditions hotels in center of London. We were very positively surprised to get so much for the money. For the following reasons: $$ Location: 2 blocks away from 2 Tube stations! 100 meters from bus stations, to all important locations, including the lines to all tourist locations which are several driving minutes by bus. $$ Facilities: Beautiful roomy lobby, dining room and launch areas. Newly remodeled top conditioned room althogh pretty small size like all hotels in central London. First class. $$ Service: Excellent personal staff in reception, bell boys and dining rom. I forgot my camera at the lobby at my check out. I called the hotel from the airport; they waited for my call and were kind enough to mail it to my home address in Israel. $$ Breakfast: absolutely fantastic (included in the price), as well as the fancy dining room itself . $$ Free internet: Free Wi-Fi in the room and a computer/internet station at the lobby. I was very impressed and hope everyone else will enjoy this hotel as much as I did. Very much recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Engalndholidaymum
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on a Friday night in Jan 11. We booked a deluxe double, directly with Shaftesbury hotels as it is the cheapest (Â£80 inc breakfast and VAT). When we arrived at 12pm they upgraded us to a club room and took our bags so we could go out to lunch. The hotel is 2 min walk from Queensway and Bayswater tube station which is fab. There is also a bus stop 30 sec away. When we arrived back from lunch our room was ready. We had room 301 - yes the room is small, but it is modern, clean and has everything you need. The bed was really comfortable, the room sound proof, the curtains dark, the TV big and lots of channels, lots of lighting choice, complimentory wine, water and fruit, a bath, modern shower, sink, toilet, comp shampoo etc, wardrobe. If I had of paid over Â£100 for this room then I may of been disappointed. Breakfast was nice, staff greeted nicely, variety of hot and cold - nothing to grumble. Check out was fast and staff once again kept our luggage so we could spend the day in London. We walked back from Oxford Street (25min) and walked to Notting Hill Portabella market (15min) and Hyde park is on your door step.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best adress in London”
Reviews.Author: FredericMarta
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in Grand Royale London Hyde Park on various occasion over the past year both for business and leisure As a very frequent traveller spending about 180 a year out of home I have become very demanding regarding standard ; and I have to confess that every one of my stays has been an extremely positive experience : great location ; rooms are not huge but very well disposed and decorated ; and the hotel staff and management are just exceptionnally qualified ;helpful; discrete and educated. Check in and out is probably the fastest I have ever seen Very convenient if the trip purpose is business with free wifi everywhere, press in the lobby; a lot of quiet places and salons to discuss ; work; meet. If they have availability ; no doubt ; go there, this is THE place.

Reviews.Title: “Not so grande after all!”
Reviews.Author: vishaal_bhimma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3nights in a standard room which is really small. The bed just about fits the entire room leaving no space to move around. The bathroom is the exact size of two bathtubs. The shower doesn't work very well. Really cramped and tiny. The bar check is not done correctly, having to inform reception that items were opened and not used by us.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price paid.”
Reviews.Author: Romangate
Reviews.Content: I booked directly using the hotel website: 2 deluxe rooms for 2 nights, (20 to 22 dec) breakfast included for Â£370 which, for what we got, was good value! Upon arrival we were upgraded to club rooms: result! As everyone has pointed out, the rooms are very small but spotlessly clean, well decorated, comfy bed, lots of refreshments, hee-ooge tv. Breakfast was nice, plenty of choice but it was cold! A couple of small things that was annoying: upon arrival the first person that dealt with us couldn't find our reservation, then when it was found, the receptionist asked US how much we thought we were paying. Everything was fine; I brought a print of my booking confirmation. Hotel is 2 min walk from tube (central line) or 5 mins from district and circle.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, smart but tiny, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: pymmjj
Reviews.Content: We were staying just one night following a dinner at The Royal Horseguards - now that IS a great hotel and a favourite of mine. Unfortunately, the best rate there was on offer was over Â£240, so we decided to stay here as it looked so great on their web site. We had booked a superior room with breakfast for Â£175 and, on arrival, were delighted to learn that we were being up-graded to one of their premier Club Rooms. When we opened the door we were amazed at its "rabbit hutch" size. Everything looked nice, but oh so claustrophobic. The shower room was remarkable. You could not stand anywhere in the shower cubicle without the shower curtain hanging against your body (and I'm thin). The toilet pedestal was also very cleverly located in a tiny corner by the shower and with the wash-hand basin directly in front. Quite novel - going to the loo and washing your hands at the same time. In this quality (price) hotel, you also expect some decent soap, shower gel and shampoo, not something non-descript, bearing the hotel group's name. and 'Made in China' on the bottles. Bed softness/hardness is mostly a personal preference, but ours was hard, high up and with excruciatingly solid polyester-filled pillows. Why oh why can't hotels get right the fundamental reason for staying with them i.e. a good night's sleep, like being at home? Our Club room (#214) faced out over the back yard to the Westminster Council-operated car park. That was fun, with all the comings and goings. Finally, our room had ceiling to floor sloping windows, each with semi-opaque fabric concertina blinds (you know, the sort you put in conservatories to cut down the sun). Well they weren't much use at cutting out the external light, so our room remained well illuminated and contributed to our fairly sleepless night. Breakfast - absolutely nothing of real quality here - fruit juice, cereals, TINNED fruit salad, and for the cooked option - soggy bacon (I hate this and Americans won't tolerate non-crispy bacon), gristly sausage, a fried potato triangle, over-cooked baked beans and rubberised scrambled egg. The croissants were stale. Not quite the "greasy spoon" but far short of what should be be provided. My advice, if you want a superlative short stay in London. is don't even consider this place (unless you are a very small person). Row out the boat a bit and go to the Royal Horseguards, where we should have stayed again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nader-Khalifah
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights 19-21 November 2010. The hotel location is very good since it is near to the queens way underground station and there is a number of bus stop points close to it and some resturants were close to the hotel. Moreover, the hyde park and Kingstone park are very close. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nice and clean. Free wireless internet access was available. I utilized the offer of 10% discount for two nights. The breakfast was OK with a warm welcoming from the nice staff. I enjoyed my stay in this hotel and I recommended for short stay since the rooms are small and there is no space for too much luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Very small and service a bit hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Richard904A
Reviews.Content: From the reception this hotel looks great but the reviewer who said the rooms are like rabbit hutches is spot on. I am skinny and I could barely scrape round the gap between the end of the bed and the table. If it was a couple staying, one would have to clamber over the bed to get to the other side. When I arrived there were no towels in my room so I had to ask. Also the key stopped working at various times. Both times staff were helpful. It's OK, but not that good value.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Laymons
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were in this hotel from 10/18 until 10/25, we were very pleased by the treatment and readiness of the employees, the neatness of our room, the localization of the hotel could not be better: close to 2 tube stations: Queensway and Bayswatch, and also, the breakfast was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Rabbitt hutch”
Reviews.Author: Bob.PLondon
Reviews.Content: On the face of it this is a quaint well sited hotel opposit a bail hostel where junkies sit on the wall smoking looking out for a victim. Inside the staff were slow and out of their depth (45 mins for 3 couples to check in) The room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in and i am a frequent business traveller. 2 adults were continually climbing over each other and it was claustrophobic in the extreme. The air conditioning didnt work and the shower was a dribble that you couldnt wash your hair and had to move alot to get the water to cover you. I complained and was offered a maintenance call that never came just like the taxi we ordered never came and we were late for reservations we made. The rooms were, however, clean, modern and well appointed but had no wardrobe spact long enough to take a shirt or jacket. We had a thoroughly unpleasant night in a stiflingly hot crampd hutch of a room that even the Japanes would be shocked to have.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service and super location”
Reviews.Author: MaryCTomD
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent five days in London recently. We had a lovely stay at the Grand Royale, Hyde Park. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. This hotel is in a really nice area, with Hyde Park just across the road. Around the corner on parallel street are two tube stations and plenty of restaurants. We could walk to Oxford st in about 15 mins or just two stops on the tube. I would definitely recommend this hotel for tourists interested in sight seeing and shopping! It is in a perfect location. Will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marsden72
Reviews.Content: Great Location - less than 2 minutes walk from Queensway tube station. Rooms you couldnt swing a cat in- the bathroom was afwul. there was 2 floor tiles of free space in their along with a leaking sink and lights that didnt work. If your going to London to not be in a hotel then this is for you as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Emsywemsy34
Reviews.Content: Check in was chaotic and they did not even have our reservation so a bad start! The rooms whilst quite smart are very small and the bathrooms tiny. The water pressure was hopeless and the knobs fell off the tap so the temperature could not be increased. The bath was only big enough for a small child and the electricity sockets were dangerous-we got a shock off one! Near tube station and Hyde Park but it still did not cut it for us. We will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Compact convenience”
Reviews.Author: pinesong
Reviews.Content: Room is small as ensuite is a modern alteration, cutting into space. Very good bed, flat screen TV, very clean at all times. We found front of staff very good. Close to tubes and buses, can walk across the parks to museums etc. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable!”
Reviews.Author: KeliandRobbie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Hyde park is minute's to walk, the underground is around the corner and many resturants of different cultures is one street away. The hotel itself offers comfortable bed with a nice size room which was very clean and tidy. The hospitality was very good and they made you feel at home. A full English and continental breakfast was available and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff turned a terrible start into a very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: carpediem111
Reviews.Content: First room we had was terrible. Far too small to be marketed as a "Superious Double Room". No hot water at 8:00 am, no hair dryer, no plug for the bath and the heat was stuck on high! When I complained to the front desk, they immediately booked us into a Gold Club Room - nice size, and ensured we had all the missing items from the other room. That night we were given two rounds of complimentary drinks at the bar and complimentary breakfast the next morning. The quick action of the staff and their obvious effort to amend the situation left us feeling very positive about our stay there. There is a hostel across the street that is rather dodgy looking and had some unsavoury characters hanging around at night. The location is excellent - just around the corner from Queensway tube station. Front desk staff were exceptional. The buffet breakfast is very nice with lots of choice- if you book through the hotel website I believe it is included in the price. The beds are VERY hard and the floors squeaky, as it is an old building the has been restored. I would recommend earplugs if you plan on sleeping in, otherwise you will hear the people above you.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Dis-appointed”
Reviews.Author: Marticat52
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through 'Last Minute.com' for a one night stay as we were going to the BBC Electric Proms. The Â£149 for the one night b & b we thought was acceptable. However on reflection it was way overpriced. As it was only a one night stay we did not bother to request a different room and judging by one of the other reviews we are glad we didn't. Our room was so small and so cluttered that you could not walk to open the window without knocking yourself on the furnishings, in fact to get into bed on one side you had to walk sideways as it was so close to the radiator under the window. It was not fit to be described as a double room, the bed appeared to be approx 4ft wide (which really is only suitable for single people), the bed was hard and uncomfortable as were the pillows. Bathrobes were supplied without the sash to tie around, so pretty useless really. The bathroom was bijoux - and actually quite dangerous as the bath was quite high to climb into with only a small gap between the shower screen and the basin stand - which incidentally extended so near to the edge of the bath which resulted in injury getting in and out as it was impossible to do without knocking against the sharp corner of the basin stand. There were other minor issues but not worth mentioning in detail - attention to detail - repairs etc. Breakfast - well that was an experience! We arrived at 9.30am (breakfast was until 10.30 am) and numerous people arrived after us. There were no glasses for fruit juice - and after making a request it was 15 minutes before they arrived. A good selection of food was available, although limited quantities. There were hot plates for the cooked food, but no cold plates for cold food. When we asked for a plate that was cold, we were told that only 'cereal bowls' were cold, and the only plates they had were hot ones. We did not want cold ham, cheese or fruit on a hot plate or in a cereal bowl. We even had to ask for cups for our coffee, as once we had sat at the table the waitress went off and started laying other tables before finishing ours. Very badly Managed, no organisation and very little concern towards the guests requests. The Reception and Bar Staff were very polite and courteous,check in and check out was quick and efficient, although we noted we were not asked if we had enjoyed our stay, we wonder why! We have stayed in numerous hotels in various destinations and have found the most comfortable beds and decent size rooms with good service and breakfast facilities and for less money are in America and Canada. The UK Hotel Industry could learn a lot from them. We were very disappointed as it took the edge off what was otherwise a very enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and still no response from 'Customer Care'!!”
Reviews.Author: MNickerson
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for my birthday, and have to say I'm glad we didn't need to stay in the hotel that much. The first room we were allocated was lovely, up on the 7th floor. It was clean and spaceous, however, the TV didn't work. We notified the Concierge when he brought our bags up and he said he'd get maintenance to take a look. After an hour we tried to call Reception to ask them for help with it, but the telephone had been ripped out of the wall. As I went to leave the room they arrived and moved us to another 'room'. It was in the basement, stuffy, concrete view, an minute inaccessible sink in the bathroom, a window that didn't stay open and a shower with peeling paper/paint in it. On the up side, the TV and phone worked!! I have emailed the hotel twice with my comments and as yet have had no reply. Amasing customer service....not!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SilviaOnTrip
Reviews.Content: Nice dÃ©cor with a lot of atmosphere, good size and clean room, excellent breakfast and a beautiful hall. The free use of WiFi in our room was a big plus for us. Easy to reach ( 1min from Queensway station - 5 min from Bayswater Station),the hotel has very good central location, near to Hyde Park. We arrived from Stansted airport, caught the bus to Liverpool Station, then the Central Line to Queensway. Quick and easy. (less than 10 min from Liverpool Station) The pictures on the web site were very curate the visual aspects of the hotel. All staff friendly and efficient, first of all Mr. Justin.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT Manager&CARING Staff are what puts the "GRAND" in Royale!”
Reviews.Author: jollyjetlaggers
Reviews.Content: In celebration of our anniversary and our final celebration in London as we make our major move overseas, we decided to stay at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park Hotel. It is ideally located, near Hyde Park for sunrise strolls, easy to hop on a London Tour Bus, walking distance to a variety of restaurants and shops. The grandeur and history that still remains for hotel guests to admire what was once the place of residence of the reknown British actress, Lilly Langtry - a gift from Edward VII as a token of affection whilst their romance was all a whirl for 3 years (1877 to 1880) is an added bonus! What truly makes you as a guest most welcome is the hotel manager, Justin, and his wonderful staff. They exude warmth, sincerity and care in their professionalism and are very attentive to any request a hotel guest may have - that indeed is rare to find in London these days. Such hospitality made our time spent even more special and we sincerely thank them all for it. The hotel room is clean, comfortable and, if you appreciate the preservation of history, it is then a pleasure to see all efforts being made to retain the glorious craftmanship you will see around you. The beautiful staircase with wood relief carvings of dogs hunting for deer in the forest tells a story of its own if you allow your eyes to let you see for yourself. The paintings from the ceiling were brought back to it's glory once the black paint that horrendously used to cover them in the very early years took time to remove and achieved magnificiently. What now is the breakfast room also retains it beauty of yesteryear where ballroom dancing once took place on the very polished wooden floors we walked on and the trio of crystal chandeliers above our heads. The full English breakfast was superb and we recommend you book it to start your day right!
