It is important to bare in mind that this 150 year old building is a "grand old lady" still standing proud and, therefore, requires the continuation of conservation projects and that takes time and money which we've been informed Â£6 billion has been poured into in order to carry out the projects. So, yes, the rooms are small as most London hotel rooms are but these rooms are clean, air conditioned, tranquil and well maintained by the staff and we slept extremely well. If there is any problem, you can rest assure that Justin and other hotel staff will tend to solve it for you immediately and that says more to us about "quality" than anything else which is superb. We highly recommend staying at this hotel if you truly want a warm, friendly and attentive hotel staff to make you feel welcomed. They take pride in being of service to all hotel guests and it shows! Thank you for everything, Justin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a reasonable hotel; if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsRascal
Reviews.Content: During a weekend, we made few demands upon the staff, when we did so, we found them polite and helpful. The 2 rooms we had on the first floor had a small set of steps up to the bedroom from the room door- we would advise that you check before booking if you have any access/disability issues. The rooms were small ( not unusual in London) and whilst one was reasonably clean, the other needed more attention to cleaning the bathroom and had a slight smell. The location is very good within easy walking distance of 2 tube stations, on different lines. With Queensway ( literally just round the corner) having several small cafes, breakfast is easy if you do not want to use the hotel. Even at the rear of the hotel, there is a fair bit of noise from traffic and pedestrians. I would recomend the hotel provided you can book at a time at a time when the price is about the same as a motel in London

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: LilyCrabb
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised having read negative reviews. Well located. Staff all polite and helpful, hotel clean and tidy and a lovely breakfast each morning with lots of choice. Rooms are quite small but perfectly adequate for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “My country (Brazil) is famous for it's hospitality. In that sense, in Grand Royale I felt at home."”
Reviews.Author: VARP1971
Reviews.Content: Nice location near the Hyde Park and Queensway Station (Central Line) allowing us to be at business at the City in 30 minutes from door to door. High speed internet in all rooms worked perfectly. Coffee/tea facilities in each room were very nice. Heating also worked well. Staff was incredibly friendly and efficient (even at 3 AM when I couldn't figure how to turn on the heating). Rooms cozy (singles were not very roomy for Brazilian standards, but very comfortable and clean). Nice Breakfast (Brazilian chef made a whole lot of difference). Charming little bar near the reception. The building has its pitoresque history, and the staff was glad to tell it. The care with conservation of the historical trends of the building is also admirable. Hotel has such things as plug adaptor and ironing board for guests, witthout aditional charges. Allows routing of expenses from one room to another, which might come handy when travelling in family. Booking through booking.com worked perfectly. Needed a specific receipt back to Brazil, and they even posted it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room small but clean”
Reviews.Author: Cazni
Reviews.Content: As the title says good location few minutes walk from Queensway Tube, room was small but adequate. Quite location not a lot of through traffic passing the room. Its a good location for tourists right on Hyde Park and a 20 min walk to the heart of Oxford st. Free and speedy internet access. Would recommend, I'm in London for business on a weekly basis and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel though rooms are small - consistent quality you can count on”
Reviews.Author: BCNMiriam
Reviews.Content: As long as you arrive knowing that the rooms are very small, you won't be disappointed. The building is lovely inside and out, the rooms are clean with nice amenities, though very very small (room only for a single bed and a nightstand). The employees are friendly. No restaurant but they have a bar. Convenient location in Hyde Park though neighborhood is a little dirtier than others - more of the real London and less tourism. FREE internet in all rooms! At a reasonable price I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Consistency is key and some London hotels can be awful.

Reviews.Title: “Good bed, Clean room with Tea/Coffee facilities...just v.small”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBallymena
Reviews.Content: Bedroom was very small for a 'Club Room' although it was clean, good air conditioning and good quality bed and pillows. Bathroom was tiny....and water pressure from bath with over headshower was terrible...virtually non existant. It was lovely to have tea/coffee making facilities made available in bedroom. Staff were pleasant. Overhall hotel was clean and suppose value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel - amazing 18th architecture - free WIFI”
Reviews.Author: sailingstarr
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three-night stay at the Grand Royale London Hyde Park. As soon as my taxi arrived in front of the main entrance, an employee rushed out to welcome me and carry my suitcase inside. In minutes I was checked in and a porter carried my bag to the room. I had forgotten my toothbrush and did not have a British plug for my PC and the receptionist handed them to me immediately from her "magic box" with a big smile. There was no safe in the room, but one was sent up as soon as I requested it. The hotel was literally the 18th century home of Lily Langtry, the mistress of Edward VII and all the common areas were carefully restored to their original condition. The breakfast room was her diningroom and the food and service was exception. I love this hotel and would definitely come back again. There are great rates to be found for the and the sister hotels at www.shaftesbury.com . I forgot to add that free WIFI and a full amazing English breakfast is included in the price. . The

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed In Better Travelodges .........”
Reviews.Author: Gareth_Online_Sl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival (having moved the toilet rolls that were blocking the entrance) we had to wait 20 miutes to check in while both receptionists we dealing with 2 other existing customers who were complaining about their rooms. When we did get seen only one of the 2 rooms that I had booked were on the system so frantic telephone calls to the central reservation personnel ensued. A mistake was acknowledged and a basement room with no natural light was allocated to my travelling companion - who just happened to be my MD! The receptionist then insisted we pay for our room for the entire stay upon registration (we were told "its company policy") before we had even seen the rooms - now I know why. I opened the door as far as I could (it was prevented from opening further by the hand-rail) and started walking into the room sideways (with a suitcase in each hand) as I had to because of the resitriction. Unbeknown to me - as it wasn't mentioned at check-in - I was entering a room that immediately led to stairs going down into the room without any form of landing. I lost my footing and dropped one of my suitcases down the stairs as I grabbed the handrail to stop myself falling. When I got into the room it was tiny. I tried to hand my clothes up in the wardrobe and it was so short my clothers didn't hang properly. You couldn't work at the desk sitting on the stool as there was not enough room - I had to sit on the bed. You couldn't walk around the window side of the bed as there was not enough room between the bed and the radiator. Sleeping in the room was extremely difficuly - the air conditioning worked on 2 settings only very cold or off! I had to turn off the air conditioning and opened a window instead. This did improve the room temerature but the noise coming from across the street at the Youth Hostel and the residents watching TV outside on their verandas until 2.30am meant that it wasn't too quiet! In addition, the internet connection was very patchy only working for a couple of minutes before it dropped out which became very annoying. I arranged to meet my colleague in the "bar" for a drink after checking in. There was no beer or lager on "tap" - it was all in bottles with a very short paper menu showing what was available. A bottle of mixer sized Coca Cola (or it may have been Pepsi) at Â£2.50 was a rip off. When I asked about this the barman didn't understand English - in fact I cannot remember during my stay talking to one member of staff where English was their first language! The best part of the stay was the breakfast which was a very good "help yourself" style which had a very wide selection. As we had been made to pay for the stay at check-in there was not need to check out but I thought it was interesting to observe that as we waited for our taxi there were even more people at reception complaining about their room / air conditioning / shower. In my opinion this is a future tourist trap. I would definitely steer clear if you are looking for a reasonably priced quality hotel for a business stay - you would get better service and quality at a Travelodge or Premier Inn!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: Allybat
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be the perfect place to come to after two weeks of non stop work and mental stress. It felt like a safe haven and the welcome was terrific. I can't wait for my next visit and will surely recommend it to my friends and family in South Africa. Since my arrival in the UK on 2nd May, this is the first time I was so welcomed and impressed by the professionalism of the staff. Well done and keep up the good work!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: smoke013
Reviews.Content: Although I was in a basement room (no reception on mobile phone and virtually no daylight) I really liked this hotel. Satellite TV, comfortable bed, staff was helpful and friendly. The bathroom was the smallest I've ever been in but it was sufficient. Location was perfect, close to both Bayswater and Queensway tube stations and right on top of Hyde Park. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lower EXpectations”
Reviews.Author: CLord007
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great, near two underground stations and across the street from Hyde Park, but service leaves a lot to be desired. They will try to relocate you to another hotel (near Heathrow Airport!!!). Rooms are incredibly small, sometimes noise on the street can be annoying at night. Customer service is non-existent. This is definitely a hotel of last resort.

Reviews.Title: “small but ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: WISHEY
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel due to its close proximity to west end theatre.. Upon check in we received a complimentary upgrade . The rooms were smaller than expected but spotlessly clean .The complientary bottle of red wine and fruit basket were a lovely touch. I found the staff extremely helpful and gracious in their manner towards customers. At breakfast the following morning we were greeted with a hearty good morning and the food was superb and hot. Thank you and well done to all hotel staff will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP AWAY! DO NOT EXPECT TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL CAUSE THEY WILL RELOCATE YOU ACCORDING TO THEIR CONVENIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Tarova
Reviews.Content: This is a tourist exploitation business! Stay away!!!! It is more than obvious that the Shaftesbury hotel chain has established a strategy of overbookings. If they donâ€™t have sufficient rooms and they donâ€™t particularly care about some clients, they move them from one hotel to another, they allocate them here and there. Pure fraud! We had booked 2 double rooms for the Grand Royale London Hyde Park in June. After a quite long journey, we arrived at the hotel, hoping to have a quick shower and relax at our nice hotel before going out. Unfortunately the Shaftesbury hotel chain thought differentlyâ€¦. Upon our arrival we were informed that â€œthere was a problem with the airconditioningâ€� and we had to be moved to another hotel. We were firm in not being willing to move to another hotel since this is the hotel and the area we have booked. We also said that we didnâ€™t mind about the airconditioning. After a while another lady came along at the reception and informed us that there is a safety issue due to the airconditioning problem and there was not other choice but to move at the other hotel in Paddington. She said that the other hotel is better than Grand Royale , it is arranged that we would have very nice rooms but we had to pay the rooms to her because if we paid at the Paddington hotel we would be charged moreâ€¦.. She also said that the hotel is close to Lancaster Gate. When we said is that we should have been informed about this before at least by phone she said that the booking company does not give to the hotel client information. The only reason we had agreed into moving to the other hotel was that we were too exhausted to argue more about it and we wanted to end this and finally have our rooms. She then informed us that a taxi has been ordered for us and it will soon arrive. We went outside of the hotel and waited more than half an hour with our luggage but noone arrived. After several complaints she called the taxi company again to find out that the driver came and left and we had to wait another fifteen minutesâ€¦ As soon as the taxi took us to the other hotel we saw a place significantly inferior to the hotel we had booked and we were taken to two rooms that were nothing bigger than the size of the bed with no view at all (all we could see was an iron plateau right in front of our window). Of course, the closest station was Paddington and not Lancaster Gate. When we asked to be moved to bigger rooms they said that they could only do it the day after. Needless to say that we have lost almost all of our first day in London (we would stay only two) and that we were too exhausted to do anything after that. To summarise I would like to say that not only were we not treated well and did not take what we have booked but also we were deceived and lied to as if we were stupid! When a person books a hotel he wants to stay at this specific hotel, if he didnâ€™t mind, we would book a cheaper one. What is most important is the lies that we have heard: -The airconditioning problemâ€¦.. Ok, if there was an airconditioning problem why were there clients in the hotel? We are talking about a central ventilation system and not separate units. -The fact that we would move to a better and more expensive hotel. The other hotel appeared to charge 105 pounds per day at the Shaftesbury website while the Grand Royale London Hyde Park was 129 for the same type of room! -The fact that the booking company did not give them our details so that they could inform us in advance. Another lie. We had made several other bookings for this same trip and all the hoteliers called us asking for details etc.. -The lie about the location which was by far Paddington and not Lancaster Gate although this is the less importantâ€¦ After we returned to Greece we sent a complaint letter asking for compensation and we received a reply, repeating the same lies and offering us a room at a discounted rate for a stay in the next 6 months (not stating the duration of stay nor of course the price). How generous of them! The company must derive from Scotland definitelyâ€¦. To conclude: Do not book the Grand Royale London Hyde Park! Although I havenâ€™t actually stayed there, most probably you will not stay there eitherâ€¦..

Reviews.Title: “Perfekt London city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: EngineerAdam
Reviews.Content: The Grand Royale is a perfect hotel for anyone making a sightseeing trip to London. The location couldn't be better, in the centre of London, but not on a loufd busy street. Two minutes from Kensington Gardens, five minutes from the tube, and near to a local high street, for those like us, who opt for the no breakfast booking. (found a nice spanish run cafe near the tube station.) The hotel itself is clean, the rooms well appointed, if a little small. Our luggage was taken to our rooms, not something I expect from a hotel in the price bracket, the staff were courtious and efficient. It i also in an old regiment house, that has been left as is in the common areas, so gives an exclusive, very english feel as one comes through the door All in all a perfect hotel for a sightseeing trip to London. The room was too small to stay there all day and just lounge. However if you are planning to be out and about in London the whole day and only use the hotel for somewhere to sleep, then that i not important, and the hotel couldn't be better

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: DirkBury
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2nights for a birthday celebration in this hotel it's a nice hotel and the location is excellent but the service is very poor. On entering the room I could see stains on the curtain and the wardrobe was not attached to the wall so fell over when opened the door. The bathroom had stains inside the toilet and makeup marks on the door so hadn't been cleaned properly before our arrival or for the remainder of our stay so imagine it's still there (Room 522). After arrival and a sit down for 5 minutes interrupted by air conditiong repair person not a major problem but when we didn't check in until 3.30pm thought they may have planned it a bit better. Breakfast was slow and disorganised and you can't sit down until someone marks you off a list which seemed to be a problem for staff. No one came to offer us a drink so we had to go and find someone, then there were no glasses for fruit juice so had to go and find someone for that. The breakfast scenario repeated again on the 2nd day but also included running out of fruit salad. Checkout took 15minutes because of a broken printer again it's nothing major but a lot of small areas with poor service add up especially when it was a special occassion that we staying here for. I would not visit this hotel again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone with the current level of service being provided as despite the hotel having 4 stars the service lets it down too much and would imagine if it continues this way will loose their rating at some point soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot work out negative Reviews This place was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: murthwc
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel 3 rooms for a weekend looked at reviews before we went and thought oh no so many negative ... Arriving the Hotel staff were so friendly and the decor inside is so lovely .. the rooms were so clean and the the 32 inch tele in the room was superb yes the rooms are fairly small but adequate and not cramped at all and lets face it you only sleep there !! the good thing was 12.00 check out and we could leave our luggage there till 7.00pm when we had checked out this was free ... next time would stay there again and the location is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT use this chain if you want to stay in the hotel you actually thought you bookedbooked”
Reviews.Author: basWales
Reviews.Content: We booked the Shaftsbury Hyde Park International via Hotel Direct, without consulting this site until it was too late. We, like many others were shunted to a different hotel -in this case the Grand Royale. The room was tiny -barely room to pass by the end of the bed and no mini bar. There were steps in the room leading to the bathroom, which could have been very dangerous if someone forgot and tried getting to the bathroom at night without turning the light on. In the hotels favour however, the bedding and bathroom were clean and the location is great, being just across the road from Hyde Park. The reason I would not recommend this hotel to a friend is because the likelihood is that if they book it, they will end up staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcome”
Reviews.Author: GlrGer
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I recently stayed at the Grand Royale, and were extremely disappointed in all areas. When we arrived, we were told there was no reservation for us, and that we'd made a mistake. I had to dig up my confirmation email to show the attendant. He told me to wait in the lobby, then begrudgingly called the reservation office. After almost twenty five minutes of sitting in the waiting room and getting indifferent, bored glances from the employees, he told me my room was ready. He didn't apologize in the least for the inconvenience. I inquired about the possibility of staying over another night, and he told me stiffly they were booked solid. When I got to my room, out of curiosity, I looked online and their website showed plenty of availability. To be sure, I even called their reservation number. They assured me there was availability. The WIFI in the hotel was terrible, as was the luke warm water in the shower. I called down to the front desk to ask for a corkscrew, and they never got back to me. After an hour I just went and bought one. While the location is decent, be warned. There were groups of drunken men sitting on the steps of the adjacent hotel across the street, cat calling all women who walked by. I would be wary of staying here. There are quite a few hotels in the immediate area that are probably more worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and very poor quality customer service”
Reviews.Author: AnniePB
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous comments - we were also victims of double booking which scuppered our plans for an ideal location for the concert in Hyde Park. We were transferred to Shaftesbury Avenue, Piccadilly and in total lost 2 hours on Saturday travelling across London in heavy traffic. After that experience we resorted to the tube. Reception staff at Grand Royale Hyde Park were unhelpful, told us they had booked a car but had to be reminded 20 minutes later. We witnessed "who shouts loudest gets a room", but surely at others' expense! No complaints about the Shaftesbury Hotel, customer service and breakfast excellent - it was just not where we wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “always make overbookings”
Reviews.Author: OXFORD61
Reviews.Content: This hotel operates an over booking system where they inform you on arrival that there are air-con or plumbing maintenance issues, so you need to be moved to another hotel in EARLS COURT!!!! (Miles away). They even have an account with a local mini-cab firm to transport you there. It's all lies, they just overbook and move you to a sister hotel away from the location you chose and researched! DON'T put up with this, stand your ground and refuse to go, they eventually give in and miraculously find available rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Tried to move us to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHaleUK
Reviews.Content: On check in we were told that due to â€œmaintenance issuesâ€� we would have to move to another hotel. As this has happened to me before in London, with dire consequences i.e. the alternative hotel was substandard and in the wrong location, I challenged this and asked for a refund. Nothing was forthcoming. After much argument and discussion, the manager offered us a room but at least 4 other guests we spoke to were moved elsewhere. I suspect this practice is wide spread. Hotels are overbooking and then they decide in which sister hotel you will stay! Often miles away. We had booked a double deluxe and because of the fuss we were offered a club room which was just about acceptable in terms of size, and was clean with pleasant dÃ©cor, although the bathroom was tiny with the smallest wash basin I have ever seen! We were asked to pay in advance and heard others being asked to pay a Â£5 deposit on top to cover any phone calls. Altogether a wholly unacceptable and unpleasant experience. Such a shame because the hotel is historic and full of character in the public rooms. Ruined by management mal practice!

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the hotel for 1 night with my...”
Reviews.Author: MKellas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night with my husband as we were there to see a concert in Hyde park. It was located within walking distance of the park so that was ideal. It is also just around the corner from the queensway tube so it's also well located for getting to the rest of London. The whole building has a very grand feel and has some really nice period features. The staff were very professional and helpful. We arrived early and they had no problem storing our bags for us until check in and did the same for us on check out. We booked room only & when we asked about breakfast were told it was Â£12 each if prebooked or Â£15 if we just turned up on the morning. This was abit pricey so we looked elsewhere & found a fantastic place called latana in Charlotte place. Get a tube to goodge street & it's two minutes round the corner. Well worth it for a special breakfast. Back to the hotel. The room we had was a double however was very limited on space. You had to take it in turns to get ready whilst the other person sat on the bed as there was nowhere else to go. There was a very thin passageway between the door & the bed where you could stand or go in the bathroom. The room overall was nicely decorated in a modern style, the bathroom too was really nice & modern & both were very clean. The room had a flatscreen tv which I had to tune in myself. The air conditioning in the room was very noisy but had no choice but to put it on as you were unable to keep the window open as they were weighted so that they shut if you tried to leave them open. The shower was also a joke as there is no power to it & it just trickles out. It took me a while to get the shampoo out of my hair! I did not pay full price for the room & am glad that I didn't because I may have felt a little ripped off. This is a slight case of style over substance.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 location”
Reviews.Author: danandmark
Reviews.Content: This place is G8! yes the rooms are compact but they clean well looked after, location is brill in easy reach of everything and has a history about the place, check out the history, i loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Unfriendly staff on reception”
Reviews.Author: Sena88
Reviews.Content: when I was checking in hotel, I came across the worst service possible. No details r provide, you have chase for everything in the hotel. Breakfast staff was friendly and nice, but overall not worthwhile to spend money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most unfriendly reception staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: nicolas_bc
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the beds are comfy and the place is pretty clean. However, the rooms are extremely small. No, honestly, it is borderline ridiculous. The main problem though is the reception staff : they were extremely unfriendly. None of them was fluent in English either. It was so bad you could feel the tension in the reception area at all times. We never felt welcome in the hotel during our 3 days there. No sign of the managenent either. I wonder if they read this reviews. When we arrived, the handle in our minuscule room's window was broken so the window could not be opened. We asked for a change of room and we were told that "windows cannot be opened due to health and safety reasons, anyway". After a bit of an argument, they reluctanctly gave us another room with a minuscule window and two single beds instead of a double bed. We are a young, easygoing and chilled couple in our early thirties so give us some credit here, we are not difficult people - however the horrible attitude of the reception staff was truly remarkable. Never seen anything like it.

Reviews.Title: “Lilliput Hotel - fit for lilliputions”
Reviews.Author: Glutton4Punishment
Reviews.Content: Lovely facade and beautiful reception room which is used extensively in the website - it doesnt tell the story. Shabby bar and indifferent staff. I had a "deluxe" double room - actually finished quite nicely though the bathroom was unfinished - the floor tiles were not grouted and so had cracked - the builders pencil markings were still all over the tiles - has anyone snagged it? The bedroom felt utterly chlaustrophobic, it cant have been more than 12ft by 12ft - the window didn't open and the air con was very noisy - I think to ensure that I didnt feel too trapped they had arranged for the room door to have a faulty lock!!! I'd say that if you were pushed, use it for one night as its clean and tidy - its never a Â£100+ a night hotel and I'd plain refuse to spend more than Â£90 on it.

Reviews.Title: “Offensive”
Reviews.Author: Jollydublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located which is why I booked it. The rooms are nice and the decor is to a high standard from what I saw although the rooms are a little noisy. However the difficulties I had was with the lack of professionalism and hospitality with the staff. They were unhelpful; unfriendly and spoke to each other using profanities with in ear shot of guests. We were switched from our original booking hotel to their sister hotel close by at the last minute. In both hotels I was asked if I wanted a twin room despite booking a double room (we are a same sex couple) and even had smirks to add insult to injury. This overall made it an uncomfortable expereince.

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectation and you would be alright”
Reviews.Author: holidaymanSingapore
Reviews.Content: The location is great, especially if you like chinese food and travel out of london. Queensway station is used to travel into London and also to Westfield shopping centre. Baywater is good for travel to Paddington, which leads you to Oxford, Bath spa, Winsor castle. Don't expect much from the reception though. A lot of disputes can be heard daily. The same room type will provide you a variety of room size.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately go again.”
Reviews.Author: Brysonwannabe
Reviews.Content: We nearly didn't book this Hotel because of the negative reviews, but because of it's proximty to the Porchester Spa, (which we love) on Queensway, http://www.courtneys.co.uk/centres/Porchester/the-porchester-spa We thought we'd take a chance. We're really glad we did too, the staff were great, the breakfast was good, and the location was great 2mins from Queensway tube. The room was very comfy and very clean, ok it was a little bijou but we had everything we needed, and room to spill out and chill out. We can recommend this great little hotel and will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Newly Renovated, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: traveler1434
Reviews.Content: Spent the first night of 2 week holiday in UK at this hotel. It was a pleasure to arrive from a long intercontinental flight to a nice clean room. Front desk staff were helpful. There was a problem with my reservation but it was settled quickly and was upgraded to a double room from a single room at no extra charge. Rooms are well decorated with new furnishings and finish. They are small but that is typical for hotel rooms in London. Great location close to Kensignton Gardens, and Bayswater Road I would stay here again next time I visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, tiny room, lousy internet”
Reviews.Author: CKENewJersey
Reviews.Content: The entry to this hotel is beautiful as is the "drawing room." Upstairs, the rooms are tiny but spotlessly clean. The bathroom is small but clean. Water pressure is quite low, but I did get a hot shower. The bar is in an cool restored theater. The hotel has an interesting history. If you're not trying to get online and don't need much space, this hotel is fine, and inexpensive. The location is very close to Hyde Park and several tube stations. There is a tourist area a block away, with money changers in every third store-front. If you're trying to change currency, look around at rates before you settle on one. But this was the cheapest place I've found so far to change money. No commission, and no processing fee, plus the rates were quite competitive. My biggest problem was the internet. I needed to get online as I'm stranded in London due to the Iceland volcano eruption. Lots of guests were having the same problem. Every time I asked for help, I'd get the same line. If I was in the lobby, they'd tell me to return to my room as the internet "is working in the rooms" and once in my room, I'd call to complain and they'd tell me to come down to the lobby and drawing room, since "it's working fine down here." I would get intermittent connectivity, but all the guests were having similar problems as I discovered when I listened to the front desk give the same line of bull to three other guests. They way they handled this, I got the impression that they give this line to every guest every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sol1612
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the park and near the tube. Very good!!!!! great tip: book direct with the hotel and the breakfast is free! The breakfast is very good. Fruits, yogurt, juice, and of course, english breakfast, beans, tomatos. the staff is so nice! When I arrived, I didn't have sterlins, just dollars, the cab driver didn't accepted them and the porter gave borrow the money!!!!!! very nice.... yes, the room is very, very small....... smaller than should be. But I see it in two ways: for the price, the hotel is good. It is new...... clean........ you have a choice:stay in other hotel bigger but old or in this one..... Very small but very clean. avoid: do not stay on the last floor. the shower doesn't have pressure. and if you complain, they will change room.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive entrance,small caravan like room.”
Reviews.Author: ROGERBEALE
Reviews.Content: Hoping for a romantic memorable two night weekend stay but was left feeling totally "RIPPED OFF". Was not shown to our room....the staff were probably too embarrassed. The room was tiny with a small single half drop wardrobe.No room to move or store anything.Bed was small but comfortable . Shower room was miniscule with WC touching the wall,had to sit on sideways to avoid my legs contacting the smallest hand basin i've ever seen. Shower tray was about 18" X 18" with a sort shower curtain that clung to my body. The shower room useable floor area was 4' X 4'. I ordered a Â£22 bottle of wine to come into which turned out to be a HALF BOTTLE of red French plonk on ice!! . I also ordered the optional Â£17 "CHOCOLATE HEAVEN" which I found out is 13 Fererro Roche!! That equates to OVER Â£1 PER CHOCOLATE!!!! Breakfast was not too bad but there were NO glasses for juice / water on either morning.I did ask but it took 10 / 15 minutes to get them. Over all I think we were in "LILLY'S" dolls house. " NOT IMPRESSED. Most expensive caravan like accommodation I've ever been tricked into. . .

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: LondonDavem
Reviews.Content: Perfect in every way, friendly welcoming staff, fabulous panelled entrance hall, lounge & dining room ( a rare treat to see) that contrasts well with modern clean well appointed rooms. Plasma TV, free Wi Fi, good shower . Breakfast was first rate, great choice & good service. Location next to Queensway is a bonus. Nice area also pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ParisWoman
Reviews.Content: A wonderful surprice! Hotel was totally renovated, just to have a new bathroom in a hotel in London is a gift!! The hotel looked beautiful from outside, like a fairytale, and we got a very professional welcome by Susana. And the room... All new and lovely! Ok, a bit small, but that was never a problem. I have stayed in so many hotels in this area, so tired and old, this was just amazing. I am so happy I discovered this hotel, and will from now on be a guest here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: ambers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights early Feb, and got a good deal with bookings.com of Â£55.00 per night. The hotel is literally 2 minutes round the corner from Queensway tube! The room was small as expected from reviews but recently refurbished and spotlessly clean with power shower. For a couple of nights its fine as we didnt have a lot of luggage and were only in the room a bit. We would stay here again and would recommend it too!

Reviews.Title: “TrÃ¨s bien”
Reviews.Author: slaincom
Reviews.Content: Luxuary, very polite service and room really cosy. Some people said room was little, but honnestly room is for sleep. When you are in London, you exit every time. So very good hÃ´tel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: thingy1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated just round the corner from Bayswater Road not a bad location, however the road it is situated in looks very run down and sleezy. As for the front of the Hotel , The only thing Grand about it was the Sign above the door saying Grand Royale Hotel. The interior wasn't much better it resembled something from a Horror film, very Gothic with wooden paneling every where. If you are looking for a modern Hotel cross this one of your list. I found myself very keen to get out of the Hotel as much as possible as I found the staff not very friendly and also not very welcoming and at times intimidating. Not a pleasant experience for what they claim is a 4 star hotel. I think the rating must have been compared to a hotel in a war zone. My own view is that the Hotel is valued more as a 2 star. I wasn't very impressed with the manager Mr O'Neil . While I was there I observed the way he treated other visitors and lets just say I am glad I didn't have to approach him myself for anything. He seemed quite intimidating and I was also surprised how casually he was dressed for a manger of a 4 star Hotel, he reminded me of a second hand car dealer . All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: marrhar
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - the rooms are all recently refurbished, with high quality finishes. All rooms have flat panel tvs, under floor heating in the bathrooms and free internet access - these are my favourite features here. The reception and dining room are very impressive and have a nice unique hotel feel that is so difficult to find in the large homogenous chain hotels. The only thing that I wish they could change is I wish they had ironing facilities in the rooms as standard and a fridge - but this is because I pretty much live here in the week and these would be really useful for my long stay requirements - maybe in the larger rooms have these as standard?

Reviews.Title: “Sold one thing - got another. Read on!!”
Reviews.Author: OutandaboutHants
Reviews.Content: We were booked in to stay at the Shaftesbury Premier London Hyde Park. But like many people found on our arrival that they had a problem (gas leak on this occasion ) and we would have to be re located to another of their hotels which was still a 4 star hotel and had been refurbished in the last 3 months. (Why did they not call us, they had our home and mobile numbers). We where asked to pay for our stay before they would book a taxi to take us to the our new hotel. We were not told the name of the new hotel or its location, just that it was about a 10 minute walk away. The taxi turned out to be a mini bus, which we think belonged to the hotel, as it was not marked as a taxi. We were then taken to the new hotel and dropped about 50m from the entrance. The driver pointed to the hotel and then was off, no chance to say no take us back. The Grand Royale is a very old hotel and in its day (1850'ish) would have been called Grand. We had booked the Shaftsbury as we like hotels with a modern interior. At reception they informed us that they knew we were coming but our room was not ready so we left our bags and went for a walk. On returning an hour later we collected our key and were told where our room was (not shown). The maid was still cleaning the room and we had to wait for another 15 mins. THE ROOM!! We had booked a Superior Room. Good points - yes it was clean, yes it had a bed and a TV. Bad points - The bed was a small double, we can't remember the last time we had a hotel bed this small!!! There was about a foot of space on either side of the bed, infact it was so close to the wall that my partner stubbed his toe on the radiator during the night. Looking on the bright side there was no chance of falling out of bed - there was no room!!! The bathroom - Yes it was new but very very small. Infact I am only short (5'2") but I could touch both walls both width and depth ways!! The last time I was in a bathroom that size was on a caravan holiday. The side of the bath was also very high which made it hard to get out of. The shower panel was so small that the bathroom was flooded when you used it. We were in room 311 at the back of the hotel, our view was of the back of flats and shops and the rubbish bins. So closed the curtains and didn't look again. Now to breakfast. We had breakfast on the first day but did not bother on the second. Most of it was cold, the fruit juice had run out and we had to ask for them to refill the containers. Watch out!! We had paid for breakfast at the Shaftesbury but when we checked at reception they said we hadn't, we had taken our booking paperwork with us which showed breakfast included. The receptionist said she would take this off the bill but when we checked out we were still asked to pay for it. Also the bar was closed during our stay. Overall we were very disappointed this was not what we would have expected in a 4 star hotel and would not book with Shaftesbury Hotels again. If you do book with them then it would be a good idea to ring them on the day you are due to stay with them and find out if there are any problems with your room or the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, full english breakfast, small but manageable rooms,very clean.”
Reviews.Author: cdjvino
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days at this hotel over Valentine's weekend because my boyfriend refused to pay the doubled prices at the Hilton. I was ready to be disappointed after reading the reviews, but was very pleasantly surprised by the Hotel itself and especially the staff. The rooms are small, but having stayed many, many times in London, I would say they were average size for the price. However, the beds were very comfy, with fluffy comforters, nicely placed reading lights, an empty fridge(so you could use it for juice or wine), big soft towels which were changed daily, coffee and tea supplies. My boyfriend is blind, and he had no trouble navigating in the room or getting to and from the lift. We had an interior 5th floor room which was very quiet. We did not choose breakfast initially, but arrived early with our luggage, which they tagged and stored for us. Initially they couldn't find our online reservation but assured us they would do so, and to come back in a few hours to check in at the standard time. When we returned, they apologized for the problems and gave us free breakfast for the entire stay. Just around the corner is the tube station, Queensway, and the street it is on is full of nice little restaurants, shops and a few decent pubs. We ate in several of the restaurants because they were so convenient and excellent. Also, our internet worked perfectly and we had no problems of any kind with anything else. And, as an added bonus, the little bar in the hotel had very reasonably priced drinks for London.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BellaF_9
Reviews.Content: Lovely old buiding, very decrotive and grand reception and breakfast room. Rooms are on the small side, butt the bed was comfy and we found it more than adequate for our one night stay. Breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice. The staff were great - couldn't do enough for us. The location is great two minute walk away from both Bayswater and Queensway tube, about 5 mins to Leicester Square from Queensway on the Central line - only problem was that you have to get a elevator to and from the trains at Queenway which always had a long que or tackle the 123 steps!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Serenity15
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 4 nights on business with a colleague, and I can't fault it! Sure the room was a little small, but the bed was comfortable, it was well decorated, clean, with all the facilities you need, including free wifi in the rooms. The en-suite bathroom with shower, complementary toiletries and under floor heating was lovely. The location was brilliant, close to Hyde Park, walking distance from Paddington Station and underground station. A wide variety of restaurants nearby. There was a complimentary fruit bowl available in reception. Don't believe all the bad reviews, I really don't know what some people want!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: katiejane36
Reviews.Content: Just got back after spending 3 nights at this hotel. We were originally quoted Â£376 for our stay - then discovered a few days before we arrived we could get the same nights for Â£100 less, just by rechecking their website! So we cancelled then rebooked! The hotel itself was ideally located for local transport links to the centre of London. The room was small but had all the usual essentials (TV, tea/coffee, hair dryer etc) although, having short legs, I found it difficult to climb into the bed as it was so high! It was nicely decorated and clean. Despite our room facing onto a block of flats we had a decent sleep. The breakfast choice was exceptional - buffet style with a wide choice of food, from the health conscious fruit and yoghurt lovers to the traditional fry up fans! For London, well worth the money and would recommend it. One disadvantage was that they don't accept Visa Electron cards which meant we practically blew the credit card despite having budgeted for it in our normal bank account.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Darlis
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Premier which is a 5 min car journey away, on arrival we were told we had to move and they had arranged a taxi for us. There was no apology and after an argument they agreed to give us complimentary parking and provide us with taxis there and back. On arrival at the Grand Royale (it looks like a scary old building), the receptionist that checked us in Anca was very rude (still no apology or explanation). We eventually arrived at our room (90 mins after arriving at the hotel we booked) which was very small, there was a weird creeking noise every 10 minute which sounded like tables being dragged around upstairs. There was no fruit basket (as promised when we booked) and the WIfi wasn't working. It was no where close to the delux we were expecting. We spoke to reception and a friendlier member of staff showed us 3 other rooms which were just as small. She told us that we had one of the best rooms in the hotel (a club room). In the end we decided to settle for what we had been given. Breakfast was chaotic, they didn't leave you with a pot of tea (like every other hotel) they would pour you a cup on request, the waiter was taking sugar and milk from other peoples tables. The food was constantly running out and very cold. When we checked out and reminded her Anca we needed a taxi she seemed very put out and miserable. I would never book a Shaftesbury hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: PPPNorthamptonshire
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms through the hotel so they threw in breakfast as part of the deal (approx Â£70 per room per night). I booked a twin and a double deluxe, When we arrived we were shown our rooms, the twin room was passable but the double was not so we asked for my daughter and her partner to be moved to a larger room. The new room was more spacious, both rooms were well decorated, clean, warm and fine for a weekend. If booking a room go for a twin as they are larger, both beds are pushed together anyway as there is no room for them to be seperated. The lounge, bar and staff were fine. Breakfast was average, but for the price that was ok. I would warn you to breakfast early as on the second day we arrived at 9.30am and had to wait 35mins for a table. Not sure why this was as there was a second dinning room next door which was not being used. To sum up if i had paid more for the rooms i would have been disappointed about the size but for the price they were compact clean and warm and had the added bonus of being in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: karmacowboy
Reviews.Content: The most rude and inflexible desk clerks ever in a hotel. The manager should be ashamed of himself!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: QualityAlways
Reviews.Content: The room my husband booked a club room which he was informed was better than a deluxe room. What a disaster....... I got to the hotel later than my husband and was very pleased with the spacious entrance and lounges it looked stunning so I was looking forward to seeing our room. It was TINY........ you could not move around the bed!! I thought it was a joke and if not for the fact that we had booked with last minute and we needed to get to the theatre then we would have left there and then. If you want a hotel room with space do not book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Never accept Room 27!”
Reviews.Author: SilviaUK
Reviews.Content: I had already stayed at the same hotel recently so I thought to stay there again as the first experience was not too bad. Rooms are indeed small as other travellers confirmed but it's not too bad as you really have to sleep there only. The hotel is new and looks posh from outside but the layout is really poor so you end up in winding corridors as well as small rooms. The problem this time was that my room (no. 27) was next to the emergency exit, which was constantly used as service door; the main problem was that people would stop there during their breaks to smoke so the smell would enter my room. I could hardly sleep that night! So, in general it's fine for a short stay, location is great as you have Queensway tube station around the corner. I don't recommend breakfast as it's not good value for money (it costs Â£15, there are plenty of places nearby).

Reviews.Title: “If you do not want a good treatment this is the place”
Reviews.Author: Grilled
Reviews.Content: There was a power cut in the second night of my stay at around 11:30 pm. Emergency lights died just a few hours after that incident. Then there was a fire alarm. I was staying on the 4th floor. We could not find the fire escape in the dark. I wonder who approved their emergency scheme??? So if you do not want to get grilled in the middle of the night Do not go there. It is dangerous. Furthermore, there was no appology, no complements next day. Breakfast is a different story all together. There are waiters runing around. There is always something missing on the buffet. Well, Internet is free. Does it worth it??

Reviews.Title: “like a b+b”
Reviews.Author: pauevans15
Reviews.Content: They say this hotel is a 4star, FREE UPGRADE and it was still poor very small It is more like a b+b than a hotel the breakfast was a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea011
Reviews.Content: There was a 5 hour power cut at the hotel, and there weren't any emergency light along the hallway or in the room. It was terribly unsafe when the fire alarm went off and I couldn't see anything to get out of room. The electric door also didn't work, so anyone could have got in the room to steal the valuables in case of the power cut/fire. I have no idea how this hotel pass the safety inspection and earn a 4*. The room is much too small than what everyone would expect, no matter if it's a deluxe or a superior. The good thing about it is that it's still new, and pretty clean.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: mdmcornwall
Reviews.Content: Just as well we didn't have a cat, certainly nowhere to swing it! Newly refurbished rooms are done tastefully but 1/2 the size they should be for the rates. Fine for 6 year olds on their own - not a lot of call for this I should imagine. DM.Cornwall

Reviews.Title: “GIVE THIS NEWLY OPENED HOTEL A TRY”
Reviews.Author: Curly81
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been reopened and although upgrading is still continuing, (however not obtrusively to guests) it is a very good hotel, and when all works are completed, it has the potential for being a really excellent hotel. Its location is perfect for central London. Queensway and Bayswater stations close by. It is next to Hyde Park with plenty of eating places at hand. We stayed in a double deluxe room with breakfast included. The room was excellent value (Â£97) for central London. Room size was good, and all finishes were new. We had a good night's sleep and no outside noise. The hotel still has plenty of 'old worlde' charm, because the lobby and ground floor rooms were of original wood panelling with huge fireplaces, and stained glass windows and original art covered ceilings visible from the second floor, were still complete (hope these features never get removed!) There are two lifts to the upper floors. My only gripe was that the cooked breakfast was lukewarm, but we asked a member of staff to put it in the microwave which they did willingly. Staff deserve a mention here because we found them very helpful. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's New in great location! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: CCinSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nites with my 4 yo. Hotel just reopened after major refurbishment so everything was spanking new & clean! Comfy bed, good sized bathroom (with Grohe fixtures!), tea/coffee making facilities (great if yr child still drinks milk), LCD TV, excellent location (5 mins walk to Queensway & Bayswater Tube Stations, 3 mins to bus stop with buses to Oxford street about 5 stops away). Esp good for young children cos I could return to hotel for my 4yo to rest up before heading out again. Staff were very helpful & children friendly. Just wish the Double Deluxe was a tab bigger or at least a proper space for my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Where deluxe means a 2.5m by 2.5m room!”
Reviews.Author: nina_auth
Reviews.Content: We have chosen the hotel due to its location. I do know that hotel rooms in major European cities are generally small but this was literally tiny, there was only place for a double bed. There was not even place to put our two-cabin size bags. Before making the reservation I phoned to the hotel and I was adviced to pay for a deluxe room if I need more space. I can not imagine what a standard room would look like, or maybe I was fooled and be allocated a standard room after paying for a deluxe one. When I complained that my room doesn't look like the one published in the Internet they say they will check it and the following day instead of offering some kind of compensation they simply said I was right and ensured me that they were going to change the photos, as if this was my problem. The hotel has been recently reopened after undergoing a major refurbishment. This is probably why nothing works properly and the tecnical staff keeps making noise in the corridor outside my room at 3pm when I was trying to rest after a long bussiness meeting. I must admit that the public areas are quite impresive, if this is what you look for.

Reviews.Title: “Newly opened, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BabyBlueLou
Reviews.Content: This hotel only opened on 31st Oct 2009 so the reviews from before that do not apply. The location is excellent with many restaurants & shops on the surrounding streets. The building is beautiful and the staff were friendly. I booked a deluxe double through book travel and stay for Â£95 - a clear bargain for central London. Taking this into account I was very pleased (though I would not have been had I paid the Â£300 rack rate). The first room we got was so tiny I thought there must have been a mistake so I went to reception to explain the problem and they kindly moved me to a larger room at no extra cost. This second room was much better. Although the rooms are extremeky small they are very well appointed and decorated with class and care - stand alone sinks, flat screen TVs, newly refurbished in every part. My good ranking is taking into account the price I got for the room and the helpfulness of the staff. It is not worth the rack rates on the website however - though what hotel in London is?

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep, but not much more.”
Reviews.Author: ubreinli
Reviews.Content: Two years ago my wife and I went to London for our honeymoon, and ended up at this hotel. It's located in Bayswater, close to Hyde park, so I find the location very good. The hotel itself however...not so good. The first day we didn't get into our room because of som problems with the key card, and the staff wasn't thrilled to help. The room we got was the smallest hotel room I've ever been to, an the bathroom was equally tiny. Apart from this, and the cockroaches, the hotel was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by this clean and tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryLecale
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in room 304 and was really impressed with the spotlessly tidy and comfortable room. The whole place has been recently refurbished and was like new.The room was on the front but no noise issues. It was everything i could have hoped for. The local Lo Spuntino Bar/Cafe on Bayswater road serves very nice food and amazing coffee. When you read negative remarks about small rooms you have to wonder what people expect from a City Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirlNSW
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel had lost our booking and gave us dirty looks like it was our fault even though we had paid in advance. The staff were rude and not at all helpful. Also their English was very limited which made communication difficult. We were put in a room at the back of the hotel and felt that because we were not paying the top rate on the top floor we were treated like we were not worth the time of day. Breakfast was an experience in itself. We were glared at by a waitress when we walked in and the food was cold and tasted terrible. We commented on the service and food to reception but were just greeted with a shrug. It was a relief to check out of that place. We even filled out one of the comment cards but because our review of their place was less than favourable we were not surprised to ever get a response from them. London - Great place. Shaftsbury Premier Inn - Not so great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a London city-break... Just don't expect luxury or great service!”
Reviews.Author: PortoPortugal
Reviews.Content: The first impact is great: the faÃ§ade is amazing and the lobby and public areas around it are just beautiful. The rooms are very small (and by that I mean really really small!!!!) and the only view you get is to a wall, but they're comfortable and, let's face it, you don't go to London to spend much time in a hotel room. The staff could use some training and some costumer service skills but they're OK, just don't expect big warm welcoming smiles (or any sort of smile for that matter) and if you want to hit the night and stay in bed the whole morning, be prepared to be woken-up a few times by the impatient cleaning ladies knocking on your door (and even opening it and walking into the room). The location is fairly central and close to the tube and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Grace in Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: kathryn5353
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has the most gracious and spacious entrance area, reminiscent of an 'Old Boys Club'. There is a glorious,wood panelled sitting room for guests to enjoy. The rooms are small, make no mistake, but for price, location & decore they are second to none. Hyde Park, Queensway and SO many restaurants, bars and shops are steps away. Every attention to detail has been addressed in this hotel's upgrade: Outstanding bathrooms, huge TV screens and well planned, luxurious fixtures & fittings. Our small , but beautiful, wrought iron balcony overlooked Inverness Terrace and out to Hyde Park. A fruit platter was offered on arrival, and we were staying in the standard room. We stayed in London 5YEARS AGO in this same area, and paid the SAME AMOUNT for accomodation which was closer to a Retention Center than a hotel. This place offers grace, quality and location at an extraordinary price. We could not have been happier. Utilise their limo booking service which gets you to Heathrow for a quarter of the price you would pay in a taxi.. quality and relaxation. Can not recommend this Hotel highly enough for couples and business.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Mrs-JB
Reviews.Content: Like most people we read the reviews written and then spent many, many hours surfing the net to find that elusive "excellent" rating. This time we decided to 'bite the bullet' and booked up over the phone and resigned ourselves to the fact that you only spend the night in a hotel to sleep, not live. We booked up a Sunday night at a cost of Â£62 for a double with breakfast included (the internet price was Â£55 bed only) so i thought Â£7 for breakfast for the two of us was better value. We arrived at the hotel early where we stored our bags. We returned at two and found that our room was still not ready. Due to the fact we needed our room to freshen up to go out again they upgraded our room free of charge. We got room 519. Wow!! It was the biggest hotel room I've ever been in (and i've been in many). A sunken bath and shower. In the bedroom was a large four-poster bed and furniture to die for. The hotel room alone was at least forty foot square. The breakfast was a buffet and no complaints there either, left there 'stuffed'. The hotel is Edwardian and the woodwork, ceilings and drawing room are breath-taking. Although we did not experience the "tiny rooms" as described by other reviews, i for one will return regardless of room size. All we want is a bed and somewhere to freshen up, we could spend the day in the drawing room without a single breath of complaint.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied guest”
Reviews.Author: lilpuppy
Reviews.Content: The good things: Nice decorated rooms, free internet in the lobby, free internet in the room, clean, good english breakfast (if included, though not worth 15Â£ as they would otherwise charge).Close to underground station and morningwalk in Hydepark. After complaining about the fact that the triple room is really a double room with chair upfolded to an extra bed the staff solved this in excelent way by giving us an extra single room. Helpful and friendly staff. The bad things: Triple roomÂ´s not really triple room and way to small for three people. Bathroom and shower verry tiny, clean except for the showerdrape. The corridore on our floor (basement) had a funny (but not to stinky) smell. I would defenetley stay here again. Especially for the sake of free internet in room (witch at another hotel during my stay in london charged 5Â£/h or 12Â£/24h) I do recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotelguyFinland
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing was that the room was in the basement and quite small but considering the standart of Londons hotels, this one was very good value for the money that we paid. We got double room for 70 pound per night and we stayed for five nights. Air conditioning was great and the bathroom also, there was also a fridge in the room which was great. Breakfest was ok, more vegetables would have been nice. But generally we can recommend this hotel to everyone who appreciate great location but don't pay more than a 90 pound per night, you can get better hotel with that money.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Barganax
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the hotel. The bad stuff? Well, my heart sank when I saw that it was directly opposite a homeless hostel, lots of shifty people hanging around. I agree that the rooms are tiny and that they are hot! The good stuff? Well, the facade of the hotel and the public rooms are a treasure, they made me smile with delight. The hotel is just around the corner from Queensway, which has the greatest selection of restaurants I have ever seen. I was booked in with speed and the staff were friendly. I was shown the way to my room and yes, the corridors were narrow. I do not mind walking up stairs so that was no problem. The room was tiny, enough room for a bed and a tv. But as we were travelling light, there was no problem with the small wardrobe. The tv worked. The room was HOT. It took me a while to work out that the air conditioning was blowing hot air into the room. So, off that went and the window (clean the windows in a while please!!!) opened and the room was fine. My wife told me there was only tepid water in the morning for her sohwer. But for the money we paid (Â£90) we got a clean, tidy and comfortable room. It is great for tube stations, great for Hyde Park and great for eateries. I did not bother with the hotel restaureant as the menu wwas terrible. If I had stayed for longer maybe the small room would have grated and maybe my patience would have snapped over fixing things like the air conditioning

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Shaftesbury Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: CruiseNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay at the Shaftesbury Hyde Park HoteI (before I read the reviews) to celebrate special birthdays that myself and my husband were celebrating. To say I was very apprehensive about staying at the Shaftesbury after reading the reviews was an understatement, so I contacted the web-site via e-mail with whom I made the booking to voice my concerns informing them it was for a special occasion. I was assured that some of the problems had been addressed and most of the bad reviews were about how small the rooms were, I was also assured that as it was a special occasion they would leave a message at reception to provide me with one of their larger rooms. I was still unsure but as my stay was within a week and I was concerned about booking somewhere else I decided to give it a go, my husband said well it's only for one night. On the day of travel we were faced with train delays and then we got lost in London, by early evening and still trying to find the hotel (which was the husbands fault) by the time we did find it, I was ready to do battle with any cockroaches or reception staff. However reception informed us they were aware that it was a special occasion and that they had a lovely room for us, we thanked them but still not convinced until of course we went into the room, when we entered we were faced with 2 doors off a small hallway we entered the door on the right to be faced with what I can only describe as a suite, it was fabulous - we had a four poster king sized bed at least that's what it seemed like it was certainly bigger than the double bed we have at home, there was a hugh sofa and 3 large comfy chairs another 2 small chairs, a huge marble mantel & log fire which was serviced by gas (not sure if it worked as I didn't try it) beautiful built in wardrobes with plenty of storage space, we went back into the hallway to enter the room on the left, this was the bathroom and what a bathroom the bathroom also had a built in wardrobe, it had a beautiful huge bath (I think it was a double) with a shower over and the bathroom was nearly the size of the bedroom, I wished we had been staying longer we could have easily been happy staying in this suite for two, three or more weeks. I shall certainly stay there again but I would request the room number we had which was on the 5th floor as I did hear a gentleman complain while I was standing at reception about the size of his room he was not happy. But I can only say I am pleased I did not change the hotel and that I did voice my concerns about the problems, as perhaps this helped with the room I was allocated. Susan and Davey. Newcastle

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ChuckKildare00
Reviews.Content: Room far too small.TV broke down several times during my stay. My faulty key card had to be replaced .. no apology or comment ! Staff unhelpfull and unfriendly. Could`nt recommend this hotel to anyone. One of the worst hotels I`ve experienced.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel-but not what is advertised”
Reviews.Author: bigngay
Reviews.Content: our stay at this hotel was pleasent eventually we were a bit weary as we read the reviews after we booked but there was not a cockroach in sight and was assured when we rang the hotel that the problem was dealt with. the hotel rooms from the reception to the hotel rooms are not as big as they look on the pictures in fact when we arrived into our room we were horrified to find how tiny it was so we rang down to reception and the very polite receptionist said they would show us another room the following day. at 11 oclock no one came so we went out for the day arriving back at about 11 oclock on the evening we could not get into our room so a bell boy let us in and when we entered we realised that all our stuff was missing and someone elses stuff was in there instead they had moved us and our stuff with out any prior notice which made us feel violated as the chamber maids had rummaged through our belongings but the next room was slightly better in size on the front of the building on the 8th floor but only 1 lift in service so sometimes a bit of a queue .we complained to the duty manager because it was wrong that we were moved with out notice and somethings had gone missing which was slightly distressing as this was my bday and did not expect this kind of things to happen but after 2 days our missing items were rerturned thankfully and i was given a bottle of wine and bowl of fruit for my bday and a way of an appology.but after that things were fine . but please donot expect a large room they have none at all the pictures are very missleading they are incredibly small but comfortable . we had no problems booking in or out a matter of minutes. the staff were quite helpful .i would stay there again now i know what to expect overall not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “smallest room I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Adouglas81
Reviews.Content: Our family of three spent 3 nights at the Clarion Shaftesbury Hyde Park. We found the hotel to be quite close to the tube, 1/2 block to the Queensway stop and the same distance to Hyde Park. The lobby had three computers free for use including internet connection. The lobbies are beautifully decorated and quite comfortable. Upon check in we went straight to our room and were dismayed to find one double bed for for the three of us, with only 8 inches clearance all the way around the bed. We went straight back reception and had to show the clerk our reservation form showing a triple with refrigerator and microwave had been requested. We were then sent to another room with a double and a chair that made out into a twin bed. This room was again very small, but otherwise seemed clean and safe. We turned on the air conditioning and went to get supper. After supper and baths we realized the air conditioning would not stay on and called for maintenance. A young man came straight away and after some time said that he would arrange a new room for us. We were then moved to a third room. This was by far larger than the room we had just left and very nice. The rest of our stay was unhampered and the hotel was very clean and quiet. Hallways are very narrow, you must go single file. The breakfast was to expensive for us, we found several wonderful places around the corner from the tube station for a better price. I would not stay here again due to the size of the rooms and the initial room assignment.

Reviews.Title: “Can you not rate a hotel Zero?”
Reviews.Author: seffie4852
Reviews.Content: I have had the misfortune of staying at this hotel 3 times now on business, and not one of them was without incident. First stay, I had a bulging damp patch in the ceiling above my door which started to drip through the light fixtures at 2 in the morning. The shower was so small that the damp shower curtain stuck to my back. 2nd time around I was put in a basement room with a broken window which wouldn't close and had a noisy vetilation shaft running below it. I called reception to get someone to fix it but half an hour later, no-one had turned up so I went to reception myself and had to fight for a room change. The 3rd and final time I will ever stay at this hotel I arrived to find the shower wasn't working and I could hardly get my case up the side of the bed the room was that small. The shower was fixed the following day but that was a minor detail. On waking one morning I found the biggest cockroach I have ever seen climbing up my curtain. In thought I'd try and put it out of my mind (I was so exhausted with the hotel by this point) and stayed for my final night. Awoke at midnight to find 6 of the buggers down the side of my bed! Called reception imediately (few of the staff have the best grasp of English) and they sent up a poor, unsuspecting man with a bottle of Coke - they thought I wanted room service! I was told that 'It is just a cockroach' and 'It's probably left the room'. I demanded another room change and was put in an icy shoebox with a pin-hole for a window. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our trip!”
Reviews.Author: hjwhite
Reviews.Content: In London for a very special occassion, booked through internet which implied it was a luxery 4* hotel. On arrival kept waiting, room in basement, no air, very stuffy and smelly. Toilet was dirty, cups had lipstick on, milk was mouldy. No plug for bath, no extractor fan, no view, very small window hardly opened, bedside lamps didn't work, 'twin' beds but due to lack of space there was no gap between beds. As soon as we put the ironing board up there was no room to move at all. Glass shower guard was hanging off the wall. We paid for breakfast but they didn't have us down for having paid so the manager refused us breakfast and we got no apologies for anything and got told by the manager that it wasn't his fault the hotel is run by CentralR. Never go there, we paid Â£180 and it wasn't worth Â£18 - very upsetting and dissapointing - couldn't wait to get back home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Small”
Reviews.Author: brit1209
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do don't bother paying any extra for a twin "luxury" room. The twin rooms are exactly the same size as all the double rooms and there is not enough space to separate the beds either, so in fact it's a double except that you have a two single beds pushed together. How that justifies the extra Â£50 I don't know. The guy at reception accepted that there is now difference in size but would not refund the difference. The rooms are very very small. Interiours fitted to a high standard yet the lack of space lets it down. The breakfast rooms is also so small also that we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated as it was full. Staff were pleasant and all seemed to speak good English, the service on the whole I would rate as good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KrissJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shaftesbury Hyde Park for 5 nights. As it was relatively cheap - GBP 480 including vat - we just hoped for the best. Having a 4 star rating, we expected quite high standards which was most definately not met. At best it deserves a 3 star rating. Our deluxe room was minute. We were expected to stay for almost a week with very little closet space and only two hangers. It was difficult to move around. Granted, it had a large modern TV, and the bathroom was OK. Just a word of warning though... If you are tall, stay away. The bed is just a double, and the shower is so low that you will bump your head. The shower is situated in the bath which is so high that an older person or child would find it almost impossible to get in and out of. The breakfast was OK but not what one would expect from a 4 star hotel. It was the same for 5 mornings with absolutely no variation in style of eggs, fruit, juice, etc. The absolute best part of this hotel is the location. It is very close to Queensway and Bayswater stations. It is also within walking distance to a lot of attractions eg. Diana Memorial, Kensington Palace, bus stops etc. It was cleanish, and well maintained. The staff was friendly and assisted where possible. One morning at around 03:30 the fire alarm went off twice for no reason. We had to phone to have them switch it off. I presume it is faulty as there was no fire anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: sense7
Reviews.Content: I was on the ground floor , which from reading the other reviews is one of the bigger rooms. Fine for one person but as soon as my partner arrived on the 2nd night the room was far too small for two people to be in. Rooms were never cleaned properly and although everything worked in my room every single time I passed though reception (without exception) there was someone complaining (I was there for 3 nights) Finally there are cockroaches, I saw one on my last night in the room, I didnâ€™t say anything as my partner would have had a heart attack and I wanted a nights sleep. Teh fact the hotel knows and clearly have done nothign over a matter of weeks should tell yuo all you need to know. I read reviews the day before i went and was going to cancel but didn't. If you are in the same situation then cancel...trust me Donâ€™t stay here, itâ€™s dirty and infested

Reviews.Title: “So there we were, tuked up in bed, having nightmares about cockroaches when...”
Reviews.Author: puddinchops
Reviews.Content: Looking for a relaxing, cockroache free holiday in london?? Looking for a good nights sleep uninterrupted in london?? Well, whatever you do...on your life do not stay at this hotel. This has to be the worst experience I have ever had the misfortune of having. When we first arrived at the hotel it was raining, we were tired and I suppose we didnt have the energy to give a toss about the size of the room. Little did we know that this would be the least of our problems!!! We went for a nice meal in town and arrived back to the hotel at around 11 pm. We entered our room and there on our bed was the biggest cockroache I have ever seen. We eventually caught it and fecked it out the window. I went straight down to reception, where i informed them of the intruder. They acted like this had never happened before and that I was the first person ever to report. I was told that they would sort the probleme out in the morning when the room was serviced. We eventually went to sleep with one eye open incase we had any more visitors. Two nights later (just after 4am) I was tucked up in bed having nightmares about cockroaches when all of a sudden the bloody fire alarm goes off in the hotel. Me and my boyfriend jump up, quickly put our clothes on and run out of the room. I saw the nightporter at the end of the corridor and asked him where the fire was.
